Hawaiian Style Poke: Might have been the best Poke I've ever had! The addition of the seaweed salad and the octopus made it phenomenal. 

Kobe Beef Roll: Might have been my favorite unique dish of the night. The flavors were delicious and it was a nice alternative to traditional sushi rolls. 

Fire Cracker Balls:  Good, but I've had other fried sushi before and this was about on par. Would order again though. 

Butterfish Nigiri: Just because :) 

Not sure what the last roll was because I did not try it, but it was apparently good as well.  

Overall a great dining experience even though you should go into it knowing you will need to expect a wait!  Put your name down on the list and head across the street for a drink while you wait!

excerpts:
We especially enjoyed the following rolls:
- fire cracker balls
- dragon
- domo roll
- castro
- crunch california

P. S.
fire cracker balls.author: Lindsey O.
fire cracker balls.review:
How I dearly wish that Domo would take reservations!  My cousins, who grew up in Japan all their lives, and I went to this restaurant on a non-holiday Sunday night - wait was still 45 minutes long!  It was worth it, though, because I got to impress my 3 young tastebuds with one of the best Americanized sushi experiences :)  We made a point to only order rolls (for an obvious reason - the cousins get the real deal in Japan).  Wow, every roll was so well made!  Fresh ingredients and innovative construction.  We especially enjoyed the following rolls:
- fire cracker balls
- dragon
- domo roll
- castro
- crunch california

P. S. They offer iichiko hot sake, and I highly recommend it!  Such a smooth hot sake to go along with the meal!

excerpts: Fire cracker balls were delicious, as was the spicy hulk roll.
The other rolls we had were tasty too.
However, for the money spent, we were not satisfied with the portions.
Also, a couple of us weren't feeling great the next day - think we got some bad fish.
fire cracker balls.author: David H.
fire cracker balls.review: Sushi here was great. The restaurant is tiny and doesn't take reservations so it can be hard to get in. Server was nice, but the sushi chef was not. Fish tacos were delicious, loved the presentation with the tempura seaweed. Fire cracker balls were delicious, as was the spicy hulk roll. The other rolls we had were tasty too. However, for the money spent, we were not satisfied with the portions. Also, a couple of us weren't feeling great the next day - think we got some bad fish.

excerpts: A friend and I shared hamachi, the Domo roll and the Fire Cracker Balls which he had told me would change my life.
One bite of that fire cracker ball
and I knew I had an addiction.
The Domo roll is also now on my list of top favorite rolls ever.
fire cracker balls.author: Liz M.
fire cracker balls.review:
I have only been here once, but I seriously see no reason for giving this place anything less than 5 stars. It was INSANELY delicious. A friend and I shared hamachi, the Domo roll and the Fire Cracker Balls which he had told me would change my life. One bite of that fire cracker ball and I knew I had an addiction. The Domo roll is also now on my list of top favorite rolls ever. You should definitely order those two! 

I had hamachi at this super expensive snobby restaurant in Vegas and honestly, Domo's was just as melt-in-your-mouth-super-fresh delicious but at half the price. The prices at Domo are just right. You are eating super fresh yummy sushi in Hayes Valley, so it's not cheap, but it's not so expensive I consider it a splurge either. It's appropriately priced.

Domo is a small place so I wouldn't recommend bringing your whole posse here and yelling "SAKI BOMB!!!!!!!!!!", while twirling your shirt in the air. Bring a friend or two and enjoy the chill ambiance.

excerpts: The fire cracker balls were on fire and if that wasn't enough,  the setting was pretty romantic.
fire cracker balls.author: Rick O.
fire cracker balls.review: The sushi was fresh and delicious.  The fire cracker balls were on fire and if that wasn't enough,  the setting was pretty romantic.

excerpts: Their butter fish & fire cracker balls are my favorite, but pretty much everything is very tasty!
fire cracker balls.author: S V.
fire cracker balls.review: Domo is WONDERFUL! Sometimes there's a wait, but it's worth it. Cool little space with a couple tables outside. They always have super fresh fish, make sure you ask for/look at the specials. Their butter fish & fire cracker balls are my favorite, but pretty much everything is very tasty!

excerpts: We had the fire cracker balls ($10), the spider roll ($9), and the spicy hulk ($10).
The fire cracker balls were a flavor explosion (no pun intended)--crunchy and saucy with kick.
It was my pick of the three.
The spider was as good as any great one that I've had.
The parties on either side of us ordered the spicy hulk, so we did as well; the spicy tuna in it was delicious, but the ponzu sauce overpowered it sometimes.
fire cracker balls.author: Liz T.
fire cracker balls.review:
Domo is a sushi bar to return to.  Forget that it has 15 seats and doesn't take reservations--it's charming with specials handwritten on a mirror and cozy with views of either tree-lined Laguna Street or the sushi chefs hard at work.  The menu is big enough for classics and creativity, yet small enough to not be visually overwhelming. 

My boyfriend let me take the reigns with ordering and, of course, I went crazy.  We began with uni (sea urchin) and ankimo (monkfish liver) crudo (two for $6).  They were beautifully presented on soup spoons, and I couldn't help but compare them to the Spoonfuls of Happiness at Koo (http://www.yelp.com/biz/koo-san-francisco).  Although the crudo here was delicate in flavor and rich in texture, the Spoonfuls of Happiness there were a foodgasm in my mouth.  We also had the dynamite mussels (two for $6)--these were hot, juicy, and flavorful, though I'm still more crazy about the baked mussels at Sushi Zone (http://www.yelp.com/biz/sushi-zone-san-francisco).  

A sushi bar is only as good as its cuts of sashimi, so we had to have some of my favorites: hamachi (yellowtail) and sake (salmon) (5 pieces each for $10).  The hamachi was incredible--so fresh and so thick.  The sake would've been as enjoyable if it weren't so thin.  Where Domo shines, however, is the rolls.  We had the fire cracker balls ($10), the spider roll ($9), and the spicy hulk ($10).  The fire cracker balls were a flavor explosion (no pun intended)--crunchy and saucy with kick.  It was my pick of the three.  The spider was as good as any great one that I've had.  The parties on either side of us ordered the spicy hulk, so we did as well; the spicy tuna in it was delicious, but the ponzu sauce overpowered it sometimes. 

Although I've had better versions of the same things elsewhere, my collective experience at Domo was still nothing short of five stars.  Even with seven items, beer, and sake, the total bill was only $83 before tax and tip.  Yes, it isn't cheap but it's reasonable--the bites were well worth the dollars.

This was the perfect cap to our Sunday afternoon walk through Hayes Valley.  First, wine in the garden of Arlequin Cafe; next, macaroons at Chantal Guillon; then, we scored the last two open seats at Domo without having to wait.  Sometimes the best dates are the unplanned ones.

excerpts: We also had the fire cracker balls and temptation roll, both of which were good, but I don't think the fire cracker balls lived up to all the hype I saw in all the other reviews.
Next time I think I'll try coming around 5:30PM or 8PM
fire cracker balls.author: Shang S.
fire cracker balls.review:
SF has good sushi, so Domo has a lot of competition. Domo's sushi? Excellent, excellent! The wait? Terribly long - 45 minutes. I got some water while waiting, and if you don't mind the cold, you can sit outside. There is the regular menu, and there are also tons of specials. The pace of eating at this restaurant is unhurried in typical California style. 

The small crudos I think are one of the highlights here. We had the ankimo as well as the spicy tuna, both excellent, and down in one or two bites (though we shared)

We sat right at the counter and watched the chef personally craft each role. He was very nice and also told us quickly what wasn't available.

My favorite roll was actually a simple one - the salmon avocado and lemon. I liked the sweet tanginess the lemon lended to the roll. We also had the fire cracker balls and temptation roll, both of which were good, but I don't think the fire cracker balls lived up to all the hype I saw in all the other reviews. Next time I think I'll try coming around 5:30PM or 8PM

excerpts: Fire Cracker balls?
yes.
fire cracker balls.author: Darya T.
fire cracker balls.review:
I'm an L.A. resident, and I was visiting a friend in The City. We did wait a while for two open places at the Sushi Bar, and were starving when we sat down. The Sushi chef was intelligent, knowledgeable and full of good suggestions.
 
I seem to recall kickass Toro, which is one sign to me of a good Sushi place. They also offer Spanish style Crudo in little spoons; elegant and cool.

Domo roll? Yes. Fire Cracker balls? yes.

excerpts: we had Spicy Hulk (rolls), Domo, fire cracker balls and some crudos (uni, scallops and ankimo which were all excellent and fresh).
fire cracker balls.author: Sung C.
fire cracker balls.review:
awesome place for some innovative japanese rolls!

I haven't been a huge fan of rolls for, mainly, I didn't like that fact that they usually depend on sauce or rice, but oh boy this place made some pretty spectacular rolls which wowed all 3 of us.

we had Spicy Hulk (rolls), Domo, fire cracker balls and some crudos (uni, scallops and ankimo which were all excellent and fresh).

The bill was only 75 dollars with a glass of sake!  

The only problem was that it's such a small place and unless you get lucky you're more likely to wait for a long time to be seated. However we got to sit right away as we walked in!

excerpts: Fiesta Roll & Fire Cracker Balls..
DELICIOUS!
also would recommend the Crudos - but
they're bite sized so more of a novelty than filling.
fire cracker balls.author: Ketki W.
fire cracker balls.review: Fiesta Roll & Fire Cracker Balls..DELICIOUS! also would recommend the Crudos - but they're bite sized so more of a novelty than filling.

excerpts: Highly recommend the fish tacos, fire cracker balls, and pretty much whatever they have on special.
Small space so not the best place for big parties.
Just bar seating and one high-top table that will seat 4.
fire cracker balls.author: Jasmyn M.
fire cracker balls.review:
Where else can you get 8 pieces of sashimi for $12? It is also some of the best sashimi I've had in the city.

Definitely my go-to sushi place. Great, creative rolls. They pay attention to quality (and therefore they do not have 50 different rolls of various combinations of the same 3 types of fish). Sake selection is minimal but a "glass" is more like a "small jug" and thus well worth your purchase price. Highly recommend the fish tacos, fire cracker balls, and pretty much whatever they have on special. Small space so not the best place for big parties. Just bar seating and one high-top table that will seat 4.

excerpts: Fire Cracker Balls: crunchy, spicy, addicting
fire cracker balls.author: Mia L.
fire cracker balls.review:
I really liked Domo.  The sushi was fresh and flavorful.  The Ankimo (monkfish liver) was fresh and clean tasting, unlike most other places I've had it.  Other must tries:

Fire Cracker Balls: crunchy, spicy, addicting
Sexy Mama Roll: lemony fresh and tasty
Spicy Hulk Roll: wrapped in cucumber gives it awesome fresh flavor and texture
Hawaiian Style Tuna Poke: sooo yummy!

Overall definitely one of the better sushi bars in SF. Get there early, it's tiny and theres always a line.

excerpts: The Fire Cracker Balls and the Spicy Hulk is delicious.
All of the small crudos are incredible.
I love sushi, but this takes the cake!
fire cracker balls.author: Julia A.
fire cracker balls.review: This place is small but memorable.  Everything is fresh and presented beautifully.  The Fire Cracker Balls and the Spicy Hulk is delicious.  All of the small crudos are incredible.  I love sushi, but this takes the cake!

excerpts: We started with edamame which needed more salt, and then moved on to the Spicy Hulk, Fire Cracker Balls, and Domo specialty rolls.
The Spicy Hulk was the winner for uniqueness and freshness.
Still a little hungry -  three guys eating here
- we had a rock and roll to close out the meal and wash it all down with some Sapporos and sake.
fire cracker balls.author: Chad S.
fire cracker balls.review:
We had been eyeing Domo for months after moving to Hayes Valley and finally paid a visit when seeing that the usual crowd on the sidewalk was gone.  

Apparently, hosting is not the specialty of Domo and they insist on sitting every party over two people at the one table in the small restaurant.  We watched helplessly as several parties of two were sat at the bar and no urgency was on us taking bar seats.

After a long wait we finally sat at the one table.  The experience greatly improved as the food was delicious albeit overpriced.  We started with edamame which needed more salt, and then moved on to the Spicy Hulk, Fire Cracker Balls, and Domo specialty rolls.  The Spicy Hulk was the winner for uniqueness and freshness.  Still a little hungry -  three guys eating here - we had a rock and roll to close out the meal and wash it all down with some Sapporos and sake.  Each roll was fresh and nicely presented.

Overall, the place is somewhat pricey and needs to work on preparing itself for larger parties if it wants my business again.

excerpts: I had the sexy mama-dynamite roll, fire cracker balls were decent and tasty
the miso is ok
i

ve had better
sea weed salad
fire cracker balls.author: farah b.
fire cracker balls.review:
Got take out here-small place and I mean really small-take out took 20 min
not bad at all. 
Their sushi is small and a bit pricey. id eat there again only bc my friends live on the same block and they have a cute bar style eating area facing the street. very cute location and restaurant.
I had the sexy mama-dynamite roll, fire cracker balls were decent and tasty
the miso is ok ive had better
sea weed salad you cant go wrong with that.

very fresh sushi

excerpts: And the academy award goes to..... FIRE CRACKER BALLS!!
Let me tell you, we had no idea that this was the best dish in the house
and somehow we managed to save it for the finale and hot damn
it was so good!!!!
fire cracker balls.author: Hector G.
fire cracker balls.review:
We didn't even know this tiny little gem existed until we tried to have dinner past 10 PM in Hayes Valley. Sushi spot next to Patxi's, closed at 10, Patxi's closed at 10:30 and we walked in at 10:32, Flipper's Burgers closed at 10. It was one of those nights, until we walked a few blocks up the street and found Domo. It was about 10:40 and we could tell they all wanted to close up shop and go home (or to the bar more likely for some beverages and fun) but they were really cool about it. We sat down, ordered quickly and the food came out really fast. Miso soup was very tasty, sea weed salad was fresh and also very good. Then we started to get to the meat and potatoes, or freshly sliced fish and rice in this case. The Hamachi carpaccio was pretty good. It could have been seared less b/c it was a little more cooked than I liked, but hey, might plate was clean so who I am to nit pick we had another roll (forget the name) that was very fresh and really clean. And the academy award goes to..... FIRE CRACKER BALLS!! Let me tell you, we had no idea that this was the best dish in the house and somehow we managed to save it for the finale and hot damn it was so good!!!! A slightly crunchy texture, very fresh tuna and the unagi sauce was money MONEY!!!!! 

Not only was the food good but they stay open til 11 and didn't have a problem serving us just before closing, which really made our night b/c we were starving!! Borderline diamond in the rough.

excerpts: We ordered the Domo (because you have to order the roll they name after themselves) and the fire cracker balls.
fire cracker balls.author: T G.
fire cracker balls.review:
Domo was good. The place is very small. We were lucky to get two seats along the window but would have waited a while if those weren't free when we arrived. There is only one table, so this is not a place where you can easily eat and look at your dinner partner. 

The sushi is good. We ordered the Domo (because you have to order the roll they name after themselves) and the fire cracker balls. Both were good and a bit indulgent. 

The reason for the three stars is that we left smelling horribly. There must be bad ventilation in the restaurant because we wreaked of oil and "kitchen" smell -- even the next morning I think I still smell. Eww.

I recommend coming here for takeout, but I won't got back and eat in the restaurant.

excerpts: I got their fire cracker balls and domo roll, which were good, but a little overdone in terms of sauce and such for me.
fire cracker balls.author: Kristine B.
fire cracker balls.review:
It is a solid sushi joint.  I would come here again, just not anytime soon given the plethora of sushi options in the city that I would like to try first.  

Bf got a $60 omakaze which was fresh, delicious and creative.  Def got $60 or more worth of deliciousness.

I got their fire cracker balls and domo roll, which were good, but a little overdone in terms of sauce and such for me.  I prefer the more simple maki sushi.

When I come back, I'll be ordering the omakaze.  Skip the overly ornate maki sushi and order the more simple things in life.

excerpts: I had the fire cracker balls -to die for and trust me
I like some good balls in my mouth
And the prices were very fair - $9 for the fire cracker balls (again so good) and $4 for the sweet potato roll (also delic).
I would def go there again!
fire cracker balls.author: Ka C.
fire cracker balls.review:
SOOO YUMMIE!!! I had the fire cracker balls -to die for and trust me I like some good balls in my mouth but these were exceptional! 

Only lost a star because of the size, very intimate good for a date or small party (3 or less). Lovely relaxing atmosphere and good music. 

Service was wonderful. We had the only table in the place and they didn't rush us at all, even when another party of 4 came through the door. 

And the prices were very fair - $9 for the fire cracker balls (again so good) and $4 for the sweet potato roll (also delic). I would def go there again!

excerpts: We also ordered the fire cracker balls that are so popular on Yelp, and while I normally don't like my sushi fried, these were an exception since the spicy tuna came through with a fun crunch and the plate was presented beautifully.
fire cracker balls.author: Nicole G.
fire cracker balls.review:
Domo is one of the cutest little sushi restaurants out there. I think it seats about 15 people total, and it's always packed with my hayes valley brethren, watching passers by from their big windows overlooking Laguna. It's just made for intimate conversation between friends or lovers.

The sushi itself was great, but not superior. I'm a big hunks-o-raw-fish sushi kind of gal, so of course my favorite is always the sashimi. We ordered the sampler to get a little taste of everything. They didn't have butterfish, but the albacore was absolutely melt in your mouth orgasmic heaven.

I was excited to see they had crudo on the menu, but to my disappointment, the fish was mashed into a spoon and not altogether innovative in its preparation. I much prefer crudo served as fresh sashimi, and I think they could get a little more creative with their flavor combos.

We also ordered the fire cracker balls that are so popular on Yelp, and while I normally don't like my sushi fried, these were an exception since the spicy tuna came through with a fun crunch and the plate was presented beautifully.

Oh, did I mention I came here AFTER consuming 12 dozen wings at the Yelp all-you-can-eat night at Double Decker? That's how I roll.

excerpts: The fire cracker balls were very good.
Actually, all of the rolls we had were delicious.
I think there was a sexy mamma roll on there, too.
Hard to choose a favorite.
fire cracker balls.author: Heidi L.
fire cracker balls.review:
One of the best sushi places I've been to. The sushi was fun, tasty, and surprising. The fire cracker balls were very good. Actually, all of the rolls we had were delicious. I think there was a sexy mamma roll on there, too. Hard to choose a favorite. Can't wait to go back!

The restaurant is small. I wonder if they could fit more than 10 people in at a time. But totally worth trying.

excerpts: Got an Orion (actually imported from Japan, unlike Sapporo which is from Canada), Rock N Roll, Fire Cracker Balls, and some salmon/avo/lemon rolls.
All were done well, and I thought price was fair.
Firecracker thing was good, but definitely pushing the notion of sushi.
You basically can't tell any fish is inside.
Bathroom was very clean and had good quality paper towels and a nice sink.
fire cracker balls.author: Marc S.
fire cracker balls.review: Monday night around 7 and it wasn't too crowded.  Got an Orion (actually imported from Japan, unlike Sapporo which is from Canada), Rock N Roll, Fire Cracker Balls, and some salmon/avo/lemon rolls.  All were done well, and I thought price was fair.  Firecracker thing was good, but definitely pushing the notion of sushi.  You basically can't tell any fish is inside.  Bathroom was very clean and had good quality paper towels and a nice sink.

excerpts: FIRE CRACKER BALLS.
Think about the goodness that those three little words could implicate and throw that into delicious sushi popcorn bites.
YUUUUM!
They're not tiny, but their small enough where you don't have to look like a hamster while munching on them.
And, don't worry
- you get more than 6 pieces.
The presentation and sauce are perfection on a platter.
This is the only thing I had
fire cracker balls.author: Courtney C.
fire cracker balls.review:
FIRE CRACKER BALLS. Think about the goodness that those three little words could implicate and throw that into delicious sushi popcorn bites. YUUUUM! They're not tiny, but their small enough where you don't have to look like a hamster while munching on them. And, don't worry - you get more than 6 pieces. The presentation and sauce are perfection on a platter. This is the only thing I had cuz my friends only wanted 1 roll to themselves, and I didn't wanna seem like a fatty and order more, but I'd DEFINITELY come back to try the others rolls. 

1 less star for the following reasons: 

The place is small - all seating is bar-style, so don't come w/ a large group. Parking looks like a nightmare - but we walked over from our office. What we ended up shelling out was a bit more than I care to spend for lunch, but it was a special occasion. 

The staff seemed cool... quiet. One of them referred us to the Mediterranean corner market down the street for some delicious ice cream for dessert.  All in all, good experience, and I'm definitely coming back for 2nds... 3rds... you get the picture.

excerpts:
We had the following:
fire cracker balls-AWESOME
spicy

hulk-Very GOOD
spider-GOOD
spicy tuna-good
but i didn't expect it to be deep fried.
I'm not a fan of fried rolls...
fire cracker balls.author: Lizete S.
fire cracker balls.review:
We came here for dinner on Sunday and had a great meal.  The restaurant is small but had a nice interior. The service was attentive.  We sat in front of the sushi chef and saw him prepare the rolls which is always a treat.
We ordered some sake and beer to drink while we waited for our rolls.   Our food came out quickly even though the restaurant was full. 
We had the following:
fire cracker balls-AWESOME
spicy hulk-Very GOOD
spider-GOOD
spicy tuna-good but i didn't expect it to be deep fried.  I'm not a fan of fried rolls... I guess it was my mistake since I overlooked that.

We definitely will return to try other items on the menu.

excerpts: We ordered edamame(sp), seaweed salad, the spicy hulk, the fire cracker balls, and the crispy cali rolls.
Um, Umm, Ummm, UMMMM, UMmmm...
I like the fire cracker balls more the the crispy cali...
You are tiny, You food is just the right size and best of all, you are speedy... and even more best of all, all that food came out to 40 bucks...
That's pretty good compared to some other places.
I will definitely come back again.
I had a dantastic time here!
fire cracker balls.author: danny e.
fire cracker balls.review:
mercie beaucoup monsieur robot!

I don't really want to give you 5 stars... I really really really want something to be wrong with you... Why? Because I am a bastard. 

We strolled in at mid 7pm's, and you sat us right in front, the nice long counter at the window gave me so much to look at. Your lights are simply cool. The "votive"s you have as old salt shakers... neat! The dishes were even simply cool,I especially like the little water jug you gave us, Why? I don't know.  

We ordered edamame(sp), seaweed salad, the spicy hulk, the fire cracker balls, and the crispy cali rolls. Um, Umm, Ummm, UMMMM, UMmmm... I like the fire cracker balls more the the crispy cali... You are tiny, You food is just the right size and best of all, you are speedy... and even more best of all, all that food came out to 40 bucks... That's pretty good compared to some other places. I will definitely come back again. I had a dantastic time here!

excerpts: She wanted the Fire Cracker Balls (spicy tuna roll with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, scallions & tobiko).
fire cracker balls.author: Jason B.
fire cracker balls.review:
She wanted the Fire Cracker Balls (spicy tuna roll with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, scallions & tobiko).

He wanted the Sexy Mama (asparagus, tobiko topped with sliced lemon & salmon, yuzu cucumber). 

We both wanted the Domo Roll (baked california roll topped with salmon & scallops with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, tobiko & scallions).

Everything was absolutely delicious, and I'm still thinking about the brilliant pop of lemon in the Sexy Mama.

Equally impressive was the Kobe beef roll. We didn't actually order it, but watched in awe as the chef cooked the beef with a propane torch. It was so very, very awesome, and so very, very on our items to order next time.

Service and decor were the perfect mix of friendly, inviting, warm, modern, subtle, sophisticated. All comes without breaking the bank - a reasonable bill became a steal after learning the salad and edamame were on the house. 

Go and enjoy.

excerpts: There were lots of interesting rolls (like the fire cracker balls, a must) and old standbys like their delicious salmon skin roll that made the entire experience a great one.
fire cracker balls.author: Jeff G.
fire cracker balls.review:
I gave Domo five stars not because it was the best sushi I've had in the city, but more because for what it was it was fantastic. And maybe the second best sushi I've had in the city.


My roommate loves this place, says the sushi chef is "cool" and "loves whiskey" so I was sold. Walking in there was great because it reminded me of what I love about good Sushi places, where the bar is the centerpiece and best seat in the house. The second thing that told me I was in for a treat was the specials -- Toro, Aji, and Hamachi neck (a first for me) among others which demonstrate the chef's willingness to pick up exotic yet delicious fish which a place like Sushi Rock may avoid.

Needless to say, the fish was all great. Very fresh, not horribly expensive (Sebo anyone?) and well presented. There were lots of interesting rolls (like the fire cracker balls, a must) and old standbys like their delicious salmon skin roll that made the entire experience a great one. 

For the record, we went at 6:30 and it was empty. We got some one on one with the chef, and the food came out quick. Later on around 7:30 was when it really started to pack in, so I highly recommend getting there a little earlier than usual to avoid a wait. 

Five stars for a classy joint like this one, with great fish, a great atmosphere and great prices.

excerpts: we had the seaweed salad, the domo roll, the salmon skin, the fire cracker balls (not as spicy as you'd think, which is a good thing), the kobe beef, and one more that i can't remember.
all tasted incredibly fresh (i don't know sushi very well, but you could just tell).
the main reason i'm not giving it five stars is that there was a slight overwhelming taste to everything.
for most of the dishes, it was salty.
for one of the rolls (again, forgot which :( ), it was too cilantro-y.
fire cracker balls.author: Jonathan K.
fire cracker balls.review:
one of the best sushi places i've been to -- and also one of the smallest (the bathroom is almost the same size as the restaurant). all bar seating (either at the sushi bar or facing the plate glass window that looks out onto the street.)

came here with a friend who had passed by but never been, and well, that was my first time really in hayes valley (what a cute area!). they have a good variety of rolls (nearing the point of overwhelming, but only because they all sound so good!) and they are priced well for the portion size you get. 

we had the seaweed salad, the domo roll, the salmon skin, the fire cracker balls (not as spicy as you'd think, which is a good thing), the kobe beef, and one more that i can't remember. all tasted incredibly fresh (i don't know sushi very well, but you could just tell). the main reason i'm not giving it five stars is that there was a slight overwhelming taste to everything. for most of the dishes, it was salty. for one of the rolls (again, forgot which :( ), it was too cilantro-y. i'm thinking it was just me, though, as just thinking about these again, i'm salivating (and not because i'm imagining salt!).

that said, however, i would gladly go again -- and go out of my way to go again. service was excellent (maybe because we got there at 5:30) and fast. very cute, warm space.

excerpts: My friends and I also tried a few rolls: fire cracker balls and sexy mama.
The fire crackers balls had a great crunch and if you like spicy, this should satisfy.
The sexy mama roll was different than I expected - very refreshing.
The crunch of the asparagus was great, but finished off with the yuzu cucumber and lemon slice, it was definitely something unexpected.
I finished off my meal with some black sesame ice cream.
fire cracker balls.author: Daphne R.
fire cracker balls.review:
Stopped by this Hayes Valley spot for dinner tonight. I was pleasantly surprised to see the sushi chefs behind the counter were actually Japanese. So rare to find nowadays. I sat with friends behind the counter that was looking out onto the street which was comfy for people gazing. 

To start, I ordered the Uni and Scallop crudos (choose two for $6). Both were good, but I thought the avocado on the uni competed a bit too much for my attention. I would have liked to have been able to taste the uni more. I also tried the inari nigiri and the ajitsuke hotate nigiri off the specials menu. If you like scallop, I would definitely recommend the ajitsuke hotate. It was really yummy.  My friends and I also tried a few rolls: fire cracker balls and sexy mama. The fire crackers balls had a great crunch and if you like spicy, this should satisfy. The sexy mama roll was different than I expected - very refreshing. The crunch of the asparagus was great, but finished off with the yuzu cucumber and lemon slice, it was definitely something unexpected. I finished off my meal with some black sesame ice cream. Nothing too special, but definitely different if you want to veer off the usual green tea ice cream path.

All in all, the food was reasonably priced, tasted good, and the atmosphere was comfy and relaxing. This is a great neighborhood spot.

excerpts: I'm not a fan of the Fire Cracker Balls that most people like though.
It's nothing special.
Oh, and one time, they served me my miso soup with a spoon in it!!!
What?
Miso soup with a spoon?
That's definitely NOT Japanese, and it threw me off a bit.
But no worries, I just took out the spoon and proceeded to drink my soup from the bowl-the way it's supposed to!
All in all, I still love this place.
Mostly for the casual but charming atmosphere.
That's important too when evaluating restaurants, right?
fire cracker balls.author: Selena L.
fire cracker balls.review:
I've been to this place many times. It's now my de facto neighborhood sushi place to go to whenever I want decent sushi and don't want to leave the hood. 

This is a tiny place (there are only about 20 seats total) and it's all bar seating. Tiny as it is, it's very comfortable and intimate. The low lighting and unobtrusive service make it a perfect place to have a great meal and catch up with a good friend. I've noticed that most of the people here are neighborhood peeps. Some come with their date or one other friend (due to the seating arrangements) and get lost in their own world and conversation. Very charming. 

I'm a little bit of a sushi/sashimi snob, so I'll have to say that the fish is fresh enough, though definitely not the top grade kind of fish served by the truly authentic Japanese restaurants who buy their fish from the markets in Japan. That said, it's still definitely good. Ive had their kampachi cappachio, all the crudos (salmon, spicy tuna, scallops, uni, etc), all the sashimis (standard fare of salmon, maguro, hamachi and albacore) and they are all good. I'm not a fan of the Fire Cracker Balls that most people like though. It's nothing special. Oh, and one time, they served me my miso soup with a spoon in it!!! What? Miso soup with a spoon? That's definitely NOT Japanese, and it threw me off a bit. But no worries, I just took out the spoon and proceeded to drink my soup from the bowl-the way it's supposed to! All in all, I still love this place. Mostly for the casual but charming atmosphere. That's important too when evaluating restaurants, right?

excerpts: I love the fire cracker balls!
The chefs are really nice too!
fire cracker balls.author: Laura H.
fire cracker balls.review: Love this place!  The food and service are great here!  I love the fire cracker balls!  The chefs are really nice too!

excerpts: spicy hulk, Fire Cracker Balls, kobe beef roll..
fire cracker balls.author: amit s.
fire cracker balls.review: my recommendations. spicy hulk, Fire Cracker Balls, kobe beef roll..

excerpts: The spicy hulk roll was pretty refreshing but other than that nothing stood out to me food-wise.
The service was very friendly though.
spicy hulk.author: Menana B.
spicy hulk.review: Unimpressive. The spicy hulk roll was pretty refreshing but other than that nothing stood out to me food-wise. The service was very friendly though.

excerpts: We had the firecracker balls, the spicy hulk, and the red dragon roll for our entrees and the chicken karage as an appetizer.
The spicy hulk is good, if you're into raw fish.
It's just fish wrapped in cucumber with pieces of avocado in the middle and no rice.
spicy hulk.author: My N.
spicy hulk.review:
Hayes valley is such a nice area to walk around and do a little bit of shopping so we decided to do that before having sushi for dinner. 

Domo is definitely affordable. Each specialty roll costs about $9-15 which is average in most places and cheap in San Francisco. The place was super quaint and didn't have a large number of seats but a counter spot facing the street was still perfect. We had the firecracker balls, the spicy hulk, and the red dragon roll for our entrees and the chicken karage as an appetizer. 

The firecracker balls are highly recommended - it has a fishy eel taste to it but came out super hot and crispy so you barely taste the fishiness. The sauces for the roll was also a wonderful mixture of flavor. 

The spicy hulk is good, if you're into raw fish. It's just fish wrapped in cucumber with pieces of avocado in the middle and no rice. The sauce for that is spicy and quite heavenly as well. 

The red dragon roll is a typical spicy tuna roll, it was delicious but not anything out of the norm. 

Last but not least, the chicken karage. It was a rather large portion for $7 and was super crispy! We had to ask for rice though since chicken karage is salty in nature. 

Overall a wonderful experience and we'd definitely come back again.

excerpts: We tried 4 rolls, the crunchy California, the domo roll, the Kobe beef roll and the spicy hulk, all 4 were delicious!
The rolls are very authentic and fresh!
Also service was fast and friendly.
Next time I'm in the city I would defiantly like to come back!
spicy hulk.author: Brittany Y.
spicy hulk.review: Found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try, came here with my dad. We tried 4 rolls, the crunchy California, the domo roll, the Kobe beef roll and the spicy hulk, all 4 were delicious! The rolls are very authentic and fresh! Also service was fast and friendly. Next time I'm in the city I would defiantly like to come back!

excerpts: The Spicy Hulk is a Gluten Free roll with spicy tuna and cucumber wrap.
These two were probably my favorite out of the five rolls we tried.
spicy hulk.author: Tamara S.
spicy hulk.review:
This review has three stars for a few reasons. 
1. The disastrous Kobe beef roll
2. The wait

Do NOT get the Kobe Beef roll. We tried it out of pure curiosity and didn't eat any more than the initial piece we first tried. The idea behind this roll is unique but the execution is a disaster. The beef is chewy beyond belief and overall flavorless. The inside is just avocado and another veggie, while the kobe beef wraps around it like nori. NOT tasty. Not worth it. 

The wait is 30 min - 1 hr on weekends at dinner time. Not the worst but I now feel like it's not totally worth the wait due to the Kobe beef roll partially (I'm just weirdly offended by it) and nothing incredible about the sushi that stood out to me otherwise. And with sushi restaurant prices- you want something to stand out. 

Pros:

The Domo roll is a hot roll with salmon that is super tasty. The Spicy Hulk is a Gluten Free roll with spicy tuna and cucumber wrap. These two were probably my favorite out of the five rolls we tried. Both had really great flavors and textures. 


Overall I wouldn't be excited to go back here, but good flavor and nice atmosphere.

excerpts:
Uni and Scallop crudos
Hamachi Carpaccio
Spicy Hulk roll
spicy hulk.author: Dawne L.
spicy hulk.review:
This is our fave sushi spot in Hayes Valley.  It's a small hole-in-a-wall that's popular with the locals so it gets full quickly.

They don't have a large selection, but their menu is pretty diverse.  The sashimi and nigiri are always fresh and light, with a melt-in-your-mouth consistency.  Also try their appetizers and crudos -- which include both conventional and innovative selections.  

Recommended:
"Chef's seasonal choice" sashimi
Fish Tacos!!!  (this is one of their popular dishes for very good reason!)
Uni and Scallop crudos
Hamachi Carpaccio
Spicy Hulk roll

excerpts: I loved the Spicy Hulk, which is spicy tuna wrapped in cucumber instead of rice.
spicy hulk.author: Rose A.
spicy hulk.review:
4.5 Stars

Don't expect to come here with a large group.  Due to its size, I would say this is more of a place to spend some QT with a loved one or catch up with a friend.

The food is pretty gosh darn delicious.  I was a bit disappointed that they did not have the uni crudo but the scallop & salmon crudo pretty much made up for it.  The Fire Cracker Balls had a good combination of crunchy, creamy & spicy. I loved the Spicy Hulk, which is spicy tuna wrapped in cucumber instead of rice.

I would definitely go back.  Especially to try that uni crudo...

excerpts: Spicy Hulk--tuna inside a cucumber wrap.
spicy hulk.author: Jessica T.
spicy hulk.review:
Domo is something different than what I normally eat.  My friends and I chose this place because another sushi place was too packed so I didn't read the full details before coming here.  The place was really small and cute.  My friends and I were the first group there for dinner.

We ordered the following:

Hawaiian Style Tuna Poke--pretty good but nothing too special.  They just mixed tuna and wakame and topped it with tako.

Crudos--Salmon & Scallops.  They were both delicious. It's probably my favorite dish ordered.  They are in spoons and it's like drinking a shooter.

Sake Nigiri--nothing too special. It was a lot smaller than I expected but still good.

Rock & Roll--unagi and avocado roll.  The ratio of avocado to unagi was 2:1. I like avocado though so thought the roll was good.

Fire Cracker Balls--These came out very small.  It just tasted like deep fried rice balls topped with their sauces.

Spicy Hulk--tuna inside a cucumber wrap. Good but probably wouldn't order it again.

The owner was very nice to us and constantly checked up on us.  This place can be pricey if you're looking to leave full.  I had to order more food because I was not full and no where near satisfied.

I would recommend this place as a place to try at least once.

excerpts: Unique dishes and combinations, excellent balance in taste and texture, ie the fish taco and spicy hulk.
Also tried the Saba Hit who has hints of plum flavor in it.
It is unfortunate that the store is so small and the wait can be as long as an hour on a Friday night at 9pm.
That's the only reason for the minus one star.
Will definitely go back, maybe get some happy hour snacks before heading over there at 8pm next time!
spicy hulk.author: Angela Y.
spicy hulk.review:
Amazing fusion Japanese! Yes, it's probably not the most "authentic" Japanese sushi and you may find better ones in more Japanese area. But this is a very unique and sincere fusion Japanese shop. Unique dishes and combinations, excellent balance in taste and texture, ie the fish taco and spicy hulk. Also tried the Saba Hit who has hints of plum flavor in it. 
It is unfortunate that the store is so small and the wait can be as long as an hour on a Friday night at 9pm. That's the only reason for the minus one star. 
Will definitely go back, maybe get some happy hour snacks before heading over there at 8pm next time!

excerpts: The Spicy Hulk - with spicy tuna, avo, and ponzu wrapped up in cucumber.
This is a nice change from the heavy rice in most rolls.
spicy hulk.author: Jocelyn B.
spicy hulk.review:
Domo arigato!

Domo has indefinitely claimed the rights to my favorite place to find fresh fish and creative rolls. We ordered "omakase" (chef's choice) and this is why we got to try a little bit of everything that makes Domo so special.

The Spicy Hulk - with spicy tuna, avo, and ponzu wrapped up in cucumber. This is a nice change from the heavy rice in most rolls. The texture is an interesting element and the plate a beautiful piece of art. 

The Kobe Beef roll with asparagus, ginger, avacado, ponzu was also an interesting flavor/texture. The Fish Taco, nori tempura fried with fresh sashimi and homemade pepper salsa - delicious! A must order.

It seems that Domo does really well creatively. Both the design of the dish and the presentation are flawless. Its easy to bring friends here and be assured that everyone will find something they enjoy.

but....fresh fish- Thats what I really come to places like this for. I want sashimi, I want nigiri. Omakase gifted our taste-buds with so many cuts of beautifully colored fish. *happy happy girl* The Sunazuri (hamachi belly) is my favorite.

excerpts: Walu, Hamachi, Albacore, Saba (THE FRESHEST and luved the fried fish head/bone presentation), Spicy Hulk (Yummmmy cucumber/tuna), Sexy Mama (my fav of the hour), Wagyu beef roll, and the hamachi/tuna/avacado tacos.
SUUUPERB!
spicy hulk.author: Vee V.
spicy hulk.review:
This started out as a TWO star review but it went back up! Hear me out...

Came here last night, for the first time, at 7pm. Long line (no problem), waited about an hour, while we scouted the menu and specials on the mirror so we knew exactly what to order when ready. Then sadness arrived...all I heard was the waiter saying "don't hate me, you're gonna hate me" because "we are out of Uni, Ankimo, Amaebi, etc..." The sudden rush of I wanna leave right now flashes before my eyes...but we decided to give it a chance. Ok, the food is YUM YUM and the presentation is gorge so what can I say. They gave us the "we just re-opened after ten days of vacation"...we softy!

We ordered almost everything else other than our favorites (above). Walu, Hamachi, Albacore, Saba (THE FRESHEST and luved the fried fish head/bone presentation), Spicy Hulk (Yummmmy cucumber/tuna), Sexy Mama (my fav of the hour), Wagyu beef roll, and the hamachi/tuna/avacado tacos. SUUUPERB!

excerpts: I would skip the spicy hulk tuna not that it was bad just not my favorite!
I can't wait to go back!
spicy hulk.author: Melisa O.
spicy hulk.review: Damn good place! Small spot so only go with one person. Everything we ordered was fresh & yummy! I would skip the spicy hulk tuna not that it was bad just not my favorite! I can't wait to go back!

excerpts: We also ordered the Spicy Hulk.
Man.
Unbelievably fantasmic.
Great for spicy lovers, which I am famous for, wonderful for tuna lovers, which I am not.
spicy hulk.author: Sharon B.
spicy hulk.review:
Uh....dang.

 I have NEVER in my life had sushi this delectable and dreamy. The fish is really fresh and the rolls are just amazing. I want to say awesome, but the word is just too plain in comparison to what the sushi actually is. 

For starters, I ordered two orders of uni. So dang fresh, I closed my eyes and had dreams of ocean living. My husband, on the other hand, liked watching me.

The place is small and crowded- elbow to elbow crowded. While waiting for seats, my husband (oh yay, I can actually say that now!) and I met a really cool couple, whom we ended up buying their desserts cause they were just that awesome, or it could have been the sake that I was feelin while I was waiting as well. 

Let's get back to the nitty gritty. The sushi was amazing. We ordered the Domo roll, which was a crazy roll that was california roll with scallops and salmon or hamachi and some other stuff I can't even remember right now, but damn, that roll was made up from some crazy imagination, it was HELLA GOOD. The sauce was somewhat garlicky, which I believe was the magic of it all. Mmm. I'm dreaming of it right now.

We also ordered the Spicy Hulk. Man. Unbelievably fantasmic. Great for spicy lovers, which I am famous for, wonderful for tuna lovers, which I am not. So it says A WHOLE LOTTA SOMETHING.

The reason why I'm not giving it 5 stars is because when we ordered mochi for dessert, please tell me why my husband saw them pull individual mochi balls from the box of 6 that I can buy at Pacific Super for $4.59 and then get charged $3 per ball on a fancy little dish with acrab fork? Everyone who eats this mochi ball knows we don't need utensils!!! BOO!

I'm coming back! But not order mochi. I'll just bring it in my purse, just to be ghetto.

excerpts: Spicy Hulk (spicy tuna & avocado, tobiko wrapped in a cucumber sheet with lemon ponzu):

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xeRy4mjZWczet5V9Jtmx1g?select=tDIlLytWufqR3wrHTRlKZQ
+
spicy hulk.author: Evelyn S.
spicy hulk.review:
Don't come if you're looking for traditional sushi. 
Come here if you're looking for fun, unique rolls!

1. Spicy Hulk (spicy tuna & avocado, tobiko wrapped in a cucumber sheet with lemon ponzu): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xeRy4mjZWczet5V9Jtmx1g?select=tDIlLytWufqR3wrHTRlKZQ
+ Refreshing with the cucumber sheet
+ Very light with the ponzu sauce
- Tuna quality was so-so and not too spicy

2. Kobe Beef (asparagus, ginger, avacado, ponzu & seared american kobe beef outside): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xeRy4mjZWczet5V9Jtmx1g?select=1EJ0Bm8dsIVLMfIoC7zM6w
+ Beef was extremely tender, and soft
- Too oily on the bottom

3. Special: Apollo (avocado, cucumber, shiso roll topped with baked scallops, crab, and tobiko): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xeRy4mjZWczet5V9Jtmx1g?select=zEqaJY3rgbWqp_hJ2vY1Kg
- Nothing special -- too many together, wasn't really able to taste individual components

4. Sashimi (3 pieces of tuna, yellowtail, salmon, albacore): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xeRy4mjZWczet5V9Jtmx1g?select=Z81nMnJn36N8iWsnwfi7KA
- NOT WORTH IT AT ALL. Sashimi pieces were of poor quality. Didn't taste fresh (had that mushy texture)

Overall, sushi was just unique, but not the best quality. A bit expensive for not a lot of pieces per roll.

BEST PART: The bathroom was extremely modern, cute, and most importantly...clean!

Tips:
1. VERY SMALL - not good for big parties!
2. Sign your name on the board in the front
3. Park on the side streets around it -- free metered parking after 6!

excerpts: Had the Spicy Hulk
- it was refreshingly not overly spiced up.
I was still able to taste the freshness of the fish.
spicy hulk.author: Paulyne R.
spicy hulk.review:
If you go to Domo expecting a traditional sushi experience, you might be disappointed. This is a Fusion project and it should be appreciated as such.

Had the Spicy Hulk - it was refreshingly not overly spiced up. I was still able to taste the freshness of the fish. Clearly, it wasn't some old/frozen tuna disguised as an innovative dish.

Had some hamachi toro. Yumm. You can never go wrong with that... Until you see hamachi belly nigiri right before you write a review. Ugh.

Fish tacos - real interesting layers of flavor. Tasty. And difficult to eat (that may be just me). Slightly greasy from the fried base.

Albacore toro. - fresh, so as expected it was good.

Madagascar something-something. Hmmm. My first time to eat raw shrimp. It tasted cooked, but it the texture was a little chewy from the rawness. It didn't taste gross, try it.

My regret was not getting anything omakase, whether it was nigiris or sushi. Go for it!

Missing a star because I felt like the dishes were missing their oooomph. However the service was awesome, kudos!

excerpts: Fire cracker balls were delicious, as was the spicy hulk roll.
The other rolls we had were tasty too.
However, for the money spent, we were not satisfied with the portions.
Also, a couple of us weren't feeling great the next day - think we got some bad fish.
spicy hulk.author: David H.
spicy hulk.review: Sushi here was great. The restaurant is tiny and doesn't take reservations so it can be hard to get in. Server was nice, but the sushi chef was not. Fish tacos were delicious, loved the presentation with the tempura seaweed. Fire cracker balls were delicious, as was the spicy hulk roll. The other rolls we had were tasty too. However, for the money spent, we were not satisfied with the portions. Also, a couple of us weren't feeling great the next day - think we got some bad fish.

excerpts: The Domo roll was by far the best that we tried but the spicy hulk looked good with cucumber as well.
It would be nice if they had sake cocktails and some heat lamps for the outside seating at night.
spicy hulk.author: Jing L.
spicy hulk.review: Good sushi with a limited menu. The Domo roll was by far the best that we tried but the spicy hulk looked good with cucumber as well. It would be nice if they had sake cocktails and some heat lamps for the outside seating at night.

excerpts:
Excellent appetizer, very fresh and tastes great
Spicy Hulk: MUST TRY - really different and tastes excellent, specially if you want a roll without rice.
spicy hulk.author: Ed R.
spicy hulk.review:
I am a fan now - the service was quick and excellent and the food was very good. 
Kobe: Excellent appetizer, very fresh and tastes great
Spicy Hulk: MUST TRY - really different and tastes excellent, specially if you want a roll without rice. 
My Friend tried the Temptation and she said it is a MUST Try as well. 

I will definitely go back... 

Note: place is small and not fit for large groups - they only have one table of 4 and the rest is a bar seating.

excerpts: walu, hamachi, toro, albacore, saba, spicy hulk roll, wagyu beef roll, sexy mama roll, and fish tacos...
ALL was just a orgasmn to my taste buds~!
However, due to the fact that they didn't have some of the most simple (yet important items) of a sushi spot...I was still going to give them at most a
3-star.
But then....the waiter came to us and apologized about all the items they couldn't serve to us due to them being closed for ten days for the holidays and
this was their first day of re-opening.
I then sharply responded "OK...now I forgive you guys"
spicy hulk.author: Patrick C.
spicy hulk.review:
No Uni, no Ankimo, no special jelly fish, no special Madagascar Amaebi that is on their specials board.  FAIL!!  Started to Yelp this on my i-phone and saved as a two star review just for this.  So why did I give them a 4-star??...

Came here with no reservations (as you can't make none at this small 10-14 seater place)....waited an hour for table for two.  NONE of what I had mentioned above so had to order others....walu, hamachi, toro, albacore, saba, spicy hulk roll, wagyu beef roll, sexy mama roll, and fish tacos...ALL was just a orgasmn to my taste buds~!  However, due to the fact that they didn't have some of the most simple (yet important items) of a sushi spot...I was still going to give them at most a 3-star.  But then....the waiter came to us and apologized about all the items they couldn't serve to us due to them being closed for ten days for the holidays and this was their first day of re-opening.  I then sharply responded "OK...now I forgive you guys"

excerpts: We had the fire cracker balls ($10), the spider roll ($9), and the spicy hulk ($10).
The fire cracker balls were a flavor explosion (no pun intended)--crunchy and saucy with kick.
It was my pick of the three.
The spider was as good as any great one that I've had.
The parties on either side of us ordered the spicy hulk, so we did as well; the spicy tuna in it was delicious, but the ponzu sauce overpowered it sometimes.
spicy hulk.author: Liz T.
spicy hulk.review:
Domo is a sushi bar to return to.  Forget that it has 15 seats and doesn't take reservations--it's charming with specials handwritten on a mirror and cozy with views of either tree-lined Laguna Street or the sushi chefs hard at work.  The menu is big enough for classics and creativity, yet small enough to not be visually overwhelming. 

My boyfriend let me take the reigns with ordering and, of course, I went crazy.  We began with uni (sea urchin) and ankimo (monkfish liver) crudo (two for $6).  They were beautifully presented on soup spoons, and I couldn't help but compare them to the Spoonfuls of Happiness at Koo (http://www.yelp.com/biz/koo-san-francisco).  Although the crudo here was delicate in flavor and rich in texture, the Spoonfuls of Happiness there were a foodgasm in my mouth.  We also had the dynamite mussels (two for $6)--these were hot, juicy, and flavorful, though I'm still more crazy about the baked mussels at Sushi Zone (http://www.yelp.com/biz/sushi-zone-san-francisco).  

A sushi bar is only as good as its cuts of sashimi, so we had to have some of my favorites: hamachi (yellowtail) and sake (salmon) (5 pieces each for $10).  The hamachi was incredible--so fresh and so thick.  The sake would've been as enjoyable if it weren't so thin.  Where Domo shines, however, is the rolls.  We had the fire cracker balls ($10), the spider roll ($9), and the spicy hulk ($10).  The fire cracker balls were a flavor explosion (no pun intended)--crunchy and saucy with kick.  It was my pick of the three.  The spider was as good as any great one that I've had.  The parties on either side of us ordered the spicy hulk, so we did as well; the spicy tuna in it was delicious, but the ponzu sauce overpowered it sometimes. 

Although I've had better versions of the same things elsewhere, my collective experience at Domo was still nothing short of five stars.  Even with seven items, beer, and sake, the total bill was only $83 before tax and tip.  Yes, it isn't cheap but it's reasonable--the bites were well worth the dollars.

This was the perfect cap to our Sunday afternoon walk through Hayes Valley.  First, wine in the garden of Arlequin Cafe; next, macaroons at Chantal Guillon; then, we scored the last two open seats at Domo without having to wait.  Sometimes the best dates are the unplanned ones.

excerpts: Our second roll was the Spicy Hulk which had spicy tuna & avocado, tobiko and was wrapped in a cucumber sheet with ponzu.
Both rolls were good.
It still can't compete with my favorite spot down in Foster City, but I'd be open to coming back.
spicy hulk.author: Kari G.
spicy hulk.review: Great location right off of the main drag in Hayes Valley. It was a long wait to sit inside so we snagged a seat on the patio. We had the miso soup and two rolls. Our first roll was the Fiesta which has albacore tuna, mango & cilantro then is topped with black pepper salsa. This roll was a lot of fun. It was married Mexican food flavor with yummy sushi. Dipping it in a tiny bit of soy sauce gave it the saltiness of tortilla chips. Our second roll was the Spicy Hulk which had spicy tuna & avocado, tobiko and was wrapped in a cucumber sheet with ponzu. Both rolls were good. It still can't compete with my favorite spot down in Foster City, but I'd be open to coming back.

excerpts: We paired this with the Spicy Hulk, which had the refreshing cucumber sheet with lemon ponzu and spicy tuna center.
spicy hulk.author: Travis L.
spicy hulk.review:
Small space but really interesting twists on sushi. My friend and I were eager to try most their Kobe Beef roll, which features a kobe beef outer wrap with avocado and, ginger, and asparagus in the center. The ponzu helped cut the oil, and the kobe beef just sort of disappears as you bite into it.

We paired this with the Spicy Hulk, which had the refreshing cucumber sheet with lemon ponzu and spicy tuna center. It's nice to break away from traditional rice-based sushi to enjoy a set of different textures and tastes all at once. 

We also had the domo roll, which is the restaurant's signature, but all in all, a mediocre warm cheese sushi. I think it was good partially because of the other rolls we had next to it.

Lastly, in order to have a bit of a traditional flavor, we went with the hamachi sashimi, which honestly was one of the best I had tried in a long time. Really fresh fish that could stand alone without the shoyu and the wasabi. It was to appreciate the natural sweetness of the fish alongside the more complex flavors of the other rolls. 

I liked the atmosphere of the restaurant and its location. It's a tad pricey, but overall the food quality was great.

excerpts: so I can't get more of the spicy hulk and the scallop crudo.
spicy hulk.author: diana m.
spicy hulk.review:
Following a recommendation of a local bartender my friend and I wandered in... and boy, was it worth it. the sushi was creative, delicious and will keep us coming back for more. wish I lived closer so I can't get more of the spicy hulk and the scallop crudo.

great ambiance, really fantastic service and delicious food. domo i'll be back soon.

excerpts: Some of my favorite dishes include the Hawaiian Style Tuna Poké, Spicy Tuna, Spicy Hulk and Fiesta.
Make sure to check out the specials board because I've had several delicious rolls from there as well.
spicy hulk.author: Joanna V.
spicy hulk.review:
Domo is hands-down my favorite hayes valley sushi place. Yes, it is small but I like it that way. It has a nice atmosphere and the staff is always friendly and spot on. The specials never have let me down. They also let you do take out which is nice for those days you wanna grab a roll and eat at home. 

The rolls are pricey but the quality is well worth it. Some of my favorite dishes include the Hawaiian Style Tuna Poké, Spicy Tuna, Spicy Hulk and Fiesta. Make sure to check out the specials board because I've had several delicious rolls from there as well.

excerpts: Get the spicy hulk, red dragon!
spicy hulk.author: Stephanie W.
spicy hulk.review:
Very small, cute and quaint. I like that they have creative rolls, I really appreciate trying something new. Get the spicy hulk, red dragon! Sake was bomb!

Minus one star for uncomfortable seating. I hate high, tiny chairs. And every seat except for one table is bar seating, which makes conversation with your date or friend hard. Dropped $100 for just 2 people including tip and alcohol which was shocking at first but now that I type this doesn't seem so bad.

excerpts: But, I decided to try something new and ordered the Spicy Hulk roll ($9.50) and on my friends recommendation, the Crunchy Spicy Tuna roll ($11).
We were told the wait was 20 mins
so we went to grab a drink
but when we came back they had already called our names
so we told the guy and he signed us up for the next spot.
The Spicy Hulk roll was tuna mashed up (looked like ground beef), avocado, a tiny bit of tobiko and all wrapped up by a piece of cucumber in a spicy sauce that was like lemony soy sauce (ponzu?).
I didn't like this at all...
the texture freaked me out and I felt like I was eating cat food.
It also might have been less enjoyable because I had it after the Crunchy roll.
spicy hulk.author: Amanda C.
spicy hulk.review:
So, this was my second stop in San Francisco and my first time trying what I'd now call mildly adventurous sushi. 

Up until tonight, I was completely excited by inside out avocado rolls. But, I decided to try something new and ordered the Spicy Hulk roll ($9.50) and on my friends recommendation, the Crunchy Spicy Tuna roll ($11). We were told the wait was 20 mins so we went to grab a drink but when we came back they had already called our names so we told the guy and he signed us up for the next spot. We were seated another 20 mins later and skimmed through the menu before deciding on the above plus the Sweet Potato roll ($4) and the Salmon Avocado roll ($6.50 I think). The crunchy roll was just about the best thing I've ever tasted. It had cooked tuna which resembled meat loaf, avocado, tobiko and spicy mayo and then the whole thing was battered and fried. I don't really enjoy spicy food but this was nice and complemented the other flavors well. The Spicy Hulk roll was tuna mashed up (looked like ground beef), avocado, a tiny bit of tobiko and all wrapped up by a piece of cucumber in a spicy sauce that was like lemony soy sauce (ponzu?). I didn't like this at all...the texture freaked me out and I felt like I was eating cat food. It also might have been less enjoyable because I had it after the Crunchy roll. I didn't eat the sweet potato or salmon and avocado rolls, but my friend really enjoyed them, especially the sweet potato roll. I'm so happy I came here and went the adventurous route; I would've completely missed out had I not! The only thing I have to complain about is the size. This place is so freakin small and you're basically seated at a wrap-around bar so you don't get to really face your friends and have a conversation. 

Hope I get to stop in again before I leave!

excerpts: The spicy hulk roll is my favorite - basically, tuna and avocado wrapped in cucumber (no rice).
spicy hulk.author: Mia M.
spicy hulk.review:
Cute and yummy sushi spot with some excellent people-watching window seating! The rolls and creative and very tasty. The spicy hulk roll is my favorite - basically, tuna and avocado wrapped in cucumber (no rice).

Ideal for parties of two b/c the place is small. The wait can get long, so I recommend calling in to put your name on the list before you get there.

excerpts:
*spicy hulk (spicy tuna & avocado, tobiko wrapped in a cucumber sheet with lemon ponzu) - 5/5, super creative roll and a total burst of flavor - the spicy tuna had quite a zing and was fresh, the tobiko added the crunch and texture, the avocado was the mild factor, the cucumber was crisp and refreshing, no soy sauce necessary as the lemon ponzu did the job)

A bottle of delicious Nigori to wash it all down!
spicy hulk.author: Bhavnak K.
spicy hulk.review:
Domo is definitely a hidden gem!!  I'd like it to remain hidden lol..because the place is so tiny as is and could easily become like 'Sushi Zone' where the normal wait time even on a week night is 45 min and up..yuck :(.  Bar seating primarily and big open kitchen...would not recommend large groups - more of an intimate setting :)

Anyway on to the more important matter - Foood
mmmmmm mmmm good!

**miso soup - 5/5 was perfect to get us warmed up
**Nigiri (albacore tuna, black snapper special, hamachi belly, and ebi) - 5/5, sweet bites of melt in your mouth freshness
**small crudos (the uni and spicy tuna) - 4/5, both were very delicious but a tease - you get to pick only 2 for $6
**spicy hulk (spicy tuna & avocado, tobiko wrapped in a cucumber sheet with lemon ponzu) - 5/5, super creative roll and a total burst of flavor - the spicy tuna had quite a zing and was fresh, the tobiko added the crunch and texture, the avocado was the mild factor, the cucumber was crisp and refreshing, no soy sauce necessary as the lemon ponzu did the job)

A bottle of delicious Nigori to wash it all down!

This is a great sushi bar - delicious food and attentive staff. The only downside is the size of the restaurant - the seating area is as big as their open kitchen.  I do love the idea of open kitchens but unfortunately the smell of cooking oil is not super appealing, but that will not deter me from coming back!

excerpts: we had Spicy Hulk (rolls), Domo, fire cracker balls and some crudos (uni, scallops and ankimo which were all excellent and fresh).
spicy hulk.author: Sung C.
spicy hulk.review:
awesome place for some innovative japanese rolls!

I haven't been a huge fan of rolls for, mainly, I didn't like that fact that they usually depend on sauce or rice, but oh boy this place made some pretty spectacular rolls which wowed all 3 of us.

we had Spicy Hulk (rolls), Domo, fire cracker balls and some crudos (uni, scallops and ankimo which were all excellent and fresh).

The bill was only 75 dollars with a glass of sake!  

The only problem was that it's such a small place and unless you get lucky you're more likely to wait for a long time to be seated. However we got to sit right away as we walked in!

excerpts: Tuna Poke, Spicy Tuna and Spicy Hulk?
YES PLEASE.
spicy hulk.author: Valerie C.
spicy hulk.review:
If it wasn't apparent to my server, I am clearly going through a tuna phase right now. Tuna Poke, Spicy Tuna and Spicy Hulk? YES PLEASE. Oh, and through in some edamame for good measure.

My favorite of this sampling is the poke. The slices were decently sized, all set atop a seaweed salad. As an added bonus, look for the tiny bits baby octopus sprinkled throughout the dish! Yum!

excerpts: I would be happy for life eating their "spicy hulk" roll and sashimi.
spicy hulk.author: Jana S.
spicy hulk.review:
This gets my vote for BEST SASHIMI in SF.  Extremely fresh, just the right thickness and delicious.  

Domo always executes a tasty time.  Love their cold sake and their awesome sake glasses that come with it (tipsy drunk friendly - I swear theres divots for your fingers!).  I would be happy for life eating their "spicy hulk" roll and sashimi.  

Tiny place, so only bring your honey - or eat outside on their heated patio.  :)  nomnomnom

excerpts:
lemony fresh and tasty
Spicy Hulk Roll: wrapped in cucumber gives it awesome fresh flavor and texture
spicy hulk.author: Mia L.
spicy hulk.review:
I really liked Domo.  The sushi was fresh and flavorful.  The Ankimo (monkfish liver) was fresh and clean tasting, unlike most other places I've had it.  Other must tries:

Fire Cracker Balls: crunchy, spicy, addicting
Sexy Mama Roll: lemony fresh and tasty
Spicy Hulk Roll: wrapped in cucumber gives it awesome fresh flavor and texture
Hawaiian Style Tuna Poke: sooo yummy!

Overall definitely one of the better sushi bars in SF. Get there early, it's tiny and theres always a line.

excerpts: Spicy Hulk roll which came wrapped in cucumber was a refreshing twist on a more typical spicy tuna roll.
I would also recommend the Castro roll if you like a variety of delicious fresh fish.
spicy hulk.author: Sam B.
spicy hulk.review: Ocean trout is a must. Very fresh fish and fun atmosphere. Spicy Hulk roll which came wrapped in cucumber was a refreshing twist on a more typical spicy tuna roll. I would also recommend the Castro roll if you like a variety of delicious fresh fish.

excerpts: Cruchy spicy tuna, spider, and the spicy hulk rolls are also very good.
spicy hulk.author: glen o.
spicy hulk.review:
This is probably my favorite sushi place in Hayes Valley.  The place is really small but I've never waited too long for a table.  Service is always great and friendly.

I've had the spicy tuna and scallop crudos.  The spicy tuna was great but the scallop was a little bland.

I love rolls so I usually get the rolls at this place.  The firecracker ball and domo rolls just melt in your mouth - my favorites.  Cruchy spicy tuna, spider, and the spicy hulk rolls are also very good.   My least favorite is proabably the Fiesta roll - mango and cilantro with the tuna doesn't taste quite right to me.

They also have a couple of tables outside which is great during spring and summetime.

excerpts: You need to try the Spicy Hulk because it's unlike any sushi roll
I've ever tried.
It's spicy tuna wrapped in a cucumber sheet!
It taste so healthy and yet so good!
spicy hulk.author: Tori Q.
spicy hulk.review:
I am definitely a fan of this tiny sushi joint.  I am a big fan of sushi rolls (my favorite being Sushi House in Alameda) and this place lives quite up to the hype.  The rolls are a lot less heavy than Sushi House but it's quite good.  

You need to try the Spicy Hulk because it's unlike any sushi roll I've ever tried.  It's spicy tuna wrapped in a cucumber sheet!  It taste so healthy and yet so good!  The Domo roll was very tasty as well if you like warm sushi.  You always gotta try the rolls named after the restaurant, after all.  

The venue is quite small with only bar seating surrounding the insides of the restaurant and one table inside.  There are three tables outside but no one would sit there on a cold SF night.  I can see this place getting busy real fast on the weekends so I recommend going on a week night where there's less traffic.

excerpts: Spicy hulk:
5/5 One thing
Domo does REALLY well
is its spicy tuna!
Get as much of it as you can!
I usually don't like rolls wrapped in cucumber rather than rice, but the spicy hulk was SO good!
spicy hulk.author: Julie S.
spicy hulk.review:
I think Domo served some of the best non-authentic "fun" sushi I've had in San Francisco!  One thing I always complain about is how San Francisco lacks good sushi.  I'm talking about delicious L.A.-style sushi.  You know, the trendy, fun sushi that you eat at Katsuya while people-watching.  For me, Domo served this purpose... except without the celebrities and celebutantes... 

It was a Saturday night and we had made dinner reservations at a different place in Hayes Valley and were STARVING.  To our dismay, we learned out our table would not be ready for awhile since other diners were lagging, so we decided to walk around Hayes Valley.  I wasn't even craving sushi at the time, but saw Domo and instantly started to think about how delicious it could be.  We put our names on the list and - lucky us! - were able to get seats at the inside bar area within a few minutes!

Please note that I can't speak to the quality of the sashimi or nigiri because we were STARVING so we just shared rolls (more bang for our buck), but the rolls are outstanding if you are in the mood for that!

We ordered the following:

Firecracker balls: 5/5 REaLLy tasty!  Don't expect to really taste the fish and to love the firecracker balls as sushi, but still expect to love them.  They're SO flavorful!  And deliciously spicy.  No wasabi or soy sauce needed.

Spicy hulk:  5/5 One thing Domo does REALLY well is its spicy tuna!  Get as much of it as you can!  I usually don't like rolls wrapped in cucumber rather than rice, but the spicy hulk was SO good!  Again, perfectly spicy and tasty - no wasabi or soy sauce needed.

Crunchy spicy tuna: 4.5/5 Also delicious, again because of the outstanding spicy tuna.  Would definitely get this again.

Jalapeno hamachi: 3/5 Decent.  We didn't love it, but it was still decent.  The chunks of jalapeno were a bit much, I thought.  My eyes started to water a bit.  I wouldn't get this roll again.

Fiesta: 1/5  Yuck.  I guess I don't like mango pieces in rolls.  It tasted a bit disturbing with the fish and I ended up pulling the mango pieces out in the end and dousing this roll with soy sauce and wasabi.  Definitely would not get this again.

Fish taco appetizer:  This dish gets probs for how creatively it is put together.  The taco "shell" is made of seaweed and tempura batter.  I am going to refrain from giving this a rating since I HATE salmon and didn't realize, in our ordering frenzy (don't judge me), that there was salmon in here.  My dinner companion liked this, though, and he's a salmon fan.

Overall, I really enjoyed my dinner at Domo.  We shared a bottle of unfiltered sake, which made for a fun evening:)  

Just a tip:  I don't recommend coming here if you have more than 2 people because I think it's pretty hard to get a table.  This place is TINY.

excerpts: The Fire Cracker Balls and the Spicy Hulk is delicious.
All of the small crudos are incredible.
I love sushi, but this takes the cake!
spicy hulk.author: Julia A.
spicy hulk.review: This place is small but memorable.  Everything is fresh and presented beautifully.  The Fire Cracker Balls and the Spicy Hulk is delicious.  All of the small crudos are incredible.  I love sushi, but this takes the cake!

excerpts: We had a spicy hulk (spicy tuna) - which was very light (no rice) and super fresh - highly recommend it, sexy mama (salmon) -
spicy hulk.author: Bhavin M.
spicy hulk.review:
Food was awesome.  The place is a bit small - however they do a good job of moving people through well.  

We had a spicy hulk (spicy tuna) - which was very light (no rice) and super fresh - highly recommend it, sexy mama (salmon) - has a bit too much lemon zest but still very good and the domo roll (baked salmon roll) - interesting item, however the sauce was a bit too sweet - preference would be too be light on the sauce.  

Definitely - a must go for the sushi yelpers!

excerpts: What I always have to order when I go to Domo is the Spicy Hulk roll - spicy tuna & avocado, tobiko wrapped in a cucumber sheet with lemon ponzu.
spicy hulk.author: Sandy K.
spicy hulk.review:
I stumbled upon Domo in a buzz after a few hours at happy hour in Hayes Valley.  I don't know how I got there, but I navigated from Sugar Lounge in my 4 1/2" Michael Kors, up a few blocks, and made a left somewhere and found Domo to my right.  The place just looked small and cozy, with all 15 some odd seats filled up (there is a sushi bar, a counter along two walls, and only one table, if I remember correctly).  Immediately I put my name on the waiting list, party of 3.  There was only one party of 2 waiting before us, so we enjoyed some beer and sake outside until our table was ready.  

The food was amazing; fresh and flavorful.  What I always have to order when I go to Domo is the Spicy Hulk roll - spicy tuna & avocado, tobiko wrapped in a cucumber sheet with lemon ponzu.  It is perfection.  

I love the food, and I love the experience of eating at an unassuming restaurant; Domo is a real find.

excerpts: we go spicy hulk and fire cracker.
both pretty normal.
we also decided to try the crudos.
ankimo and uni- both interesting.
spicy hulk.author: Janet Y.
spicy hulk.review:
place is pretty average. however, given the area I can see it being rated higher because there are many other sushi places around. there are tons of other good restaurants in the area tho

I generally get combination plates of sashimi/nigiri and I don't think they had them here. we go spicy hulk and fire cracker. both pretty normal. we also decided to try the crudos. ankimo and uni- both interesting. i would say fairly pricey so probably pick a fish that you like.

small and quaint place. i got lucky and didn't have to wait but i heard there is generally a wait. 

good for catching up with friends. prob not a good date spot unless you want people next to you hearing your convos.

excerpts: We started with edamame which needed more salt, and then moved on to the Spicy Hulk, Fire Cracker Balls, and Domo specialty rolls.
The Spicy Hulk was the winner for uniqueness and freshness.
Still a little hungry -  three guys eating here
- we had a rock and roll to close out the meal and wash it all down with some Sapporos and sake.
spicy hulk.author: Chad S.
spicy hulk.review:
We had been eyeing Domo for months after moving to Hayes Valley and finally paid a visit when seeing that the usual crowd on the sidewalk was gone.  

Apparently, hosting is not the specialty of Domo and they insist on sitting every party over two people at the one table in the small restaurant.  We watched helplessly as several parties of two were sat at the bar and no urgency was on us taking bar seats.

After a long wait we finally sat at the one table.  The experience greatly improved as the food was delicious albeit overpriced.  We started with edamame which needed more salt, and then moved on to the Spicy Hulk, Fire Cracker Balls, and Domo specialty rolls.  The Spicy Hulk was the winner for uniqueness and freshness.  Still a little hungry -  three guys eating here - we had a rock and roll to close out the meal and wash it all down with some Sapporos and sake.  Each roll was fresh and nicely presented.

Overall, the place is somewhat pricey and needs to work on preparing itself for larger parties if it wants my business again.

excerpts:
Crispy spicy tuna, Fiesta, Spicy Hulk, Jalepeño Hamachi
+ Nigiri: Shiro Maguro, Maguro and Blue Fin
My friend was raving about the crisply spicy tuna roll but for me, the Spicy Hulk takes the cake.
I love anything tuna and avocado
so I was immediately interested.
When it arrived, it caught my eye.
It was so elegantly wrapped in a handmade cucumber shell.
It's the perfect meal...healthy, tasty and refreshing!
Go Spicy Hulk!
spicy hulk.author: Karlyn N.
spicy hulk.review:
We decided on Domo over Serpentine and boy was I happy! I love it when going to sushi surprises and delights.

At first I was kind of shocked at how small it was but was glad we were the first ones there. Small places are fun as long as you're not the one waiting for days.

Here is what we ordered:
+ Rolls: Crispy spicy tuna, Fiesta, Spicy Hulk, Jalepeño Hamachi
+ Nigiri: Shiro Maguro, Maguro and Blue Fin

My friend was raving about the crisply spicy tuna roll but for me, the Spicy Hulk takes the cake. I love anything tuna and avocado so I was immediately interested. When it arrived, it caught my eye. It was so elegantly wrapped in a handmade cucumber shell. It's the perfect meal...healthy, tasty and refreshing! Go Spicy Hulk!

Looking forward to going back again soon.

excerpts: To go for: Spicy Hulk, Firecracker Balls, Fish Tacos, Sweet potato maki.
spicy hulk.author: Rika P.
spicy hulk.review:
Small and intimate, Domo squeezes up modern sushi enthusiasts to fit their capacity of 20 people (the most). Very creative menu, crafty sushi masters, colorful dishes.

To go for: Spicy Hulk, Firecracker Balls, Fish Tacos, Sweet potato maki.
