Specials are written on their only mirrored wall, also worth checking it out. 

I don't think they take reservations, but if you have to wait, be patient. This place is worth waiting for. Fish is always fresh, service is nothing to complain about, and overall atmosphere is great!

excerpts: The two of us split a few special rolls (Spicy Hulk, Firecracker Balls) and I had tried some nigiri (albacore, hamachi), and all of it was good.
The portions felt a bit small for the cost though, so don't expect to be stuffed unless you're prepared to pay a pretty penny.
Still, the quality is of a much higher caliber than many other sushi places I've been to.
spicy hulk.author: Will C.
spicy hulk.review:
Sushi is probably my favorite food. I could honestly eat it for every meal, or just all the time without even stopping. But then I'd be broke. It doesn't help that Domo is literally three blocks from my apartment.

I dropped by here with a friend the other night since we've been trying out a lot of the places in Hayes Valley we've never been to. Figured that (A) they have a lot of good reviews, and (B) their menu isn't insanely expensive like some places (i.e. Blue Fin). Both points are pretty spot on.

Be warned, Domo is a sushi BAR, not a restaurant; there's enough seating for maybe 15-20 people at most, making it a pretty tight squeeze if you're looking to bring friends. The atmosphere is both modern and intimate, so it'd make a nice little dinner-date location if anything. My friend and I arrived a little after they opened for dinner (5:30P) and by the time we left (6:20P) the place was already filling up.

Food-wise the sushi is incredibly flavorful and fresh. The two of us split a few special rolls (Spicy Hulk, Firecracker Balls) and I had tried some nigiri (albacore, hamachi), and all of it was good. The portions felt a bit small for the cost though, so don't expect to be stuffed unless you're prepared to pay a pretty penny. Still, the quality is of a much higher caliber than many other sushi places I've been to. Domo also has lunch specials, which I'm eager to try.

Overall, Domo is a pleasant, quaint little sushi bar that deserves the (current) 4-star rating on Yelp. There aren't many negatives to it other than its size (but come on, you can't entirely fault them for that) and perhaps the price-to-portion ratio, and it's worth repeated trips especially if you live in the area. Just... try to come early, otherwise you might be waiting for awhile.

excerpts: Firecracker Balls, Spicy Hulk, Sexy Mama???
What would Nobu think?
I told my companions that I could go for anything...anything except uni and monkfish liver.
Because...
well...
spicy hulk.author: Kerrie L.
spicy hulk.review:
Okay, I'll give you the bottom line first, because let's face it, we're all looking for shortcuts.  I'm a student, I know.

***Bottom line: I started the evening in a suck-ass mood, seriously wanting to shoot myself...and ended the evening *happily* eating monkfish liver for the first time.***

That's it.  You don't have to read any further, because it'll just get more boring, and I've had a run of long reviews lately.  But if you insist....

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Yesterday was my last day of rotation #9 (yay, me) and my most annoying Caucasian brother (his words, not mine) was in town.  Because I did not have any more assignments to do, nor did I have to wake up this morning at the butt crack of dawn, I wholeheartedly and enthusiastically agreed to meet him in the city for dinner.  However, this involved getting to the city from Napa at rush hour - I kept hitting stupid traffic...bay bridge traffic started way back in El Cerrito...and then again at the Octavia St exit.  And then when I *finally* made it to Hayes Valley, there was no parking AND stupid-ass drivers kept blocking the roads.  To top it all off, I had drunk a gallon of coffee at work, and didn't pee before I left Napa.  This equaled a miserable Kerrie L.

After I *finally* found parking, my friend, his friend, and I went into Domo...where a table for three was miraculously waiting for us.  (I made a bee-line for the bathroom, which was nice, by the way.)  So...apparently, we're all pretty loquacious, which meant we weren't in a big hurry to look at the menu.  We pretty much made our decisions while the server was there, taking a little more of their time than they had wanted, I'm sure.  So - their patience was a high point.

When I finally got around to looking at the menu, my first thought was, "JIVE ASS."  Firecracker Balls, Spicy Hulk, Sexy Mama???  What would Nobu think? :(  I told my companions that I could go for anything...anything except uni and monkfish liver.  Because...well...EW.

But as the night went on, and I drank more sake, I learned to accept the jive ass...even encouraging another order of the Fish Tacos.  Everything was fresh, flavors were strong, and of course, the presentation was very nice.  Finally, one of us dropped out and said he was done, but being the troopers we were, the "bro" and I decided to go for one last dish.  And because I was in such a great mood, I agreed to try an order of UNI and MONKFISH LIVER (you pick two items from the "small crudos" section of the menu).  I did it, I loved it, and now you can't say I'm not adventurous.

Such a perfect way to start my 2-MONTH vacation. :D

excerpts: The Spicy Hulk is probably the my all time favorite.
I could eat a whole order by myself!!
spicy hulk.author: Angel P.
spicy hulk.review:
YUMMM! Just thinking about this place makes me hungry! I love everything about Domo, from it's decor to the food. I've rarely had to wait very long but I usually only come with one other person. There is no room in here for a large group. The prices seem fair compared to other places in the city. 

I always get the sweet potato roll and the firecracker balls. The Spicy Hulk is probably the my all time favorite. I could eat a whole order by myself!!

excerpts: I loved the fun rolls...esp the spicy hulk and crispy california roll.
spicy hulk.author: Misha F.
spicy hulk.review:
Delicious and fresh. The two most important things about sushi. 

I loved the fun rolls...esp the spicy hulk and crispy california roll. 

Get here early...no reservations, and the locals know what is good.

excerpts:
- 2 uni
- 1 sake
- spicy hulk:
SO GOOD!!
Pretty small "roll" but each bite was super tangy and spicy.
Loved the ponzu sauce mix!
and the food wasn't bad either -- highly recommend the spicy hulk!
Prices to portions, it's not the best
but hey, what sushi place is cheap!!?
spicy hulk.author: T L.
spicy hulk.review:
Let me tell you, I was skeptical.

Right off the bat, we ordered a large hot sake and there was a small dead spider in one of the cups. But they were so nice about it and gave us an extra free large sake.

A friend took us here, telling us its his favorite sushi spot. I already have my favorite down (Koo) but Domo made quite an impression!

The ambiance is extremely intimate - not great for any group with more than 3 people. Besides, the restaurant itself is super small.

We ordered:
- crudos: uni x ankimo - uni sashimi & ankimo, each on a single spoon. Simple and delicious. We had 2 pairs of this :)
- 2 amaebi: the fried heads were very lightly, LIGHTLY fried. Still very good but I wish they fried it more!
- 2 uni
- 1 sake
- spicy hulk: SO GOOD!! Pretty small "roll" but each bite was super tangy and spicy. Loved the ponzu sauce mix!
- domo roll: satisfying! when you're craving something filling, this hits the spot.
- spider roll: meh, it was okay.
- large, hot sake

Yes, the portions are pretty small.
Yes, the owner's Chinese.
Yes, it's priced a little exorbitantly (due to its location).
Yes, there was a small dead spider in one of our sake cups, but they handled it quite well and we could have probably gotten it comped.

This place was really cute, and the food was pretty good - rolls and sushi. Everything tasted refreshing and delicious, except the spider roll (my bf orders that, not me!) and that other spider, but all in all, I really liked Domo.

The ambiance was perfect (so intimate!) and the food wasn't bad either -- highly recommend the spicy hulk! Prices to portions, it's not the best but hey, what sushi place is cheap!!?

excerpts: Also ordered the Spicy Hulk and enjoyed it.
spicy hulk.author: Littlefish B.
spicy hulk.review:
Returned almost a year later to the day, relieved to see they're open and seem to be doing well.

Got a seat at the bar and ordered what I recalled were my favourites: firecracker balls and the crunchy california roll.  In hindsight, just order one of those.  The combination of flavours is similar enough and the deep-fry became a little overwhelming.  Regardless, both are still delicious.

Also ordered the Spicy Hulk and enjoyed it.  But it's not going to prompt a craving for me.

Tried the unfiltered saki.  Guess I'm just not much of a saki person.

Not cheap, but still recommended.  Enjoy!

excerpts: We also ordered the Spicy Hulk roll, which was actually quite good
and I'm not into spicy stuff.
I think we also had some kind of Dragon roll.
I can't remember.
Oh, and the chef's choice sashimi platter.
spicy hulk.author: Kris L.
spicy hulk.review:
A and I headed to Domo for my 2nd birthday dinner.  He wanted to make sure I had sushi for my birthday because I love sushi.  We found parking in Hayes Valley so he let me choose between Sebo and Domo.  He'd just been to Sebo the week before and neither of us have ever been to Domo, so I decided to go here.

It was totally empty when we got there a little before 7pm, but it filled up pretty quickly.  Although that's not really hard to do because it's tiny.  Very small seating capacity.  

I don't remember exactly what we ordered.  I know we ordered the Firecracker Balls.  They're so wrong because it's so not sushi, but they were so good!!!  We also ordered the Spicy Hulk roll, which was actually quite good and I'm not into spicy stuff.  I think we also had some kind of Dragon roll.  I can't remember.  Oh, and the chef's choice sashimi platter.  Anyway, everything we ordered was really good.  

I'd go back just for the Firecracker Balls.

excerpts: Another positive was the Spicy Hulk roll - very nicely done, great, refreshing texture and flavor.
spicy hulk.author: Kimbalee W.
spicy hulk.review:
More negatives than positives for Domo ...

We sat at the bar and watched the chef in action. I'd have to say that he was very chintzy on the portions. The uni nigiri we ordered was unfortunately the worst I've ever had. I saw him spoon up the liquid scraps of sea urchin, place it into the small seaweed opening, and called it done. For $6.95, I could have bought a whole super burrito. Come on ... give us a real piece of uni!!! The albacore tuna nigiri was also dollhouse size, miniature (looking at the posted images ... our portions were no where near what is shown).

To add, it was pathetic how they, a Japanese restaurant, could run out of hot sake. Before our eyes, the waitress tipped the cardboard box sideways and squeezed out the last sake droplets. 

A positive was the restaurant's simple format allowing for a warm, and cozy ambiance. Although, I'm on the fence with liking the bar stool seating, and literally being elbow to elbow with other patrons. Another positive was the Spicy Hulk roll - very nicely done, great, refreshing texture and flavor.

excerpts: My favorites are: domo roll, the spicy hulk, fish tacos, and this yummy potato appetizer-y thing (but I don't know what the name of it is).
spicy hulk.author: Radha S.
spicy hulk.review:
I can't believe I've lived in Hayes Valley for 6 months, right down the street from Domo, and it took my friend from Italy to show me this place. I'm downright disappointed in myself!

My favorites are: domo roll, the spicy hulk, fish tacos, and this yummy potato appetizer-y thing (but I don't know what the name of it is).

I've only eaten here on two occasions, both at lunch time. All the other times I've gotten takeout. 

My staff is super friendly and attentive. The only two concerns are that the place is very small, so not the best place to go if you want to have a meal where you can talk (it's only side-by-side seating), and definitely not for a group of more than 2 people. Also, the sushi is a little pricy (I think it's 13 bucks for the domo), so I don't get to come here as often as I would like, but I think the prices are a little pricier than other places because the fish they use is very fresh.

excerpts: spicy hulk - love it!
no carb, a la no rice, but wrapped in crunchy cucumber (they use to slice it thinner, which we liked, but it's still good) and the spicy tuna, total staple, but the "juice" it's in is so yummy.
my man loves to use the leftover juice to add to the shoyu for further dipping.
spicy hulk.author: J P.
spicy hulk.review:
by far, our fav sushi joint!!  seriously, we get the same order every time, it is that good!  

ok, let's get to the goods... highlights:  

fish taco (don't think baja) it's a delicious square of nori tempura fried with fresh nigiri and homemade pepper salsa. dude, i don't know what's up with that combo, but it is amazing!!!  

sexy mama - OH the holy grail of rolls for me.  i'm particular with rolls, the whole too much rice, shove anything in there, i mean cream cheese people?... but this one is a culinary masterpiece, the flavors all compliment, the crunch of the asparagus, fresh fish, and viola that lil' slice of lemon is heaven.  seriously, it is one of my all time favorites.  

spicy hulk - love it! no carb, a la no rice, but wrapped in crunchy cucumber (they use to slice it thinner, which we liked, but it's still good) and the spicy tuna, total staple, but the "juice" it's in is so yummy.  my man loves to use the leftover juice to add to the shoyu for further dipping.  so good. 

jalapeno hamachi - jalapeno more for the crunch, not really for the heat and fresh hamachi, simple, but delicious! 

sake - oh man, i can't think of the name of our usual, but it's katanaba (yikes) or something like that, but my all time favorite sake, reasonable price and a good time.  ;) 

beer - orion, always! 

note:  we explored a couple of times in the beginning with some of the other items, def not worth veering from our usual.  didn't care at all for the "baked/warm" rolls.  

enjoy, cheers, kumpai!

excerpts: as for their rolls, always go from the cucumber wrapped spicy tuna (Spicy Hulk) and the soy sauce they use just makes it much more enjoyable and my brother's favorite; the (light) deep fried firecracker balls.
they are always an order for me each time i go, so good and bite size.
spicy hulk.author: Boho H.
spicy hulk.review:
I just returned from Domo after my second visit.  Definitely a sushi place that prides itself and knowing its fare and keeping their customer happy.  They are driven to please you, whatever you want, you can have...but some say otherwise. So I'm not sure how open they are to suggestions (what you don't like, or; what you do like) and having them create something special for you.  However, the service is always great, the atmosphere is serene for a date or with a couple friends (this place is TINY, so not good for more than 2 people).

i highly suggest ordering the butter fish sashimi which is not on the paper menu, but you'll find it on the hard-to-read mirror menu on the northern wall of the restaurant.  it is one of the few sushi places (that I know) whic carry this fish and the only place I will order it.  always a slight cool and definitely fresh, i sometimes have three orders.

as for their rolls, always go from the cucumber wrapped spicy tuna (Spicy Hulk) and the soy sauce they use just makes it much more enjoyable and my brother's favorite; the (light) deep fried firecracker balls.  they are always an order for me each time i go, so good and bite size.  i've also had the opportunity to try to domo roll with friends, while delicious, i always tend to go for the mercury laden tuna in my rolls.  i'll never learn (maybe when my fingers begin to curl into my palms) then I'll learn.

the ambiance is always on the quite side since it is a smaller venue, the lighting always dim and the seating mostly bar or window bar with one lone table that seats up to four guests makes it a perfect evening with friends yet you can still feel intimate with your date (however, one time I heard the depressive story of a girl and I wanted to tell her to shut up).

excerpts: Don't miss the Spicy Hulk!
spicy hulk.author: Melanie D.
spicy hulk.review:
I have been putting off rating Domo for awhile now. I think it's because I am intimidated somehow. I mean, I really could find no disparity between what they offer (fresh fish, great service, cozy atmosphere) and what they deliver (fresh fish, great service, cozy atmosphere).

They have a rotating list of specials, which I consider to be an excellent sign for any place, but def for a sushi place. They also highlight their new rolls, which is nice for people who have been there before.

I have had endless, fresh nigiri and sashimi, with nary a misstep on presentation, cut or taste. All the rolls are creative, interesting and daring - and so well pulled off! I hate when you try an interesting sounding maki roll, and it tastes terrible - like the chef did not even taste it. Not the case at Domo, each roll works and it is a great place to experiment with new kinds of fish and flavor combinations that you might not have put together yourself. Don't miss the Spicy Hulk! Somehow replacing nori with cucumber works, and you don't even miss the rice!

Their sake menu, while limited, offers a variety of tastes for a variety of price levels, which I appreciate. They also have a fine selection off beers.

Some may complain about the cramped quarters or long waits, but that's what happens when a place is this good! They never rush you out, and the helpful staff seems to encourage the practice of ordering food as you want it - not all at once - which I really like.

Domo is an excellent spot in Hayes Valley, and I can highly recommend taking someone here that you want to impress with some great food for a pretty reasonable price.

excerpts: We ordered edamame(sp), seaweed salad, the spicy hulk, the fire cracker balls, and the crispy cali rolls.
Um, Umm, Ummm, UMMMM, UMmmm...
I like the fire cracker balls more the the crispy cali...
You are tiny, You food is just the right size and best of all, you are speedy... and even more best of all, all that food came out to 40 bucks...
That's pretty good compared to some other places.
I will definitely come back again.
I had a dantastic time here!
spicy hulk.author: danny e.
spicy hulk.review:
mercie beaucoup monsieur robot!

I don't really want to give you 5 stars... I really really really want something to be wrong with you... Why? Because I am a bastard. 

We strolled in at mid 7pm's, and you sat us right in front, the nice long counter at the window gave me so much to look at. Your lights are simply cool. The "votive"s you have as old salt shakers... neat! The dishes were even simply cool,I especially like the little water jug you gave us, Why? I don't know.  

We ordered edamame(sp), seaweed salad, the spicy hulk, the fire cracker balls, and the crispy cali rolls. Um, Umm, Ummm, UMMMM, UMmmm... I like the fire cracker balls more the the crispy cali... You are tiny, You food is just the right size and best of all, you are speedy... and even more best of all, all that food came out to 40 bucks... That's pretty good compared to some other places. I will definitely come back again. I had a dantastic time here!

excerpts: We tried the kobe beef roll, spicy tuna, spider role and the cucumber spicy hulk.
The Kobe Beef roll took forever to come out.
spicy hulk.author: Jboogie L.
spicy hulk.review:
My first time here and we had to wait 45 minutes before getting seated. Luckily my friend and I had some catching up to do.  A small sushi restaurant (sits about 20?) with dimmed lights and mostly bar stool seating.  

We tried the kobe beef roll, spicy tuna, spider role and the cucumber spicy hulk.  The Kobe Beef roll took forever to come out.   The bill came to about $25/each. 

Not my favorite sushi restaurant but the first sushi joint I've ever eaten in the Hayes valley area.  

A place that is good for dates but not so good for families.

excerpts:
salmon crudo - bite size scoop of salmon, avocado, olive oil
spicy hulk - spicy tuna, avocado, wrapped in cucumber
fish taco (japanese version) - seared salmon and tuna on fried nori (tortilla)
spicy hulk.author: Kumar D.
spicy hulk.review:
They have some great flavor and texture combinations.
salmon crudo - bite size scoop of salmon, avocado, olive oil
spicy hulk - spicy tuna, avocado, wrapped in cucumber
fish taco (japanese version) - seared salmon and tuna on fried nori (tortilla)

excerpts: Spicy Hulk roll.
Fish tacos (even better than
Umami- really).
The only thing that I wouldn't have again was the deep-fried Spanish Mackeral
skeleton-
but it was an experience
spicy hulk.author: Trisha F.
spicy hulk.review:
I AM OBSESSED WITH DOMO!  

My guy and I went about a month ago for the first time, and we were in heaven!

As everyone here has mentioned, you must try the firecracker balls- they make your mouth come alive!  Domo roll (which is tasty but does kinda fall apart) and the crunchy California roll are special- the dragon roll is the best I've ever had.  Fully satisfied, we started plotting our return.

Two weeks later we decide to bring a couple with us.  We got there just in time to snag the single table.   The daikon salad was savory and an excellent starter.  Then the owner Kuohwa and the waiter recommended some rolls for us- and the fatty tuni nigiri.  WOW.  Each dish presented to us was sampled, and we'd break out in applause.  It was that good.  It didn't hurt that we had some delicious unfiltered sake flowing at the table!  Our friends Heidi A  and Glenn C said it was the best sushi experience they've ever had!

We had to go again.

A couple of weeks later, we had something to celebrate- my guy had gotten a promotion, so we decided to go to one of our two fave restaraunts: you guessed it, Domo.  What followed is an experience every sushi lover should have: I HIGHLY recommend it.  After greeting us  back effusively, Kuohwa asked if he could order for us.  

Seriously, if you have never tried this before: indulge, at least once in your life. 

Crudos: monkfish pate and seared scallops.  Both melt in  your mouth.  Probably my favorite.  Tataki- asparagus wrapped in slightly seared Kobe Beef.  Spicy Hulk roll.  Fish tacos (even better than Umami- really).  The only thing that I wouldn't have again was the deep-fried Spanish Mackeral skeleton- but it was an experience and I'm glad I tried it! 

Kuohwha knows his sushi.  Yes I wish it was bigger- but give them time! They've been here less than a year.  I cannot wait to go back.

Best sushi EVER.

excerpts: Meanwhile, the Spicy Hulk Roll seems to be a bit of a misnomer.
It's spicy tuna, avocado, tobiko wrapped in a cucumber sheet with spicy ponzu sauce.
spicy hulk.author: Evelyn K.
spicy hulk.review:
I just moved to Hayes Valley a few days ago, and I am thrilled that there is a fantastic sushi joint right down the street from me.  I've been there on a couple different occasions so far and I have to say that I've been super pleased.  I love that they have tables outside so that you can dine al fresco when the weather cooperates.  Otherwise, the seating indoors is definitely a tight squeeze. 

The seaweed salad is perfect!  Meanwhile, the Spicy Hulk Roll seems to be a bit of a misnomer.  It's spicy tuna, avocado, tobiko wrapped in a cucumber sheet with spicy ponzu sauce.  It's not much of a hulk, but rather light and delicate.   

I tried my friend's crunchy California roll, and that was over the top! A smidge too much indulgence in fried tempura and mayo for my liking.  I could only eat one piece of it before feeling bloated.  Don't get me wrong, it was very tasty, but just a little excessive for me.  I thought sushi was supposed to be healthy! 

The service is generally pretty quick, but sometimes they forget to give you chopsticks...making it challenging to eat the seaweed salad!

excerpts: The Spicy Hulk was actually spicy, cool, and refreshing...
spicy hulk.author: Ken W.
spicy hulk.review:
I'll start with the good things and then work my way down.  
*Nice cozy place and atmosphere in a hood surrounded by other cozy restaurants.  
*I thought the service was good and attentive.  The waitress said they were running out of hot sake but managed to squeeze out two bottles out of the box for us.
*The Spicy Hulk was actually spicy, cool, and refreshing...our favorite of the night.

The specials scribbled on the mirror were hard to read...we constantly had to bobble our heads in order to see what was up.  One of the specials was the Fresh Ikura so we asked for it.

"We're out of it."  Ok, how about the not-so-fresh ikura?  
"We're out of that too."  

Okey, on to the others: uni (sissy portions), the uni/monkfish liver sushi crudo combo (more sissy portions), seared albacore nigiri (came to us non-seared, equally sissy), and the $14 sashimi salad (We got what looked like one expensive head of lettuce compared to the amount of sashimi in it, and the dressing was bland).  The way they hold back on the portions I was surprised they would be out of anything...from my experience most Chinese-owned sushi shops are rather generous with their portions but this joint plays this neighborhood.

$.02

excerpts: Our third roll was the Spicy Hulk...a variation of the spicy tuna roll.
It also was delicious, but a little big to eat in one bite.
More like 3 bites.
Ok, so finally we got around to the nigiri, because we were still hungry after the three rolls.
We ordered the scallop, salmon and tuna rolls.
They were all really fresh, which is what makes or breaks the whole experience.
It's easy to spot day-old fish, and there was none of that here.
Loved the little bar facing the street, and the music was really great.
spicy hulk.author: Alyssa G.
spicy hulk.review:
I loved their rolls! Couldn't get enough, and my friend and I ended up ordering 3 rolls, and 3 different Nigiris. To start out, we had the hot sake, always a must, when chatting about dirtbag guys and catching up with friends.  Then came the edemame, which were always a plus. Edamame is always good when they aren't overcooked, slightly crunchy and mildly salty. On to the rolls. My favorite was definitely the spider roll, it was so light but incredibly flavorful. Next on my list would be the crunchy california roll, which was great! The roll was a little hot when we received it, so we let it cool down for a minute, but then.....nothing but a fiesta in my mouth!
Our third roll was the Spicy Hulk...a variation of the spicy tuna roll. It also was delicious, but a little big to eat in one bite. More like 3 bites. Ok, so finally we got around to the nigiri, because we were still hungry after the three rolls. We ordered the scallop, salmon and tuna rolls. They were all really fresh, which is what makes or breaks the whole experience. It's easy to spot day-old fish, and there was none of that here. Loved the little bar facing the street, and the music was really great. Even though I was talking and talking with my friend throughout the meal, I paused and enjoyed the great mix of house/lounge-esque music in the background.

The waitstaff were really nice, and patient as it took us a while to decide what we finally wanted to order. Definitely coming back soon!

excerpts: Firecracker Balls live up to their hype, Domo Roll was dank, and the Spicy Hulk was a keeper as well.
They have changing "specials" of which were all pretty good.
I added Jalapenos to a "Dragon Domo" roll they have, and the chefs appreciated my recommendation...so
next time I'm expecting to see the Matt's Dragon Domo Roll gracing the menu!
Arigato!
spicy hulk.author: Matt D.
spicy hulk.review: Mmhmm, beer at Suppenkuche and then stroll down the street to this teency weency sushi bar for some scrumptious sushi. Firecracker Balls live up to their hype, Domo Roll was dank, and the Spicy Hulk was a keeper as well. They have changing "specials" of which were all pretty good. I added Jalapenos to a "Dragon Domo" roll they have, and the chefs appreciated my recommendation...so next time I'm expecting to see the Matt's Dragon Domo Roll gracing the menu! Arigato!

excerpts: the spicy hulk is a super good roll.
usually i dont really like cucumber in my sushi but
this one is all fish wrapped in cucumber and it gives sushi a really fresh and clean taste
spicy hulk.author: edward k.
spicy hulk.review: domo arigato mr roboto.. sorry but had to do it. this place a pretty nice place even tho its small. the rolls are fresh and tasty but the selection is pretty small. but i guess thats ok since what they do have is nice and fresh and done really well. the spicy hulk is a super good roll. usually i dont really like cucumber in my sushi but this one is all fish wrapped in cucumber and it gives sushi a really fresh and clean taste

excerpts: We had the Spicy Hulk roll....
the cucumber slices around it was amazing.
The service was quick and friendly.
I would definitely recommend checking this place out!
spicy hulk.author: Erin D.
spicy hulk.review: I went here on a Saturday evening, with a date.  It was cozy and we only waited 10 minutes to get a seat.  The sushi was amazing and unique.  We had the Spicy Hulk roll....the cucumber slices around it was amazing.  The service was quick and friendly.  I would definitely recommend checking this place out!

excerpts: My roll of choice: Spicy Hulk.
Great prices, but small restaurant.
spicy hulk.author: Lisa C.
spicy hulk.review: This place fairly good. Makes a variety of rolls of different flavors. My roll of choice: Spicy Hulk. Great prices, but small restaurant.

excerpts:
The Spicy Hulk roll is fun and tasty.  
Using cucumber as a wrapper is inventive and I wanted to lick the sauce off the plate.
The Rock and Roll is a good standard unagi roll.
spicy hulk.author: Kat M.
spicy hulk.review:
Where to begin....  My first time at Domo I wasn't terribly impressed, but it's been consistently awesome every time I went back.  I guess I figured out the right things to order.
Those things would be: The Fiesta Roll (not on the menu, currently written on the wall - get there before it goes away!)  Salsa and mango in sushi?  Absurdly good.
Crispy spicy tuna (also not on the menu): holy crap.  $9.60 of intense flavor and great textures!  Comes on an extra long plate, and the pieces of the roll barely fit into my mouth.  It's super filling and very indulgent.  
The nigiri is always very good and fresh tasting.  I've tried to be more adventurous in my fish consumption - the Tazmanian Trout is a new favorite.
The Spicy Hulk roll is fun and tasty.  Using cucumber as a wrapper is inventive and I wanted to lick the sauce off the plate.
The Rock and Roll is a good standard unagi roll.
The Jalepeno Hamachi is another good combo - I really like the bright flavor of the pepper mixed with the fish.
My vegetarian friend has good things to say about the veggie stuff.  We both like the edamame.  
The service is brisk and efficient.  I prefer the female server we've gotten the past few times over the guy who served my friend and I tonight.  
Can't wait to keep eating my way through the Domo menu!

excerpts: Love the Domo Roll, the Spicy Hulk, and the Crudos.
The restaurant is tiny and the seating isn't very spacious, but th great food and good service more than makes up for it.
spicy hulk.author: Vijay C.
spicy hulk.review: Love the Domo Roll, the Spicy Hulk, and the Crudos. The restaurant is tiny and the seating isn't very spacious, but th great food and good service more than makes up for it.

excerpts: try the 'spicy hulk', asparagus roll, and the crudo's. holler.
spicy hulk.author: C. G.
spicy hulk.review:
ultra small, ultra cute, ultra gooOOod!

the dishes are innovative and ultra tasty. go with one or two people max. try the 'spicy hulk', asparagus roll, and the crudo's. holler.

excerpts: spicy hulk, Fire Cracker Balls, kobe beef roll..
spicy hulk.author: amit s.
spicy hulk.review: my recommendations. spicy hulk, Fire Cracker Balls, kobe beef roll..

excerpts: We ordered the Mac Daddy, Firecracker Balls and the Spicy Hulk.
The Mac Daddy was amazing - featuring ocean trout and a bunch of other stuff.
As other yelpers have mentioned, the FireCracker Balls are super-tasty.
In fact, all three rolls were just excellent.
Admit it, you don't want to read any more of this, you just want to go and try it yourself... enjoy!
spicy hulk.author: Jono K.
spicy hulk.review: Let me just start by putting my cards out on the table here. This is seriously some of the best sushi I've had in a while. A long while. The fish was deliciously fresh and the service was really nice, as our server walked us through the specials, was very attentive to our needs, etc. The sushi came out really fast -- almost too fast, but you can't fault a sushi artist for making his/her stuff quickly! The environment is classic Japanese-chic - VERY small inside, but very tastefully decorated. This is an great date-place, as my date and I noticed everyone that was there was in pairs of two. Probably not the best place to take the entire team for a work lunch, as there's just no room inside. But really, who cares - let's get back to the sushi! We ordered the Mac Daddy, Firecracker Balls and the Spicy Hulk. The Mac Daddy was amazing - featuring ocean trout and a bunch of other stuff. As other yelpers have mentioned, the FireCracker Balls are super-tasty. In fact, all three rolls were just excellent. Admit it, you don't want to read any more of this, you just want to go and try it yourself... enjoy!

excerpts: If you like crazy rolls, you'll love it--don't miss the firecracker balls (I could eat these everyday for the rest of my life and die a happy man) and spicy hulk roll!
spicy hulk.author: Xander M.
spicy hulk.review: I couldn't ask for more in my neighborhood sushi spot. Excellent sushi, moderate price, though not cheap by any stretch of the imagination. It's definitely not traditional, so if that's what you're into, don't go. If you like crazy rolls, you'll love it--don't miss the firecracker balls (I could eat these everyday for the rest of my life and die a happy man) and spicy hulk roll!

excerpts: And the kobe beef, sexy mama, domo roll and one other roll that slips my mind.
sexy mama.author: Mabel Y.
sexy mama.review:
Came here quite a while ago with babe to get our sushi grub on.

Babe and I got a couple of rolls and some crudos and a beer. If I recall correctly, we got the salmon and scallop crudo, very yum with lots of flavor. And the kobe beef, sexy mama, domo roll and one other roll that slips my mind.

The portions here are pretty small, so not for you if you love sushi and can't get enough. The crudos are very delicious though, I certainly recommend it.

Our server was eh, seemed bored, didn't talk much and didn't smile.

excerpts: They do work on their Sexy Mama roll (avacado and asparagus topped with salmon and lemon slice) as well - which is my all-time fave classic roll!!
sexy mama.author: Erin C.
sexy mama.review:
Domo-Arigatou Gozaimasu!

Love this place! Was in the area on a Friday night having tea at Samovar and decided to stroll around the area to look for sushi. Only a block and a half away.. DOMO! Wrote my name down for two, took a brisk walk around Hayes and was called when we arrived back.

Cozy, well-designed sushi bar with DELICIOUS rolls. Only bar chairs along the sushi bar and walls of the place, one table inside, and a few tables for four outside. 

The service was excellent, the food came out in a timely manner and I will forever remember the kobe roll and firecracker ball. They do work on their Sexy Mama roll (avacado and asparagus topped with salmon and lemon slice) as well - which is my all-time fave classic roll!!

drrrooool. Think I'll go back this weekend.

excerpts: Walu, Hamachi, Albacore, Saba (THE FRESHEST and luved the fried fish head/bone presentation), Spicy Hulk (Yummmmy cucumber/tuna), Sexy Mama (my fav of the hour), Wagyu beef roll, and the hamachi/tuna/avacado tacos.
SUUUPERB!
sexy mama.author: Vee V.
sexy mama.review:
This started out as a TWO star review but it went back up! Hear me out...

Came here last night, for the first time, at 7pm. Long line (no problem), waited about an hour, while we scouted the menu and specials on the mirror so we knew exactly what to order when ready. Then sadness arrived...all I heard was the waiter saying "don't hate me, you're gonna hate me" because "we are out of Uni, Ankimo, Amaebi, etc..." The sudden rush of I wanna leave right now flashes before my eyes...but we decided to give it a chance. Ok, the food is YUM YUM and the presentation is gorge so what can I say. They gave us the "we just re-opened after ten days of vacation"...we softy!

We ordered almost everything else other than our favorites (above). Walu, Hamachi, Albacore, Saba (THE FRESHEST and luved the fried fish head/bone presentation), Spicy Hulk (Yummmmy cucumber/tuna), Sexy Mama (my fav of the hour), Wagyu beef roll, and the hamachi/tuna/avacado tacos. SUUUPERB!

excerpts: Moving on, I ordered some of the sushi rolls including the Fire Cracker Balls, Sexy Mama, and the Domo Roll.
Each were fantastic with Sexy Mama being my favorite!
The Sexy Mama is really great if you love the taste of citrus in every bite because it's completely lined with thinly sliced lemons.
sexy mama.author: Ann S.
sexy mama.review:
Domo is a great place for some good Japanese food. 

I started off with the edamame, miso soup, and seaweed salad appetizers followed by spoonfuls of small crudos. The salmon crudo was fresh and perfect with the small wedge of avocado. The spicy tuna crudo had a nice kick to it with the addition of the sriracha hot sauce. The scallop crudo was wonderfully balanced with delicious seasoning. Last but not least, the uni was delicate, bright, and very fresh. Really, how else would you prefer sea urchin gonads for consumption? Mmm... That's some serious good eats!

Moving on, I ordered some of the sushi rolls including the Fire Cracker Balls, Sexy Mama, and the Domo Roll. Each were fantastic with Sexy Mama being my favorite! The Sexy Mama is really great if you love the taste of citrus in every bite because it's completely lined with thinly sliced lemons. Yum!

Domo is located in Hayes Valley in a cool neighborhood, perfect for outdoor seating. 

Service was attentive and friendly!

excerpts: walu, hamachi, toro, albacore, saba, spicy hulk roll, wagyu beef roll, sexy mama roll, and fish tacos...
ALL was just a orgasmn to my taste buds~!
However, due to the fact that they didn't have some of the most simple (yet important items) of a sushi spot...I was still going to give them at most a
3-star.
But then....the waiter came to us and apologized about all the items they couldn't serve to us due to them being closed for ten days for the holidays and
this was their first day of re-opening.
I then sharply responded "OK...now I forgive you guys"
sexy mama.author: Patrick C.
sexy mama.review:
No Uni, no Ankimo, no special jelly fish, no special Madagascar Amaebi that is on their specials board.  FAIL!!  Started to Yelp this on my i-phone and saved as a two star review just for this.  So why did I give them a 4-star??...

Came here with no reservations (as you can't make none at this small 10-14 seater place)....waited an hour for table for two.  NONE of what I had mentioned above so had to order others....walu, hamachi, toro, albacore, saba, spicy hulk roll, wagyu beef roll, sexy mama roll, and fish tacos...ALL was just a orgasmn to my taste buds~!  However, due to the fact that they didn't have some of the most simple (yet important items) of a sushi spot...I was still going to give them at most a 3-star.  But then....the waiter came to us and apologized about all the items they couldn't serve to us due to them being closed for ten days for the holidays and this was their first day of re-opening.  I then sharply responded "OK...now I forgive you guys"

excerpts: We ordered Domo, Kobe Beef, Sexy Mama, Temptation, Hamachi and Salmon sashimi and 2 orders of crudos.
The only thing that was memorable was the uni and scallop crudos, the rest of the food was ok, no wow factors.
I've definitely had better versions of the same things elsewhere but here, the portion was smaller.
For the price, I should have gone to Ichi, for better services and food.
sexy mama.author: Lulu C.
sexy mama.review:
Came here with a good friend last week, due to the good Yelp reviews. We got there at 5:30ish on a week night, it's a fairly small place and the only table available was for 3 ppl so we were sent to the waiting area (they would have earned 1 more star if they let us seated at that 3 ppl table, not to mention that table was unoccupied the whole hour while we were there). We had a movie to catch afterwards so although it was chilly, we decided to sit outside. 

We ordered Domo, Kobe Beef, Sexy Mama, Temptation, Hamachi and Salmon sashimi and 2 orders of crudos. The only thing that was memorable was the uni and scallop crudos, the rest of the food was ok, no wow factors. I've definitely had better versions of the same things elsewhere but here, the portion was smaller. For the price, I should have gone to Ichi, for better services and food.

excerpts: ("Sexy Mama Roll") - bright flavors which were perfect for spring.
I don't know if I can bring myself to try the firecracker balls as I am loyal to the ones at Red Box Sushi, but I watched order after order go out
sexy mama.author: Liz S.
sexy mama.review:
Great little spot to stop for some tasty sushi.  It's designed for "on-the-go" eating, and there is not one table in the place to encourage lingering.  Instead, you pull up a stool and belly up to a counter, either facing the sushi bar, or facing the window.  A server takes your order, and whoosh, you are on your way.

I met Jill K. there for an early dinner last week, and thank God we got there early.  At 6:00 there were seats available, at 6:30 there was a line - on a Wednesday.  Seems that people in the neighborhood were ready for a new sushi place, despite having Sebo just a block or so away.

I loved that they offer "crudos", or little one-bite tastes, served in soup spoons.  We tried the Uni and the Salmon crudo - I could make a meal out of an assortment these delicious mouthfuls.  The uni one had avocado, and the salmon had capers and onions.

We shared a couple rolls, and they were very good.  The Spicy Tuna is VERY spicy, which I liked.  The sushi is fresh and well-prepared, and one of the rolls we tried had salmon, asparagus, tobiko and yuzu in it ("Sexy Mama Roll") - bright flavors which were perfect for spring.  I don't know if I can bring myself to try the firecracker balls as I am loyal to the ones at Red Box Sushi, but I watched order after order go out and they looked decadent and good.

They have a small selection of sakes, and this sounds weird but I really liked the water that they bring to the table.  It's ice cold and served in a lovely glass bottle.

It would be a great stop after a day of shopping or after work, either with a friend or by yourself.  Since you are seated side-by-side, and the place is so small, I wouldn't recommend a group larger than two people.

Nice, friendly service, reasonable prices, great location.  I'll be back soon!

excerpts: Sexy Mama Roll:
sexy mama.author: Mia L.
sexy mama.review:
I really liked Domo.  The sushi was fresh and flavorful.  The Ankimo (monkfish liver) was fresh and clean tasting, unlike most other places I've had it.  Other must tries:

Fire Cracker Balls: crunchy, spicy, addicting
Sexy Mama Roll: lemony fresh and tasty
Spicy Hulk Roll: wrapped in cucumber gives it awesome fresh flavor and texture
Hawaiian Style Tuna Poke: sooo yummy!

Overall definitely one of the better sushi bars in SF. Get there early, it's tiny and theres always a line.

excerpts: We had a spicy hulk (spicy tuna) - which was very light (no rice) and super fresh - highly recommend it, sexy mama (salmon) -
sexy mama.author: Bhavin M.
sexy mama.review:
Food was awesome.  The place is a bit small - however they do a good job of moving people through well.  

We had a spicy hulk (spicy tuna) - which was very light (no rice) and super fresh - highly recommend it, sexy mama (salmon) - has a bit too much lemon zest but still very good and the domo roll (baked salmon roll) - interesting item, however the sauce was a bit too sweet - preference would be too be light on the sauce.  

Definitely - a must go for the sushi yelpers!

excerpts: I had the sexy mama-dynamite roll, fire cracker balls were decent and tasty
the miso is ok
i

ve had better
sea weed salad
sexy mama.author: farah b.
sexy mama.review:
Got take out here-small place and I mean really small-take out took 20 min
not bad at all. 
Their sushi is small and a bit pricey. id eat there again only bc my friends live on the same block and they have a cute bar style eating area facing the street. very cute location and restaurant.
I had the sexy mama-dynamite roll, fire cracker balls were decent and tasty
the miso is ok ive had better
sea weed salad you cant go wrong with that.

very fresh sushi

excerpts: Firecracker Balls, Spicy Hulk, Sexy Mama???
What would Nobu think?
I told my companions that I could go for anything...anything except uni and monkfish liver.
Because...
well...
sexy mama.author: Kerrie L.
sexy mama.review:
Okay, I'll give you the bottom line first, because let's face it, we're all looking for shortcuts.  I'm a student, I know.

***Bottom line: I started the evening in a suck-ass mood, seriously wanting to shoot myself...and ended the evening *happily* eating monkfish liver for the first time.***

That's it.  You don't have to read any further, because it'll just get more boring, and I've had a run of long reviews lately.  But if you insist....

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Yesterday was my last day of rotation #9 (yay, me) and my most annoying Caucasian brother (his words, not mine) was in town.  Because I did not have any more assignments to do, nor did I have to wake up this morning at the butt crack of dawn, I wholeheartedly and enthusiastically agreed to meet him in the city for dinner.  However, this involved getting to the city from Napa at rush hour - I kept hitting stupid traffic...bay bridge traffic started way back in El Cerrito...and then again at the Octavia St exit.  And then when I *finally* made it to Hayes Valley, there was no parking AND stupid-ass drivers kept blocking the roads.  To top it all off, I had drunk a gallon of coffee at work, and didn't pee before I left Napa.  This equaled a miserable Kerrie L.

After I *finally* found parking, my friend, his friend, and I went into Domo...where a table for three was miraculously waiting for us.  (I made a bee-line for the bathroom, which was nice, by the way.)  So...apparently, we're all pretty loquacious, which meant we weren't in a big hurry to look at the menu.  We pretty much made our decisions while the server was there, taking a little more of their time than they had wanted, I'm sure.  So - their patience was a high point.

When I finally got around to looking at the menu, my first thought was, "JIVE ASS."  Firecracker Balls, Spicy Hulk, Sexy Mama???  What would Nobu think? :(  I told my companions that I could go for anything...anything except uni and monkfish liver.  Because...well...EW.

But as the night went on, and I drank more sake, I learned to accept the jive ass...even encouraging another order of the Fish Tacos.  Everything was fresh, flavors were strong, and of course, the presentation was very nice.  Finally, one of us dropped out and said he was done, but being the troopers we were, the "bro" and I decided to go for one last dish.  And because I was in such a great mood, I agreed to try an order of UNI and MONKFISH LIVER (you pick two items from the "small crudos" section of the menu).  I did it, I loved it, and now you can't say I'm not adventurous.

Such a perfect way to start my 2-MONTH vacation. :D

excerpts: My favorite roll we ordered was the Sexy Mama.
sexy mama.author: Morgan M.
sexy mama.review:
Whenever I would think about going out for sushi, I used to get hot and clammy and be that flakey friend that said they had things to do but secretly stayed in eating my Special K sat on the couch. I'd think about a friend who showed me this grotesque picture of a man and tapeworms from her desk while she was plowing down shrimp tempura rolls.  

I refused the flavorful treat that is sushi for so long, no thanks to my Hamachi loving friend and her crappy google find. After a huge drunken debate and careful consideration, I relapsed off of the non-sushi wagon.

I was meeting up with Queenie C. for a foodie night out and we ventured over to Domo to give it a whirl. We sipped our tea and started catching up but got sidetracked by the sexy music playing. Sexy Sushi, yes please.

The inside is intimate and the seats look close together but your personal bubble is big enough to accomodate. The service is quick and swift and if you're lucky to sit away from the main window you'll have a front line view of the chefs working their magic and are not afraid of taking part of photo ops. My favorite roll we ordered was the Sexy Mama. The smallest touch of lemon made that roll sexy with scrumptious desire.

Lovely spot but I know to get here earlier than the later crowd since there could be a little wait.

excerpts: My recommendations are the domo roll, sexy mama, and fire cracker ball.
The small crudos are awesome too!
sexy mama.author: Jeanne L.
sexy mama.review:
The various rolls that I had were all amazing with great flavor. The presenation of each dish was a work of art. The service was good and although the place is small, the ambience was nice. I will definately have to come back and try the other items, especially the special deals.

My recommendations are the domo roll, sexy mama, and fire cracker ball. The small crudos are awesome too!

excerpts: sexy mama
- I love any roll that uses lemon.

This one did not see me wrong
dragon - its a dragon roll.
You can't go wrong really.
jalapeno hamachi - 3/4 members of the party gagged on the power of the chilli.
I, however thought that the flavour of the hamachi and the jalapeno worked really well together.
For me, a win!
And I got the last one as a result :)
sexy mama.author: Catriona C.
sexy mama.review:
I so very much enjoyed my meal at Domo last night. And the gallon of sake we drank. And the Sapporo. But not so much the hangover this morning...

This place is tiny. It really doesn't suit large parties of people. Four of us showed up and we had a seriously long wait to get a seat along the wall (when I say along the wall, thats really the only option bar one table in the corner). Seeing as the couple occupying our space were on the way to an adventure of the horizontal sorts, it took some time to get us seated. On the upside however, the waiter was clearly embarrassed to have us waiting on the side. I like it when I see that people really care about me and my feelings. 

So once we were seated, we got to the menu. We ordered (along with a nice ginjo): 

salmon and spicy tuna crudos - tuna - very spicy. Its the first time my food has been served in a soup spoon... and I feel like I have gone up the world
firecracker balls - delicious and worth every rave review
sexy mama - I love any roll that uses lemon. This one did not see me wrong
dragon - its a dragon roll. You can't go wrong really. 
jalapeno hamachi - 3/4 members of the party gagged on the power of the chilli. I, however thought that the flavour of the hamachi and the jalapeno worked really well together. For me, a win! And I got the last one as a result :)
fiesta (special) - this was delicious. Mango, shrimp, roe... and other stuff. It is a party in your mouth. 
wasabi peas - enough wasabi for flavour, but it wasn't overpowering
edamame - good edamame. Nice edamame. Still crunchy and flavourful

All in all, there wasn't a single part of the meal that I didn't enjoy and for that I have to give it the full five. It was definitely well worth the wait. I just wish it was a little bit larger. There is outdoor seating, which can work for larger groups but when its windy and SF is still recovering from Winter, it's not so appropriate sans outdoor heaters.

excerpts: sexy mama -
OH
the holy grail of rolls for me.
i'm particular with rolls, the whole too much rice, shove anything in there, i mean cream cheese people?
but this one is a culinary masterpiece, the flavors all compliment, the crunch of the asparagus, fresh fish, and viola that lil' slice of lemon is heaven.
sexy mama.author: J P.
sexy mama.review:
by far, our fav sushi joint!!  seriously, we get the same order every time, it is that good!  

ok, let's get to the goods... highlights:  

fish taco (don't think baja) it's a delicious square of nori tempura fried with fresh nigiri and homemade pepper salsa. dude, i don't know what's up with that combo, but it is amazing!!!  

sexy mama - OH the holy grail of rolls for me.  i'm particular with rolls, the whole too much rice, shove anything in there, i mean cream cheese people?... but this one is a culinary masterpiece, the flavors all compliment, the crunch of the asparagus, fresh fish, and viola that lil' slice of lemon is heaven.  seriously, it is one of my all time favorites.  

spicy hulk - love it! no carb, a la no rice, but wrapped in crunchy cucumber (they use to slice it thinner, which we liked, but it's still good) and the spicy tuna, total staple, but the "juice" it's in is so yummy.  my man loves to use the leftover juice to add to the shoyu for further dipping.  so good. 

jalapeno hamachi - jalapeno more for the crunch, not really for the heat and fresh hamachi, simple, but delicious! 

sake - oh man, i can't think of the name of our usual, but it's katanaba (yikes) or something like that, but my all time favorite sake, reasonable price and a good time.  ;) 

beer - orion, always! 

note:  we explored a couple of times in the beginning with some of the other items, def not worth veering from our usual.  didn't care at all for the "baked/warm" rolls.  

enjoy, cheers, kumpai!

excerpts: We ordered a Sexy Mama roll which was absolutely perfect combination of ingredients with flavors that slowly shifted as I ate it.
The Kobi beef roll while not exactly sushi was equally amazing.
sexy mama.author: Colin F.
sexy mama.review:
Excellent fresh sushi with some inspired rolls. We ordered a Sexy Mama roll which was absolutely perfect combination of ingredients with flavors that slowly shifted as I ate it. The Kobi beef roll while not exactly sushi was equally amazing. The hamachi belly nigiri melted in my mouth.

The food is a solid 5 stars but the bar chairs are uncomfortable. I guess people with long legs might be ok but my leg circulation was cut off. Also, it is fairly pricy -- expect to drop at least $60-80 for two person meal.

excerpts:
He wanted the Sexy Mama (asparagus, tobiko topped with sliced lemon & salmon, yuzu cucumber). 

Everything was absolutely delicious, and I'm still thinking about the brilliant pop of lemon in the Sexy Mama.
sexy mama.author: Jason B.
sexy mama.review:
She wanted the Fire Cracker Balls (spicy tuna roll with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, scallions & tobiko).

He wanted the Sexy Mama (asparagus, tobiko topped with sliced lemon & salmon, yuzu cucumber). 

We both wanted the Domo Roll (baked california roll topped with salmon & scallops with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, tobiko & scallions).

Everything was absolutely delicious, and I'm still thinking about the brilliant pop of lemon in the Sexy Mama.

Equally impressive was the Kobe beef roll. We didn't actually order it, but watched in awe as the chef cooked the beef with a propane torch. It was so very, very awesome, and so very, very on our items to order next time.

Service and decor were the perfect mix of friendly, inviting, warm, modern, subtle, sophisticated. All comes without breaking the bank - a reasonable bill became a steal after learning the salad and edamame were on the house. 

Go and enjoy.

excerpts: The sexy mama's pretty good as well.
sexy mama.author: Keyvan R.
sexy mama.review:
Solid Japanese food at a great neighborhood joint. I've been there twice and really like the crudos, especially the crab crudo. I usually get some yellowtail or white albacore nigiri as well to start off, and then top it off with some rolls, like the mighty Temptation roll. The sexy mama's pretty good as well. I'm not a big fan of spicy food, so I stayed away from the firecracker balls, but people tell they're worth it. 

I've eaten there twice, once on a Saturday night that surprisingly had no wait. Well worth a try...

excerpts: It made a great closer after a tasty negi-hama roll and a fresh, bright Sexy Mama roll (aspragus, salmon, and tobiko, topped with lemon and yuzu).
sexy mama.author: Joe G.
sexy mama.review:
The Toro.

Oh, the Toro.

It's the best $2.13 a bite ($5.25 a piece, $10.50 an order) to be had in Hayes Valley. (This goes along with the best $0.25 a sip at Absinthe, the best $0.50 a nibble at Citizen Cake, and the best $4 a skewer at Hayes and Kebab.)  It made a great closer after a tasty negi-hama roll and a fresh, bright Sexy Mama roll (aspragus, salmon, and tobiko, topped with lemon and yuzu).

excerpts: We ordered the similar rolls from last time including the sexy mama, spicy tuna crunchy, ST handrolls & firecracker balls.
sexy mama.author: Nick V.
sexy mama.review:
2nd TRIP: "Really Freakin Bad!"

God I must have been drunk when I wrote the last review or when I was there cause I have never been to a sushi place that did such a 180-degree turn that it would go from 5 stars to 2 stars! Serious case of inconsistency.

2nd trip was with less spectacle and the party was just my GF and myself. We loved the sushi last time! Even the fried rolls, which I usually can't stand anywhere. We ordered the similar rolls from last time including the sexy mama, spicy tuna crunchy, ST handrolls & firecracker balls. 

Everything was crap...handrolls had 1/2 the amount of fish, rolls were drowning in spiced mayo to the point we couldn't taste the fish or finish the roll & the rice wasn't prepared correctly as it was too soft and fell apart on all rolls.  Service was not pro like the 1st time...the busboy from last time served us. This was one of very few times where we have left a personal tip for the chefs that was to tone down on the sauce.

Your inconsistency has disgraced the family Domo! 1 last chance left due to the close proximity and a once proud 5 star rating. We will likely return in a couple of months to see if they have shaped up. Domo Domo.

*******************
The last entry was actually from months ago, just wanted to divide it out from the original. 

The last time we tried Domo it came back swinging. Gone was the mayo-o-plenty and the firecracker balls were made right. Everything was fairly good so averaged with the last rating it's now moved up on this update to 3 stars.

excerpts:
Generous pours of sake (cold options a-plenty)

and some unique dishes (sexy mama roll!)
sexy mama.author: Timothy P.
sexy mama.review:
Miki and I always say we love this place mainly because it's a block away and so convenient. We say that if you were headed to this area to get sushi we'd choose Sushi Zone, but because Domo is right there and there's not the ridiculous amount of wait we often encounter at the Zone, we're very happy. 

For a time Sebo was the only sushi option on the Hayes strip, but that's not an every weekend sushi place. Domo is.

Come by Domo for decent sushi. 

Prices are good.

Generous pours of sake (cold options a-plenty)

and some unique dishes (sexy mama roll!)

Thank you Domo for setting up shop near my house.

excerpts: Firecracker balls, sexy mama roll...you cannot really go wrong here.
Cute spot and looking forward to going back!
sexy mama.author: Emma A.
sexy mama.review: VERY small but definitely worth the wait. We grabbed a beer across the street while we waited for a few seats to open up.  Everything we ordered was delicious!  Firecracker balls, sexy mama roll...you cannot really go wrong here.  Cute spot and looking forward to going back!

excerpts: My friends and I also tried a few rolls: fire cracker balls and sexy mama.
The fire crackers balls had a great crunch and if you like spicy, this should satisfy.
The sexy mama roll was different than I expected - very refreshing.
The crunch of the asparagus was great, but finished off with the yuzu cucumber and lemon slice, it was definitely something unexpected.
I finished off my meal with some black sesame ice cream.
sexy mama.author: Daphne R.
sexy mama.review:
Stopped by this Hayes Valley spot for dinner tonight. I was pleasantly surprised to see the sushi chefs behind the counter were actually Japanese. So rare to find nowadays. I sat with friends behind the counter that was looking out onto the street which was comfy for people gazing. 

To start, I ordered the Uni and Scallop crudos (choose two for $6). Both were good, but I thought the avocado on the uni competed a bit too much for my attention. I would have liked to have been able to taste the uni more. I also tried the inari nigiri and the ajitsuke hotate nigiri off the specials menu. If you like scallop, I would definitely recommend the ajitsuke hotate. It was really yummy.  My friends and I also tried a few rolls: fire cracker balls and sexy mama. The fire crackers balls had a great crunch and if you like spicy, this should satisfy. The sexy mama roll was different than I expected - very refreshing. The crunch of the asparagus was great, but finished off with the yuzu cucumber and lemon slice, it was definitely something unexpected. I finished off my meal with some black sesame ice cream. Nothing too special, but definitely different if you want to veer off the usual green tea ice cream path.

All in all, the food was reasonably priced, tasted good, and the atmosphere was comfy and relaxing. This is a great neighborhood spot.

excerpts: The tasmanian trout has been spectacular lately; I also like the Sexy Mama roll.
Rolls, nigiri, and sashimi are all splendid.
Beverages are good, if uninteresting.
sexy mama.author: Landish D.
sexy mama.review:
Domo has great fish. I've gotten take-out from them frequently, and I've never been disappointed. Seating is so tight that I've never bothered trying to get a seat -- it's a cozy sushi bar, but since I live in the area, take-out is much easier.

The tasmanian trout has been spectacular lately; I also like the Sexy Mama roll. Rolls, nigiri, and sashimi are all splendid. Beverages are good, if uninteresting.

excerpts: We then had the sexy mama which was also very tasty.
sexy mama.author: Brian L.
sexy mama.review:
We started out with the cucumber sunomono which was nice and refreshing.

We then had the kobe steak roll with asparagus.  The meat was so smooth and tasty.  We then had the sexy mama which was also very tasty.  Each roll came conveniently cut in 8 smaller bites.

We had hamachi belly and trout which were good.  The veggie croquette was also very nice.

We had a nice bottle of $10 sake.

All in all a very good meal in hayes valley.  It was $65 with tip, otherwise I would have rated it 4 stars.

excerpts: we also shared a couple rolls, including the spicy tuna and sexy mama.
sexy mama.author: Jill k.
sexy mama.review:
the one and only liz s and i came here a few months ago for a quick and early dinner.  i must say, it was good that we arrived there early, because half an hour into our meal, a line was formed!

one of the unique things about this place was their "crudos" - think amuse bouche-sized tastes.  i'm normally not a big uni fan, but their uni was great, as was the salmon one.  

we also shared a couple rolls, including the spicy tuna and sexy mama.  both were well-executed, fresh, and most importantly, tasty!

i look forward to coming to domo again, and trying more of their interesting offerings.  thanks for sharing with me, liz!

excerpts: Delicious Sexy Mama Roll, Kanpachi Carpaccio, and fresh sushi.
They run out every once in a while on the specials so get there early.
the Salmon Skin roll is also especially delicious.
It is a small-er establishment
so it is best for an intimate snack for two with some unfiltered sake.
sexy mama.author: Diana L.
sexy mama.review: Delicious Sexy Mama Roll, Kanpachi Carpaccio, and fresh sushi.  They run out every once in a while on the specials so get there early.  the Salmon Skin roll is also especially delicious.  It is a small-er establishment so it is best for an intimate snack for two with some unfiltered sake.

excerpts: Sexy mama was tasty as was the spicy tuna.
Would come back to check out the 10 lunch special.
sexy mama.author: Kelly G.
sexy mama.review:
After art class, we were craving some sushi so I mentioned Sushi Zone to the gals and we stopped by to check out the status of the line.  We were fooled by only 4 people waiting at the door, until we realized that there was a white board listing 10 other parties that were waiting for a spot in stealth mode.
Z mentioned that there was a cute spot on Hayes that we should take a look at, but it might be swanky.  The place turned out to be Sebo and as we were checking out the overpriced menu, a guy named Niko told us to walk around the block and check out Domo instead. 

We had 5 rolls and sake for the 3 of us and were decently satisfied.  The 2 hamachi rolls we had, one with jalepeno and one with out, were tiny.   Sexy mama was tasty as was the spicy tuna.   
Would come back to check out the 10 lunch special.

excerpts: The small crudos were followed by a handpicked sampling of Nigiri and two different kinds of rolls; Sexy Mama and Crunch California Roll.
sexy mama.author: Ashley Q.
sexy mama.review:
doumo, konnichiwa!  

Well Hello there!  No this Domo is not the strange creature that hatched from an egg, who is known to pass gas at the first sign of nervousness or discomfort.  Domo is a fresh new take on Japanese food in Hayes Valley.

The food at this tiny Japanese sushi bar is a mix of simple favorites complimented by trendy creative concoctions. The food is definitely worth the wait.  To pass the time order a beer or some sake, you won't be disappointed.

To start off our meal we ordered some 'small crudos'.  Individual sized servings of deliciousness.  The presentation was simple and the experience was all about the food.  The small crudos were followed by a handpicked sampling of Nigiri and two different kinds of rolls; Sexy Mama and Crunch California Roll.  The Nigiri was served up with a good fish to rice ratio and the rolls each had a signature kick.

The prices are reasonable and the food... oishii!

This place would best be enjoyed with a single companion.  The place is small and not designed for big groups, as most Sushi bars are.

Domo arigato gozaimasu!

excerpts: I got the seared albacore tataki, the fiesta roll, and the I.C. roll.
Seared albacore tataki--so spot on and so
so so delicious.
Would highly recommend you order this if you go!
The albacore slices are super generous and the ponzu sauce just completes it perfectly.
I''d definitely consider just eating this as a whole meal.
Seared albacore tataki--so spot on and so
so so delicious.
Would highly recommend you order this if you go!
The albacore slices are super generous and the ponzu sauce just completes it perfectly.
I''d definitely consider just eating this as a whole meal.
tldr; meh not as good as I think Yelp makes it out to be, though the seared albacore tataki is spot on
tldr; meh not as good as I think Yelp makes it out to be, though the seared albacore tataki is spot on
fiesta.author: Jasmine X.
fiesta.review:
Eh I wasn't a huge fan of this place, probably because although I do love Chinese food, when I'm eating Japanese food, I'm a purist at heart and can't deal with these not Japanese Japanese joints.

Anyways, I came here for dinner on Sunday right when they opened and it was insane how quickly they filled up. I got there about five minutes after opening and all the indoor seats were already taken. Luckily, they have a few tables outside which are actually really  nice since weather in SF has been pretty good. They're also more fun if you want to people watch. I also personally liked the outside seating more because the inside smelled really oily and restuaranty. 

I got the seared albacore tataki, the fiesta roll, and the I.C. roll. Part of me regrets not following what other Yelpers suggested, but I'm just not really a fan of unagi so some of the more popular rolls wouldn't have made much sense for me.

Seared albacore tataki--so spot on and so so so delicious. Would highly recommend you order this if you go! The albacore slices are super generous and the ponzu sauce just completes it perfectly. I''d definitely consider just eating this as a whole meal. It's five slices per order, so if I ever go back, I'd be down for two of these lol.

The rolls... were not so great. Pretty mediocre rolls. The fish cuts were really thin and not worth it. Rolls were fine but nothing special. I liked I.C. enough, but I honestly felt like both rolls were super mediocre. 

All in all, price came out to be about $20/person without tax which wasn't too bad since we didn't eat too much.

tldr; meh not as good as I think Yelp makes it out to be, though the seared albacore tataki is spot on

excerpts: - Fiesta roll
: This one was good.
fiesta.author: Thatcher H.
fiesta.review:
I went to grab lunch on a Friday with my friend. Ever since we saw the pictures of the fish taco, we knew we had to go to Domo. Our overall experience was nice. It felt very welcoming and comfortable. Maybe because it wasn't filled with customers. I was so excited that we didn't have to wait because I was starving. We were promptly greeted and seated at the bar as soon as we walked in.The waiter was very polite. 

What we ordered: 

- Fish Taco: So creative and delicious! It was refreshing yet satisfying. 

-Spicy Hulk roll: I personally love cucumber so I thought it was so good! 

- Crudos: Each order comes with two: we each got the scallop and salmon one. The salmon was good and fresh. The scallop one was very good and very fresh. I was surprised. 

- Fiesta roll: This one was good. It had mango it in. 

-Negi Hama roll: It was simple and good. 

Overall, everything was very fresh. I would definitely come back depending if there would be a wait.

excerpts: I was slightly taken back at how quick their service was (almost suspiciously so), but all that melted away alongside that first Fiesta roll.
My choice for the evening: Fiesta roll (deliciously fresh), spicy tuna (yummm),
fiesta.author: Nikki G.
fiesta.review:
Sunday night on a unusually warm SF night (it hits 75!), I decide to pop in at Domo with a friend.  We had to wait for 30 minutes for a table - not bad especially given the entertainment options on Laguna/Hayes.

We were given a seat by the window bar and our food was brought out within minutes of ordering.  I was slightly taken back at how quick their service was (almost suspiciously so), but all that melted away alongside that first Fiesta roll.  

My choice for the evening: Fiesta roll (deliciously fresh), spicy tuna (yummm), firecracker balls (it's like a party in your mouth), and the scallop crudo (could have done without this one...it was too chewy and lacked the buttery flavor). 

One quick tip - if you plan on coming here, do it in 2's.  There was a 3 person party that had to wait much, much longer.

excerpts:
the right kick to warrant its name, Fiesta!
-Sweet Potato:
This roll is also deceivingly tasty.
It's not as sweet as you think it'd be
fiesta.author: Lillian C.
fiesta.review:
This sushi place is DELICIOUS! 

We ordered the following rolls and I highly recommend ALL THREE: 
-Veggie: At first I was skeptical of this role since it wouldn't have any meat...but it is delicious! It could be the shiitake that gives the rolls a chewiness that mimics meat. The combination of the different flavors also make this really delicious. We liked it so much that we ordered another one!
-Fiesta: This is a great roll especially if you like tuna. It features a slight twist in the taste due to the mango and black pepper salsa, the right kick to warrant its name, Fiesta!
-Sweet Potato: This roll is also deceivingly tasty. It's not as sweet as you think it'd be so I'd give it a try.

Overall, this sushi place has very unique rolls that have an amazing taste! 

As with all sushi restaurants, I just wish that I got more food for my money!

excerpts: One of my favorites is the Mexican-inspired Fiesta roll.
Domo is popular on weekend evenings and combined with the small space, you can expect a short or long wait depending upon the size of your party.
I generally frown upon waiting more than 15 minutes for restaurants and since they don't take reservations, I always have a nearby backup.
So if you're like me and want to enjoy their delicious food, plan to go early or during a less busy week night.
fiesta.author: G B.
fiesta.review:
Their sushi, sake and service are all solid.

Ambiance: The space is small but cozy.

Service:  Friendly and staff is always willing to clarify ingredients with the chef.

Food (gluten-free dairy-free perspective): They have Tamari (which is gluten-free soy sauce) available at request.  Many of their rolls are gluten and dairy free or can be customized to be.  One of my favorites is the Mexican-inspired Fiesta roll.  Domo is popular on weekend evenings and combined with the small space, you can expect a short or long wait depending upon the size of your party.  I generally frown upon waiting more than 15 minutes for restaurants and since they don't take reservations, I always have a nearby backup.  So if you're like me and want to enjoy their delicious food, plan to go early or during a less busy week night.

excerpts:
These were some of my favorites:
Fish Tacos - tempura-fried seaweed with salmon, avocado and some kind of salsa on top
Fiesta Roll - albacore tuna, mango & cilantro with black pepper salsa

Solid place for sushi.
fiesta.author: Michele S.
fiesta.review:
Great small place for sushi.  With so many great choices in the city, it's hard to find the right balance of quality, price and ambiance.
We came here around 8pm on a Thursday night and only had to wait for about 5 minutes for 3 people.  We ordered a bunch of stuff and the bill only came out to $100 - not bad.  
These were some of my favorites:
Fish Tacos - tempura-fried seaweed with salmon, avocado and some kind of salsa on top
Fiesta Roll - albacore tuna, mango & cilantro with black pepper salsa

Solid place for sushi.

excerpts: The something fiesta.
It sounds good, but it's really average only.
I feel like Domo creates a unique menu that is exotic
and it's fun to try them.
However it's more western-influenced sushi and not so much the traditionally Japanese sushi...
and I love traditional Japanese sushi.
It wasn't bad, I am glad I got to try such an exotic combination, however I didn't plan on returning again.
fiesta.author: Natalie Charlotte W.
fiesta.review:
I've come here two times; the first time I ordered the roll that has mango in it? OH. The something fiesta. It sounds good, but it's really average only. I feel like Domo creates a unique menu that is exotic and it's fun to try them. However it's more western-influenced sushi and not so much the traditionally Japanese sushi...and I love traditional Japanese sushi. It wasn't bad, I am glad I got to try such an exotic combination, however I didn't plan on returning again. Their orders are also a little pricey.

The second time I came, I got a simple tuna roll, that was a couple dollars more than I usually spend. The only reason I dropped by again was because it was sort of in the neighborhood. 

Also the wait was really long, like 20 minutes....even though the place it's really small and there should be no reason to take that long because they're not serving a BUNCH of people. Also it's not as if they spend extra time on my food because it's not excellent tasting when it came out.

If the price was more fair, I'd give it a 3.5/5

excerpts: Our first roll was the Fiesta which has albacore tuna, mango & cilantro then is topped with black pepper salsa.
This roll was a lot of fun.
It was married Mexican food flavor with yummy sushi.
Dipping it in a tiny bit of soy sauce gave it the saltiness of tortilla chips.
fiesta.author: Kari G.
fiesta.review: Great location right off of the main drag in Hayes Valley. It was a long wait to sit inside so we snagged a seat on the patio. We had the miso soup and two rolls. Our first roll was the Fiesta which has albacore tuna, mango & cilantro then is topped with black pepper salsa. This roll was a lot of fun. It was married Mexican food flavor with yummy sushi. Dipping it in a tiny bit of soy sauce gave it the saltiness of tortilla chips. Our second roll was the Spicy Hulk which had spicy tuna & avocado, tobiko and was wrapped in a cucumber sheet with ponzu. Both rolls were good. It still can't compete with my favorite spot down in Foster City, but I'd be open to coming back.

excerpts: The I.C. and Fiesta rolls are my favorite (Fiesta roll, literally a party in your mouth).
fiesta.author: maggie w.
fiesta.review:
Domo is delicious.  Fresh fish, great service, creative menu.  The I.C. and Fiesta rolls are my favorite (Fiesta roll, literally a party in your mouth).  I love the hint of citrus in all of their rolls creating complex delicious flavors. 

 I would have given them 5 stars but for the fact that the menu is slightly overpriced.  But then again, you get what you pay for and the sashimi pretty much melts in your mouth. Nom nom nom.

excerpts: Some of my favorite dishes include the Hawaiian Style Tuna Poké, Spicy Tuna, Spicy Hulk and Fiesta.
Make sure to check out the specials board because I've had several delicious rolls from there as well.
fiesta.author: Joanna V.
fiesta.review:
Domo is hands-down my favorite hayes valley sushi place. Yes, it is small but I like it that way. It has a nice atmosphere and the staff is always friendly and spot on. The specials never have let me down. They also let you do take out which is nice for those days you wanna grab a roll and eat at home. 

The rolls are pricey but the quality is well worth it. Some of my favorite dishes include the Hawaiian Style Tuna Poké, Spicy Tuna, Spicy Hulk and Fiesta. Make sure to check out the specials board because I've had several delicious rolls from there as well.

excerpts: Our favorites of the night were the fiesta roll and the crunchy California roll.
As for amount, we ordered 5 sets of rolls for two small/medium adult appetites, which was about 1 set too much.
fiesta.author: Laura M.
fiesta.review:
First, I love that they let you leave a phone number on the wait list. This is a small courtesy that has a big impact, and it definitely influences my mood when my table is ready (as in, did I stand around making half-hearted chitchat for x minutes, or did I get to take a stroll and pop into a bar for a quick drink). Great start.

Second, the space is very cozy. Some would say small, which is true, but when it is small in a way that feels good, I go with cozy.
