The great part of a small joint is that the noise level is low, the service is very attentive, and it makes the whole experience feel very intimate (date night!). We sat at the bar facing the street, which I think is the superior spot since you get to people watch yet still have the warmth and comfort of sitting inside.

Third, the food is delicious. We went to Domo because I was having a major tuna and avocado craving, so most of our rolls had those elements. Usually we try to get at least one new thing, and a mix of rolls and nigiri, but this time we focused in on tuna or avocado flavors and stuck with rolls. Our favorites of the night were the fiesta roll and the crunchy California roll. As for amount, we ordered 5 sets of rolls for two small/medium adult appetites, which was about 1 set too much. We also each had a beer.

Overall, the whole experience at Domo was wonderful. We were treated well and enjoyed a delicious dinner, and we will surely be back.

excerpts: Fiesta Roll & Fire Cracker Balls..
DELICIOUS!
also would recommend the Crudos - but
they're bite sized so more of a novelty than filling.
fiesta.author: Ketki W.
fiesta.review: Fiesta Roll & Fire Cracker Balls..DELICIOUS! also would recommend the Crudos - but they're bite sized so more of a novelty than filling.

excerpts: My friend ordered the Fiesta Roll but that just didn't work because its mexican japanese fusion... with salsa and not enough albacore tuna.
Should have known better... besides that everything else was good even though its not authentic.
fiesta.author: Julia T.
fiesta.review:
Martin Luther King Jr. Day Plans: Sleep in, finish Kendra's Sliding Into Home, and lunch with friends. 

But who knew so many places were be closed on a Monday for lunch?! All of my neighborhood spots: Little Star, Eiji, Limon, etc.

A search on Yelp found Domo who was not only open but had lunch specials (sushi rice plates).

Domo is in such a cute neighborhood with cafes, shops and clean streets. Earthbody Spa is right across. 

We opted to sit outside since there are no tables inside. 

We all got a lunch special for $13 that includes a soup and salad. Tea is also free! I got the "Open Face Dragon" that came with two big pieces of tempura shrimp, unagi, and avocado over sushi rice. 

My friend ordered the Fiesta Roll but that just didn't work because its mexican japanese fusion... with salsa and not enough albacore tuna. Should have known better... besides that everything else was good even though its not authentic.

excerpts: The Fiesta Roll was refreshing and a interesting take on Mexican-Japanese fusion.
Had 2 orders of the Yellow fin Belly, sooooo good.
The Butterfish nigiri was super fresh.
Sushi is all about the rice
and I forget how good it is made here.
fiesta.author: Sean B.
fiesta.review:
Came here with a couple friends to celebrate and its just as good as the last time. The Ankimo appetizer needed a touch of Japanese sea salt, didn't taste seasoned enough although the thinly sliced cucumber added a perfect crunch. The Wagyu Beef roll needs a little less avocado and the meat seemed a little on the tougher side - maybe add some crab in the middle and call it surf n turf. The Tacos were surprisingly good, crunchy with great flavors and the salmon was cooked perfect. The Fiesta Roll was refreshing and a interesting take on Mexican-Japanese fusion. Had 2 orders of the Yellow fin Belly, sooooo good. The Butterfish nigiri was super fresh. Sushi is all about the rice and I forget how good it is made here. Keep up the good work Domo. 

Atmosphere: Tiny but they have outdoor seating and usually doesn't take that long on weekdays. Farely Hip. They need to stop putting specials on the mirror cant read it.  
Service: Smiling faces.
Sake: Kinda pricey went with the hot Sho chiku Bai and an Asahi Black.
Cost: $125
Overall Score: 4

excerpts: My least favorite is proabably the Fiesta roll - mango and cilantro with the tuna doesn't taste quite right to me.
fiesta.author: glen o.
fiesta.review:
This is probably my favorite sushi place in Hayes Valley.  The place is really small but I've never waited too long for a table.  Service is always great and friendly.

I've had the spicy tuna and scallop crudos.  The spicy tuna was great but the scallop was a little bland.

I love rolls so I usually get the rolls at this place.  The firecracker ball and domo rolls just melt in your mouth - my favorites.  Cruchy spicy tuna, spider, and the spicy hulk rolls are also very good.   My least favorite is proabably the Fiesta roll - mango and cilantro with the tuna doesn't taste quite right to me.

They also have a couple of tables outside which is great during spring and summetime.

excerpts: Fiesta: 1/5
Yuck.
I guess I don't like mango pieces in rolls.
It tasted a bit disturbing with the fish and I ended up pulling the mango pieces out in the end and dousing this roll with soy sauce and wasabi.
fiesta.author: Julie S.
fiesta.review:
I think Domo served some of the best non-authentic "fun" sushi I've had in San Francisco!  One thing I always complain about is how San Francisco lacks good sushi.  I'm talking about delicious L.A.-style sushi.  You know, the trendy, fun sushi that you eat at Katsuya while people-watching.  For me, Domo served this purpose... except without the celebrities and celebutantes... 

It was a Saturday night and we had made dinner reservations at a different place in Hayes Valley and were STARVING.  To our dismay, we learned out our table would not be ready for awhile since other diners were lagging, so we decided to walk around Hayes Valley.  I wasn't even craving sushi at the time, but saw Domo and instantly started to think about how delicious it could be.  We put our names on the list and - lucky us! - were able to get seats at the inside bar area within a few minutes!

Please note that I can't speak to the quality of the sashimi or nigiri because we were STARVING so we just shared rolls (more bang for our buck), but the rolls are outstanding if you are in the mood for that!

We ordered the following:

Firecracker balls: 5/5 REaLLy tasty!  Don't expect to really taste the fish and to love the firecracker balls as sushi, but still expect to love them.  They're SO flavorful!  And deliciously spicy.  No wasabi or soy sauce needed.

Spicy hulk:  5/5 One thing Domo does REALLY well is its spicy tuna!  Get as much of it as you can!  I usually don't like rolls wrapped in cucumber rather than rice, but the spicy hulk was SO good!  Again, perfectly spicy and tasty - no wasabi or soy sauce needed.

Crunchy spicy tuna: 4.5/5 Also delicious, again because of the outstanding spicy tuna.  Would definitely get this again.

Jalapeno hamachi: 3/5 Decent.  We didn't love it, but it was still decent.  The chunks of jalapeno were a bit much, I thought.  My eyes started to water a bit.  I wouldn't get this roll again.

Fiesta: 1/5  Yuck.  I guess I don't like mango pieces in rolls.  It tasted a bit disturbing with the fish and I ended up pulling the mango pieces out in the end and dousing this roll with soy sauce and wasabi.  Definitely would not get this again.

Fish taco appetizer:  This dish gets probs for how creatively it is put together.  The taco "shell" is made of seaweed and tempura batter.  I am going to refrain from giving this a rating since I HATE salmon and didn't realize, in our ordering frenzy (don't judge me), that there was salmon in here.  My dinner companion liked this, though, and he's a salmon fan.

Overall, I really enjoyed my dinner at Domo.  We shared a bottle of unfiltered sake, which made for a fun evening:)  

Just a tip:  I don't recommend coming here if you have more than 2 people because I think it's pretty hard to get a table.  This place is TINY.

excerpts: Had very nice maguro sashimi, good seaweed salad, ok fiesta roll (tuna w/ salsa and mango), and an ok to disappointing seared kobe beef roll.
Veggie croquette was tasty (duh! fried goodness), but my FAVORITE part of the meal was the ice cream!
Black sesame and green tea ice cream
Loved that the green tea ice cream wasn't too intensely flavored, and the sesame was sweet and unique.
fiesta.author: Priscilla T.
fiesta.review:
4 stars for the experience, 3 stars for my opinion of the food (my bf would disagree and say 4 stars though).

We got lucky and came at the right time on a Wednesday night so we didn't have to wait for a seat.  The place is small but not claustrophobic.  I liked the lighting and the vibe, and it was fun watching the sushi chefs at work.

Had very nice maguro sashimi, good seaweed salad, ok fiesta roll (tuna w/ salsa and mango), and an ok to disappointing seared kobe beef roll.  Veggie croquette was tasty (duh! fried goodness), but my FAVORITE part of the meal was the ice cream!  Black sesame and green tea ice cream :) Loved that the green tea ice cream wasn't too intensely flavored, and the sesame was sweet and unique.

excerpts:
Crispy spicy tuna, Fiesta, Spicy Hulk, Jalepeño Hamachi
+ Nigiri: Shiro Maguro, Maguro and Blue Fin
My friend was raving about the crisply spicy tuna roll but for me, the Spicy Hulk takes the cake.
I love anything tuna and avocado
so I was immediately interested.
When it arrived, it caught my eye.
It was so elegantly wrapped in a handmade cucumber shell.
It's the perfect meal...healthy, tasty and refreshing!
Go Spicy Hulk!
fiesta.author: Karlyn N.
fiesta.review:
We decided on Domo over Serpentine and boy was I happy! I love it when going to sushi surprises and delights.

At first I was kind of shocked at how small it was but was glad we were the first ones there. Small places are fun as long as you're not the one waiting for days.

Here is what we ordered:
+ Rolls: Crispy spicy tuna, Fiesta, Spicy Hulk, Jalepeño Hamachi
+ Nigiri: Shiro Maguro, Maguro and Blue Fin

My friend was raving about the crisply spicy tuna roll but for me, the Spicy Hulk takes the cake. I love anything tuna and avocado so I was immediately interested. When it arrived, it caught my eye. It was so elegantly wrapped in a handmade cucumber shell. It's the perfect meal...healthy, tasty and refreshing! Go Spicy Hulk!

Looking forward to going back again soon.

excerpts: I affirmatively did not like the fiesta roll.
Pico de gallo on sushi turns my stomach.
With that said, all the fish was fresh and delicious!
The service was bleh -
I didn't feel at all valued.
It was a little on the pricey side, but that wouldn't prevent my return.
I think I'd choose Otoro down the street though.
fiesta.author: Andrew K.
fiesta.review: Domo: I liked you. You're small - so only dinner for 2 please. The rainbow roll was the standout, but we had a lot, including carpaccio, spicy crunchy tuna roll, sake nigiri, and the kobe beef. I affirmatively did not like the fiesta roll.  Pico de gallo on sushi turns my stomach. With that said, all the fish was fresh and delicious! The service was bleh - I didn't feel at all valued. It was a little on the pricey side, but that wouldn't prevent my return. I think I'd choose Otoro down the street though.

excerpts: I love their rolls, especially the Spicy Tuna, the Fiesta, and the Hulk!
The service is very friendly.
The only thing I don't like is the fishy smell you get on your clothes.
But now I dine on an outdoor table!
Problem solved!
fiesta.author: Emilie P.
fiesta.review: My favorite sushi restaurant in San Francisco. I love their rolls, especially the Spicy Tuna, the Fiesta, and the Hulk! The service is very friendly. The only thing I don't like is the fishy smell you get on your clothes. But now I dine on an outdoor table! Problem solved!

excerpts: fiesta (special)
- this was delicious.
Mango, shrimp, roe... and other stuff.
It is a party in your mouth.

wasabi peas - enough wasabi for flavour, but it wasn't overpowering
edamame - good edamame.
Nice edamame.
fiesta.author: Catriona C.
fiesta.review:
I so very much enjoyed my meal at Domo last night. And the gallon of sake we drank. And the Sapporo. But not so much the hangover this morning...

This place is tiny. It really doesn't suit large parties of people. Four of us showed up and we had a seriously long wait to get a seat along the wall (when I say along the wall, thats really the only option bar one table in the corner). Seeing as the couple occupying our space were on the way to an adventure of the horizontal sorts, it took some time to get us seated. On the upside however, the waiter was clearly embarrassed to have us waiting on the side. I like it when I see that people really care about me and my feelings. 

So once we were seated, we got to the menu. We ordered (along with a nice ginjo): 

salmon and spicy tuna crudos - tuna - very spicy. Its the first time my food has been served in a soup spoon... and I feel like I have gone up the world
firecracker balls - delicious and worth every rave review
sexy mama - I love any roll that uses lemon. This one did not see me wrong
dragon - its a dragon roll. You can't go wrong really. 
jalapeno hamachi - 3/4 members of the party gagged on the power of the chilli. I, however thought that the flavour of the hamachi and the jalapeno worked really well together. For me, a win! And I got the last one as a result :)
fiesta (special) - this was delicious. Mango, shrimp, roe... and other stuff. It is a party in your mouth. 
wasabi peas - enough wasabi for flavour, but it wasn't overpowering
edamame - good edamame. Nice edamame. Still crunchy and flavourful

All in all, there wasn't a single part of the meal that I didn't enjoy and for that I have to give it the full five. It was definitely well worth the wait. I just wish it was a little bit larger. There is outdoor seating, which can work for larger groups but when its windy and SF is still recovering from Winter, it's not so appropriate sans outdoor heaters.

excerpts: The fiesta roll sounded interesting because I like tuna, mango and cilantro, but it's actually kind of weird to have salsa on your sushi
so I'll never order that roll again.
We also ordered the spider roll and one other that I forget the name of; I liked both of them and found that everything tasted fresh with a great mix of spices and flavors.
I can't wait to go back and try some of the other rolls!
fiesta.author: Natalie M.
fiesta.review: I was worried we would have to wait a really long time since we were a party of five and there's only one table in addition to bar seating. Luckily, we only waited ten minutes, at the very most and then we did our best to fit around the table with all of our water glasses and plates- it was a tight squeeze, and our waiter did his best to accommodate our group. We ordered the Hamachi Cappachio to start and this was my favorite out of all the sushi we tried- it was very fresh and the flavors were great. The fiesta roll sounded interesting because I like tuna, mango and cilantro, but it's actually kind of weird to have salsa on your sushi so I'll never order that roll again. We also ordered the spider roll and one other that I forget the name of; I liked both of them and found that everything tasted fresh with a great mix of spices and flavors. I can't wait to go back and try some of the other rolls!

excerpts: The roll was a little hot when we received it, so we let it cool down for a minute, but then.....nothing but a fiesta in my mouth!
fiesta.author: Alyssa G.
fiesta.review:
I loved their rolls! Couldn't get enough, and my friend and I ended up ordering 3 rolls, and 3 different Nigiris. To start out, we had the hot sake, always a must, when chatting about dirtbag guys and catching up with friends.  Then came the edemame, which were always a plus. Edamame is always good when they aren't overcooked, slightly crunchy and mildly salty. On to the rolls. My favorite was definitely the spider roll, it was so light but incredibly flavorful. Next on my list would be the crunchy california roll, which was great! The roll was a little hot when we received it, so we let it cool down for a minute, but then.....nothing but a fiesta in my mouth!
Our third roll was the Spicy Hulk...a variation of the spicy tuna roll. It also was delicious, but a little big to eat in one bite. More like 3 bites. Ok, so finally we got around to the nigiri, because we were still hungry after the three rolls. We ordered the scallop, salmon and tuna rolls. They were all really fresh, which is what makes or breaks the whole experience. It's easy to spot day-old fish, and there was none of that here. Loved the little bar facing the street, and the music was really great. Even though I was talking and talking with my friend throughout the meal, I paused and enjoyed the great mix of house/lounge-esque music in the background.

The waitstaff were really nice, and patient as it took us a while to decide what we finally wanted to order. Definitely coming back soon!

excerpts:
Firecracker balls, Fiesta roll, Mango and black pepper

For the vegans: veggie croquettes, seaweed salad, sweet potato roll, shitake roll and the veggie roll.
fiesta.author: Viola B.
fiesta.review:
Best sushi, hands down.  Everyone I have taken here falls in love with this place. 

Very fresh, fast and friendly.  Prices are good too compared to other places.   The chefs are so fun to watch and there is one there that is so cute.  He talks to you while he is creating these little art pieces.  They play good music and it is just a fun experience. 

Why are they outstanding?  Firecracker balls, Fiesta roll, Mango and black pepper

For the vegans: veggie croquettes, seaweed salad, sweet potato roll, shitake roll and the veggie roll.  OMG the veggie roll is so good!   It has all the different flavors that come together in the roll, just like sushi should.  

You will leave very happy and be back very soon.

excerpts: Those things would be: The Fiesta Roll (not on the menu, currently written on the wall - get there before it goes away!)
Salsa and mango in sushi?
Absurdly good.
Crispy spicy tuna (also not on the menu): holy crap.
$9.60 of intense flavor and great textures!
Comes on an extra long plate, and the pieces of the roll barely fit into my mouth.
It's super filling and very indulgent.
The nigiri is always very good and fresh tasting.
I've tried to be more adventurous in my fish consumption - the Tazmanian Trout is a new favorite.
fiesta.author: Kat M.
fiesta.review:
Where to begin....  My first time at Domo I wasn't terribly impressed, but it's been consistently awesome every time I went back.  I guess I figured out the right things to order.
Those things would be: The Fiesta Roll (not on the menu, currently written on the wall - get there before it goes away!)  Salsa and mango in sushi?  Absurdly good.
Crispy spicy tuna (also not on the menu): holy crap.  $9.60 of intense flavor and great textures!  Comes on an extra long plate, and the pieces of the roll barely fit into my mouth.  It's super filling and very indulgent.  
The nigiri is always very good and fresh tasting.  I've tried to be more adventurous in my fish consumption - the Tazmanian Trout is a new favorite.
The Spicy Hulk roll is fun and tasty.  Using cucumber as a wrapper is inventive and I wanted to lick the sauce off the plate.
The Rock and Roll is a good standard unagi roll.
The Jalepeno Hamachi is another good combo - I really like the bright flavor of the pepper mixed with the fish.
My vegetarian friend has good things to say about the veggie stuff.  We both like the edamame.  
The service is brisk and efficient.  I prefer the female server we've gotten the past few times over the guy who served my friend and I tonight.  
Can't wait to keep eating my way through the Domo menu!

excerpts: We ordered miso soup, a crunchy california roll, a Domo roll, and a Temptation roll.
Our personal favorite was the Domo roll, I would highly recommend you get that if you come here!
temptation.author: James D.
temptation.review:
Came here this past Thursday and was blown away with how good the sushi tasted!

It's a small restaurant so expect a wait, but it's completely worth it once you get in. They also have outdoor seating as well in front of the restaurant.

We ordered miso soup, a crunchy california roll, a Domo roll, and a Temptation roll. Everything came out super quick to us!

I've tried a good amount of sushi places in San Francisco, but the minute I tasted our first roll I was absolutely SOLD on this place as being one of the best sushi restaurants in SF. The sushi tasted fresh, flavorful, and the prices were very comparable to other sushi in the city.

Our personal favorite was the Domo roll, I would highly recommend you get that if you come here! 

No doubt that we will be repeat customers.

excerpts: For our rolls, we tried the Wiki Wiki and the Temptation; I thought both showcased fresh fish and were not overly covered in sauce.
I enjoyed the shiitake mushroom tempura in the Wiki Wiki, and the shrimp tempura in the Temptation roll was crispy yet not greasy.
I will definitely be back!
temptation.author: Keith H.
temptation.review:
Domo is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in San Francisco, and I have not had a disappointing meal there so far.  It's a small space, so during peak dinner hours there can be a wait.  There is indoor and outdoor seating, though I think it can be variable whether they are sitting customers outside or not.  

During my last meal, my friend and I decided to share a few appetizers and rolls.  The seaweed salad was solid, but I was more impressed with the fish taco: they somehow found a way to combine salmon, avocado, salsa, albacore tuna, and sriracha sauce on a sheet of what looked like tempura-fried nori.  It was a somewhat messy endeavor to eat it all, but it was definitely worth the trouble.  We also tried the firecracker, which involved panko-crusted spicy tuna balls fried and covered with unagi sauce, spicy mayo, and sriracha.  I thought this was tasty, though the fish taco was definitely the standout.   

For our rolls, we tried the Wiki Wiki and the Temptation; I thought both showcased fresh fish and were not overly covered in sauce.  I enjoyed the shiitake mushroom tempura in the Wiki Wiki, and the shrimp tempura in the Temptation roll was crispy yet not greasy. I will definitely be back!

excerpts:
- Would be a 5 if topped with poke instead of salsa
Dynamite mussels - 4/5
Fire tuna balls - 3/5 - 
Temptation roll - 4/5 - So much crab
temptation.author: Mark O.
temptation.review:
Dinner review. 

Chicken Karaage - 3/5
Fish tacos - 4/5 - Would be a 5 if topped with poke instead of salsa
Dynamite mussels - 4/5
Fire tuna balls - 3/5 - 
Temptation roll - 4/5 - So much crab
Domo roll - 4/5

Overall, great sushi place. "I'm a fan."

excerpts: Food ordered: classic yellow tail roll and temptation roll.
temptation.author: Sam B.
temptation.review:
I understand why people get excited about the lunch (Lots of food for $14). It's a small quick spot, sushi is mediocre. They don't tell you the crab is premixed and sweet. Service was just ok, surprising for such a small place. Would not go back. 

Food ordered: classic yellow tail roll and temptation roll.

excerpts: Our favorite is definitely the Temptation roll and the Kobe beef roll is also worth trying.
The best way to do it is order a couple rolls and share.
Highly recommend to people who love sushi.
Plus the sashimi is delicious - tastes super fresh.
Try the Otoro/Toro!
Perfect fattiness.
If there's a long wait, try asking for outdoor seating and bring a jacket.
Otherwise, be prepared for around a 30 minute wait.
temptation.author: Haley A.
temptation.review: This is me and my boyfriend's go-to date night sushi place! We've been here at least four times now and have tried almost every roll on the menu! Our favorite is definitely the Temptation roll and the Kobe beef roll is also worth trying. The best way to do it is order a couple rolls and share. Highly recommend to people who love sushi. Plus the sashimi is delicious - tastes super fresh. Try the Otoro/Toro! Perfect fattiness. If there's a long wait, try asking for outdoor seating and bring a jacket. Otherwise, be prepared for around a 30 minute wait.

excerpts: The temptation roll was devoured fast: shrimp tempura, unagi, avocado and crab.
temptation.author: Janice C.
temptation.review:
Domo is the place for all things fresh (FISH!) in Hayes Valley. 

This cozy sushi spot is worth the parking headaches or Muni ickiness. There's usually a wait since they don't take reservations, but 30 min wasn't bad. Gladly squeeze yourself in between patrons at the almost non-existent waiting area and hold onto your green tea while you warm your hands up. 

The best seats are actually the ones facing Laguna to check out the street action, but we liked our corner sushi bar chairs.

Despite being run by non-Japanese folks and having more "saucy" rolls on the menu, the fish is very fresh and the place is neat and clean.  Loved the Old School Negi Hama and Salmon Citron rolls (the shiso was a nice touch!) The temptation roll was devoured fast: shrimp tempura, unagi, avocado and crab. You really can't go wrong with that combo. 

Walked out into the cool San Francisco night with a warm feeling and a full belly. Domo Arigato!

excerpts: The temptation roll (had a creamy crab taste) and domo roll were yummy.
temptation.author: Beth H.
temptation.review:
I came here with a group of four at 830pm. We waited around 30 minutes as it had super limited space, like everything around downtown SF. 

Food: a friend from my group knew the guy behind the bar and he was super nice and let us try a variety of appetizers. The memorable ones were the Hawaiian style tuna poke (very unique dish, loved the mix of tuna, seaweed, and fish eggs), Uni (he gave us a good portion of Uni on spoons), fish tacos (the variety of fishes on this taco made this dish so delicious). I would highly recommend trying out appetizers, the blend of ingredients in these dishes made them so delicious.

Aside from appetizers we also got some rolls. The temptation roll (had a creamy crab taste) and domo roll were yummy. 

Definitely try to come with a group and share a variety of plates as each plate is very unique in its own way. Very different than a normal sushi bar.

excerpts: The crunchy California roll and Temptation were my favorite.
temptation.author: Coralie S.
temptation.review: Great sushi place! Pretty small so there is usually some wait. The crunchy California roll and Temptation were my favorite.

excerpts: Get the temptation roll, soo good, and the fish tacos.
Also I had read reviews about the fried octopus special-
got it and didn't like it at all so
wouldn't get that.
But everything else I have gotten has been great
temptation.author: Kelli L.
temptation.review: Favorite sushi place in the city. Super small, don't  recommend going in groups larger than 2. Get the temptation roll, soo good, and the fish tacos. Also I had read reviews about the fried octopus special- got it and didn't like it at all so wouldn't get that. But everything else I have gotten has been great

excerpts: We had Crunchy California, Fire Ball and Temptation Roll, plus Chef's Sushi selection.
temptation.author: Dom G.
temptation.review:
Thanks to Yelp, we found another good Sushi Place close by our area. 

   We got here on the Wednesday cold evening so there were no line or no long waiting. The service was decent but the best part of all is the food itself.

 We had Crunchy California, Fire Ball and Temptation Roll, plus Chef's Sushi selection. They're all good. 

  We will definitely coming back for more.

excerpts: I particularly love the temptation roll, the dragon roll, and the Domo roll.
While some of them don't wow me
temptation.author: Nathan B.
temptation.review:
I've been coming to Domo since I discovered it was down the street.  It's a small restaurant, so you'll need to get cozy unless you're fortunate enough to be seated outside on a nice warm evening.  It's a good value and has great service.

The lunch specials are a great value.  I sometimes pick up two or three for myself and have lunch, dinner, and then another lunch.  

The nigiri is really nice, and they have a nice selection of fresh fish.  The sashimi is great too.  They frequently have butterfish (walu), which is one of my personal favorites, along with monkfish liver and uni.  All worth getting when available.  Definitely check out the specials too, as the hamachi kama is wonderful.

While I'm not a huge fan of sushi rolls, the rolls here are something special.  I particularly love the temptation roll, the dragon roll, and the Domo roll.  While some of them don't wow me, I have enjoyed all that I have tasted.

There is only one menu item that I've tried that I'm not a fan of, and that's the fish tacos.  It's a fusion confusion dish, and while some of the individual flavors are nice, it doesn't quite come together.

While it can be a wait to eat here, they do to-go orders quickly.  If you live around the corner like me!  An awesome way to have a perfect sushi experience at home.

excerpts: My Friend tried the Temptation and she said it is a MUST Try as well.
temptation.author: Ed R.
temptation.review:
I am a fan now - the service was quick and excellent and the food was very good. 
Kobe: Excellent appetizer, very fresh and tastes great
Spicy Hulk: MUST TRY - really different and tastes excellent, specially if you want a roll without rice. 
My Friend tried the Temptation and she said it is a MUST Try as well. 

I will definitely go back... 

Note: place is small and not fit for large groups - they only have one table of 4 and the rest is a bar seating.

excerpts: We also had the fire cracker balls and temptation roll, both of which were good, but I don't think the fire cracker balls lived up to all the hype I saw in all the other reviews.
Next time I think I'll try coming around 5:30PM or 8PM
temptation.author: Shang S.
temptation.review:
SF has good sushi, so Domo has a lot of competition. Domo's sushi? Excellent, excellent! The wait? Terribly long - 45 minutes. I got some water while waiting, and if you don't mind the cold, you can sit outside. There is the regular menu, and there are also tons of specials. The pace of eating at this restaurant is unhurried in typical California style. 

The small crudos I think are one of the highlights here. We had the ankimo as well as the spicy tuna, both excellent, and down in one or two bites (though we shared)

We sat right at the counter and watched the chef personally craft each role. He was very nice and also told us quickly what wasn't available.

My favorite roll was actually a simple one - the salmon avocado and lemon. I liked the sweet tanginess the lemon lended to the roll. We also had the fire cracker balls and temptation roll, both of which were good, but I don't think the fire cracker balls lived up to all the hype I saw in all the other reviews. Next time I think I'll try coming around 5:30PM or 8PM

excerpts: We ordered Domo, Kobe Beef, Sexy Mama, Temptation, Hamachi and Salmon sashimi and 2 orders of crudos.
The only thing that was memorable was the uni and scallop crudos, the rest of the food was ok, no wow factors.
I've definitely had better versions of the same things elsewhere but here, the portion was smaller.
For the price, I should have gone to Ichi, for better services and food.
temptation.author: Lulu C.
temptation.review:
Came here with a good friend last week, due to the good Yelp reviews. We got there at 5:30ish on a week night, it's a fairly small place and the only table available was for 3 ppl so we were sent to the waiting area (they would have earned 1 more star if they let us seated at that 3 ppl table, not to mention that table was unoccupied the whole hour while we were there). We had a movie to catch afterwards so although it was chilly, we decided to sit outside. 

We ordered Domo, Kobe Beef, Sexy Mama, Temptation, Hamachi and Salmon sashimi and 2 orders of crudos. The only thing that was memorable was the uni and scallop crudos, the rest of the food was ok, no wow factors. I've definitely had better versions of the same things elsewhere but here, the portion was smaller. For the price, I should have gone to Ichi, for better services and food.

excerpts:
We ordered the Temptation, Domo, Kobe Beef, and Chef's choice Sashimi

Temptation: everything i always want in one roll!!!
temptation.author: Ashley H.
temptation.review:
Ok Domo is hella bomb!
Went here last night and cant wait to go again. This place is SUPER small. So its great for a date. All the seats are bar style around the window and counter. I'm guessing maybe 14 people can fit in here at one time...max. the atmoshpere is energetic but quiet because there are a lot of people in  small space. the service is good too. we sat down less than 5 minuets afer walking in and sat in a little edge on the wall. i think we were both blocking someones  chair but nobody was going any where and we would have gladly moved for someone to exit.  the timing is a little off but the food made up for it. we got our edamame right before the first roll so we didnt have time to enjoy it before we dug into the main event. from there the domo roll took a little long to get out but then again it was cooked may have needed a little more love than the other rolls. 

We ordered the Temptation, Domo, Kobe Beef, and Chef's choice Sashimi

Temptation: everything i always want in one roll!!! i love it! it was pretty small. about 6 pieces but it was delicious!

Sashimi: well it was fresh and it was good but there were only two pieces of each type of fish so it wasnt very satisfying. and i have had fresher sashimi before but that doesnt mean theres wasnt spot on good. 

Domo: Took a little longer to come out. Just the right amount of spicey mayo. I love the baked rolls and the presentation was the best ive probably seen in a baked roll.
 
Kobe Beef:  while everything was super great and yummy we werent quite full yet so we decided to order one more roll. No rice, just steak. Thats just about as americanized sushi can get. it was soo good but i doubt i would get it again. it was nice to try.

overall a great experience.

excerpts: The Temptation roll sounded great, but was just ok.
It looked nice but the flavors were not much better than grocery store sushi.
temptation.author: J C.
temptation.review:
So-so sushi. The menu and the way things are described makes the place sound absolutely delicious. But the actual sushi was so-so. The Temptation roll sounded great, but was just ok. It looked nice but the flavors were not much better than grocery store sushi. The nigiri were all a little fishy, and the salmon had tough sinews in them, which was surprising because even grocery store salmon is usually at least relatively tender.

High hopes based on the way the place sounds and looks, but disappointingly so-so food.

excerpts: We shared edamame which was properly cooked, and my friend had several pieces of nigiri and a temptation roll.
Great service.
Great green tea - it's the nutty kind, I can't remember what it's called.
temptation.author: Alyssa A.
temptation.review: Ate outside with a high school friend last night. Ordered a sweet potato roll and a dragon roll, which comes with shrimp tempura, cucumber, eel, and roe (hold the avo - unfortunately, it doesn't agree with me). The sweet potato was so yummy and topped with some kind of sauce. I've never had eel before and the dragon roll was amazing. We shared edamame which was properly cooked, and my friend had several pieces of nigiri and a temptation roll. Great service. Great green tea - it's the nutty kind, I can't remember what it's called.

excerpts: Firecracker Balls, Temptation Roll and Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll seem to be our favorites.
temptation.author: Jenna L.
temptation.review: Intimate dining, good service. Small place, but we haven't been there once and not been able to find seating. This has become our new "go-to" sushi spot in the city.- a guaranteed satisfied belly. Firecracker Balls, Temptation Roll and Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll seem to be our favorites.

excerpts: I usually get some yellowtail or white albacore nigiri as well to start off, and then top it off with some rolls, like the mighty Temptation roll.
temptation.author: Keyvan R.
temptation.review:
Solid Japanese food at a great neighborhood joint. I've been there twice and really like the crudos, especially the crab crudo. I usually get some yellowtail or white albacore nigiri as well to start off, and then top it off with some rolls, like the mighty Temptation roll. The sexy mama's pretty good as well. I'm not a big fan of spicy food, so I stayed away from the firecracker balls, but people tell they're worth it. 

I've eaten there twice, once on a Saturday night that surprisingly had no wait. Well worth a try...

excerpts: I like the temptation roll, which was crispy and filled with unagi-goodness.
temptation.author: Shay F.
temptation.review:
I heard somewhere before that the chef at Domo actually started Blowfish, so I was slightly hesitant on giving this place a lot of credit.  

No hate, just being honest.  Blowfish didn't blow, it was just ... you know, okay.  Like sushi purgatory.

Anyway, Domo was a really nice surprise.  The venue is a little small, so DO NOT try to bring a big party or you'll have a big fail moment.  I like the temptation roll, which was crispy and filled with unagi-goodness.  The fatty tuna was good but didn't seem as fresh as other places, and the other fares were also delish like the seaweed salad, firecracker balls, etc.

If you're up for an intimate date place, this is a good choice.

excerpts: We ordered 3 rolls: Temptation, Rock n Roll, Spider Roll, and also ordered the Sashimi combination.
I loved how everything was very tasty, wasnt too bland or anything like that.
temptation.author: M W.
temptation.review:
yummy yummy yummy! 

I came here for dinner last night w/ the bf and was very satisfied. We ordered 3 rolls: Temptation, Rock n Roll, Spider Roll, and also ordered the Sashimi combination. I loved how everything was very tasty, wasnt too bland or anything like that. Their tempura was cooked perfectly, not too little or too much breading, but just perfect!

The sashimi was soooooooooo fresh, it felt as if it was literally melting in my mouth.... MMmmmmmMmmm :) 

The space is quite small and was filled throughout the entire night. I am a bit bummed that I would only be able to come here with 2-3 people and not as a huge group. They definitely used every inch of space to the max! Our waitress was super friendly and business was excellent. This place is definitely a great addition to the neighborhood.

excerpts: We ordered miso soup, a crunchy california roll, a Domo roll, and a Temptation roll.
Our personal favorite was the Domo roll, I would highly recommend you get that if you come here!
crunchy california roll.author: James D.
crunchy california roll.review:
Came here this past Thursday and was blown away with how good the sushi tasted!

It's a small restaurant so expect a wait, but it's completely worth it once you get in. They also have outdoor seating as well in front of the restaurant.

We ordered miso soup, a crunchy california roll, a Domo roll, and a Temptation roll. Everything came out super quick to us!

I've tried a good amount of sushi places in San Francisco, but the minute I tasted our first roll I was absolutely SOLD on this place as being one of the best sushi restaurants in SF. The sushi tasted fresh, flavorful, and the prices were very comparable to other sushi in the city.

Our personal favorite was the Domo roll, I would highly recommend you get that if you come here! 

No doubt that we will be repeat customers.

excerpts: The crunchy California roll was delish.
You must try!
crunchy california roll.author: Victoria W.
crunchy california roll.review: So good! Small restaurant, so expect to be elbow to elbow, but ambiance is good and food is really good so yo won't mind the cozy seating. The crunchy California roll was delish. You must try!

excerpts: We also had the Crunchy California roll, it had a nice texture to it and the spicy mayo was a nice touch.
crunchy california roll.author: Jackson T.
crunchy california roll.review:
Before heading out the Opera I thought we should have a little sushi.
This place was a bit hard to locate based on it's size, but it was worth the search.
 
We ordered the Kobe Beef roll which was a bit different, but all the Kobe beef flavor was present. We also had the Crunchy California roll, it had a nice texture to it and the spicy mayo was a nice touch. 

Great place to get a quick bite before any events near the Hayes Valley area.

excerpts: The crunchy California roll and Temptation were my favorite.
crunchy california roll.author: Coralie S.
crunchy california roll.review: Great sushi place! Pretty small so there is usually some wait. The crunchy California roll and Temptation were my favorite.

excerpts: Our favorites of the night were the fiesta roll and the crunchy California roll.
As for amount, we ordered 5 sets of rolls for two small/medium adult appetites, which was about 1 set too much.
crunchy california roll.author: Laura M.
crunchy california roll.review:
First, I love that they let you leave a phone number on the wait list. This is a small courtesy that has a big impact, and it definitely influences my mood when my table is ready (as in, did I stand around making half-hearted chitchat for x minutes, or did I get to take a stroll and pop into a bar for a quick drink). Great start.

Second, the space is very cozy. Some would say small, which is true, but when it is small in a way that feels good, I go with cozy. The great part of a small joint is that the noise level is low, the service is very attentive, and it makes the whole experience feel very intimate (date night!). We sat at the bar facing the street, which I think is the superior spot since you get to people watch yet still have the warmth and comfort of sitting inside.

Third, the food is delicious. We went to Domo because I was having a major tuna and avocado craving, so most of our rolls had those elements. Usually we try to get at least one new thing, and a mix of rolls and nigiri, but this time we focused in on tuna or avocado flavors and stuck with rolls. Our favorites of the night were the fiesta roll and the crunchy California roll. As for amount, we ordered 5 sets of rolls for two small/medium adult appetites, which was about 1 set too much. We also each had a beer.

Overall, the whole experience at Domo was wonderful. We were treated well and enjoyed a delicious dinner, and we will surely be back.

excerpts:
(http://static1.px.yelp.com/bphoto/VENheXH8mYtgwPrFtMU_Ow/l)
- Hamachi and Toro Sashimi (http://static4.px.yelp.com/bphoto/GT2ksGp2QBhJO19j-w3G-g/l)
- Domo Roll (http://static1.px.yelp.com/bphoto/XByYhTTvoVewW3nd25g0MA/l)
- Crunchy California Roll (http://static3.px.yelp.com/bphoto/MzHL9-eDlchb7xxBK5oWvA/l)
- Omega Roll (http://static2.px.yelp.com/bphoto/OgLyxt4lFEaGnlsIgFvTfg/l)
Hamachi Sashimi (3.5 Stars): Fresh Yellowtail, one of my favorites to order.
Not the best I've had, but still quite good and tasty.
Toro Sashimi (5 Stars):
My other favorite, the Fatty Tuna that was extremely stimulating and scrumptious.
When I devoured the first piece I instantly fell in love.
It seriously just melted in my mouth.
One of the best sashimis I've had in quite a while.
I highly recommend this for any sashimi lovers out there!
Crunchy California Roll (5 Stars):
Tempura Battered California Roll with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, scallions, & tobiko.
Out of the three rolls we had, this was my favorite.
Again, I am a sucker for fried rolls,
so I am a bit biased.
Domo Roll (4.5 Stars):
Baked California Roll topped with salmon & scallops with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, and tobiko & scallions.
This roll was a close second in terms of what I liked between the three rolls we ordered.
Full of flavor and packs quite a tasty punch!
Omega Roll (4 Stars):
This was on their special menu written on the mirror.
Our waitress informed us the specials rolls and what they contained, and I didn't catch everything she said.
I do remember it having shrimp, mango, and macadamia nuts.
This roll was quite refreshing and luscious.
Sake - Cream de Sake (5 Stars)
: This is my first experience of having unfiltered sake and my only question is, why have I never had this before?
OMG, it was so good!
It looks real creamy and milky like, and tasted so smooth and sweet.
I think I will start ordering unfiltered sake from now on!
crunchy california roll.author: Mike S.
crunchy california roll.review:
Domo is quite a charming little sushi joint that offers a cozy yet intimate atmosphere. It's a relatively small and modern restaurant, able to fit a maximum of 20 or so people. I was helping my friend move last weekend and for his last dinner before he moved we decided to hit up Domo. I really didn't know what to expect, but it wasn't like I was going to say no to soooshi! :)
 
Between the two of us, we ordered:
- Three bottles of Sake (http://static1.px.yelp.com/bphoto/VENheXH8mYtgwPrFtMU_Ow/l)
- Hamachi and Toro Sashimi (http://static4.px.yelp.com/bphoto/GT2ksGp2QBhJO19j-w3G-g/l)
- Domo Roll (http://static1.px.yelp.com/bphoto/XByYhTTvoVewW3nd25g0MA/l)
- Crunchy California Roll (http://static3.px.yelp.com/bphoto/MzHL9-eDlchb7xxBK5oWvA/l)
- Omega Roll (http://static2.px.yelp.com/bphoto/OgLyxt4lFEaGnlsIgFvTfg/l)
 
Hamachi Sashimi (3.5 Stars): Fresh Yellowtail, one of my favorites to order.  Not the best I've had, but still quite good and tasty.
 
Toro Sashimi (5 Stars): My other favorite, the Fatty Tuna that was extremely stimulating and scrumptious.  When I devoured the first piece I instantly fell in love.  It seriously just melted in my mouth.  One of the best sashimis I've had in quite a while. I highly recommend this for any sashimi lovers out there!
 
Crunchy California Roll (5 Stars): Tempura Battered California Roll with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, scallions, & tobiko.  Out of the three rolls we had, this was my favorite.  Again, I am a sucker for fried rolls, so I am a bit biased.  The crunchy tempura layer is what does it for me, so exceptional!

Domo Roll (4.5 Stars): Baked California Roll topped with salmon & scallops with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, and tobiko & scallions. This roll was a close second in terms of what I liked between the three rolls we ordered. Full of flavor and packs quite a tasty punch!
 
Omega Roll (4 Stars): This was on their special menu written on the mirror.  Our waitress informed us the specials rolls and what they contained, and I didn't catch everything she said.  I do remember it having shrimp, mango, and macadamia nuts.  This roll was quite refreshing and luscious.
 
Sake - Cream de Sake (5 Stars): This is my first experience of having unfiltered sake and my only question is, why have I never had this before? OMG, it was so good! It looks real creamy and milky like, and tasted so smooth and sweet.  I think I will start ordering unfiltered sake from now on! :)

Summary (5 Stars): A true hidden gem! They have Toro Sashimi to die for, as well as highly addictive and delicious rolls. It all goes so well with their Cream de Sake! I also enjoyed the soft mellow hip hop beats in the background, so faint that my friend didn't even notice.

excerpts: Crunchy California roll is amazing, as well as the nigiri (yellow fin, and butter fish are my favorite).
Great lunch prices.
Only bad thing is the size of the seating.
Only one table for 4 inside so dress warm to eat outside.
crunchy california roll.author: Kalani M.
crunchy california roll.review: Best sushi in the neighborhood! Everything's very fresh and well prepared. You can honestly taste the freshness. Crunchy California roll is amazing, as well as the nigiri (yellow fin, and butter fish are my favorite). Great lunch prices. Only bad thing is the size of the seating. Only one table for 4 inside so dress warm to eat outside.

excerpts: And finally, while I am not a roll girl, I would recommend trying the Crunchy California Roll, which is a tempura-style deep-fried roll, the Domo Roll, which is a really luxurious baked roll topped with scallop and sauces, and the Jalapeno Hamachi,not nearly as big or as fancy as the previous two, but the juxtaposition of the sweet, soft hamachi with the crunchy, crisp, sometimes spicy jalapeno and sea salt is one that I often crave.
crunchy california roll.author: Shirley T.
crunchy california roll.review:
For a "neighborhood joint" feel and a good date night spot, Domo is ichiban! The fish is always fresh and sliced generously and the sushi rice is seasoned properly.  I've been going for about three years, and now that I live in the neighborhood, I go at least twice a month.  And, while I may go alone, I never eat alone.  Ryo, the head sushi chef and manager, is unpretentious, outgoing, cool, and has great taste in music.  It's easy to sit at the bar and engage him in conversation while he prepares you some delicious sushi.  The staff is also very friendly and helpful with the menu. 

I like to recommend Domo as a good date place, especially for dates #1-4.  It's small and intimate with soft lighting, so everyone looks pretty good and you don't have to yell to communicate.  The seating is all counter style so you sit next to one another which can work when you're too nervous or don't want to be forced to face each other, or, when you want to be able to lean in closer or even have a reason to "accidentally" touch.  Finally, it's sushi.  For those fortunate enough to be on a date with someone who likes sushi, it's perfect date food, light, yet filling, allows you to show off your cultured palate and the dinner can be as long or as short as you can handle.  And to help you seal the deal, you can try going off the beaten path from the menu and order dinner from Ryo, omakase (chef's choice).

While they don't have a "kitchen", there are some excellent dishes besides sushi/sashimi that are unique to Domo.  Try any of their Crudos; the Ankimo, monkfish liver pate, is made in-house, fresh, and is great for those who enjoy foie gras or duck liver pate.  The Daikon Salad, served with arugula and bonito shavings; light and refreshing while anchored with the earthy bitterness of the arugula and the delicate saltiness of the bonito and drizzled with a house dressing.  Iidako, deep-fried baby octopus served with a spicy dipping sauce, takes the pedestrian calamari to a different level.  One of my go-to favorites, and highly overlooked, is the Hamachi Kama.  The kama is the jaw or cheek of the Yellowfin Tuna that they broil and serve with lemon and a light soy or temari sauce.  It's always cooked perfectly tender and completely satisfying.  Try the Fish Tacos.  It's a creative take on mexican tacos using deep-fried nori as the shell, filled with a couple different fish and avocado and topped with a house-made salsa.   And finally, while I am not a roll girl, I would recommend trying the Crunchy California Roll, which is a tempura-style deep-fried roll, the Domo Roll, which is a really luxurious baked roll topped with scallop and sauces, and the Jalapeno Hamachi,not nearly as big or as fancy as the previous two, but the juxtaposition of the sweet, soft hamachi with the crunchy, crisp, sometimes spicy jalapeno and sea salt is one that I often crave.

excerpts: Got a seat at the bar and ordered what I recalled were my favourites: firecracker balls and the crunchy california roll.
In hindsight, just order one of those.
The combination of flavours is similar enough and the deep-fry became a little overwhelming.
crunchy california roll.author: Littlefish B.
crunchy california roll.review:
Returned almost a year later to the day, relieved to see they're open and seem to be doing well.

Got a seat at the bar and ordered what I recalled were my favourites: firecracker balls and the crunchy california roll.  In hindsight, just order one of those.  The combination of flavours is similar enough and the deep-fry became a little overwhelming.  Regardless, both are still delicious.

Also ordered the Spicy Hulk and enjoyed it.  But it's not going to prompt a craving for me.

Tried the unfiltered saki.  Guess I'm just not much of a saki person.

Not cheap, but still recommended.  Enjoy!

excerpts:
Albacore - Pretty Good
Crunchy California Roll - Delicious
Kobe Beef Roll - not that good.
I don't think the asparagus worked well with the rest of the stuff.
It did, however, make my pee smell like asparagus.
(*asparapiss?)
We also consumed Ed Money (aka Edamame) - Cold but still good.
They are served cold, I don't think it was a mistake.
We ate some other shit too
but I forgot what it was.
Also, Olie Flowers ate Sea Urchin like a dumbface.
crunchy california roll.author: N S.
crunchy california roll.review:
Good things in this establishment. Me and my flower-backed associate ate raw fish here. The fishes were good. Here are the fishes we ate.

Yellowtail - Delicious
Albacore - Pretty Good
Crunchy California Roll - Delicious 
Kobe Beef Roll - not that good. I don't think the asparagus worked well with the rest of the stuff. It did, however, make my pee smell like asparagus. (*asparapiss?)
We also consumed Ed Money (aka Edamame) - Cold but still good. They are served cold, I don't think it was a mistake. We ate some other shit too but I forgot what it was. Also, Olie Flowers ate Sea Urchin like a dumbface. I bet it tasted like the ocean. 

I would eat here if I were you.

excerpts: the crunchy california roll was excellent, and the firecracker balls are a reason to go back to Domo all by themselves.
crunchy california roll.author: donal c.
crunchy california roll.review:
We went to Domo on a whim Saturday night (intending to go to Suppenkuche next door, but scared away by the crowds...) There was a bit of a wait (half an hour or so) but really, not too bad for 8 PM Saturday night.

The placed is tiny, but casual and very cozy. Very interesting sushi -- not your standard fare... We had an interesting hamachi carpaccio appetizer (which, unfortunately, didnt arrive before the rest of the sushi...) Then, we had the kobe beef-wrapped asparagus. Good, but not memorably excellent. However, the deep-fried choices were a different story... the crunchy california roll was excellent, and the firecracker balls are a reason to go back to Domo all by themselves. Amazing! 

All-in-all, very delicious (& accompanied by lots of tasty, fruity sake...) Sadly, the service was a bit spotty -- but it *was* Saturday night. But, a very good, casual drop-by sushi choice  (and a happy discovery for us.)

excerpts: Domo roll (which is tasty but does kinda fall apart) and the crunchy California roll are special- the dragon roll is the best I've ever had.
crunchy california roll.author: Trisha F.
crunchy california roll.review:
I AM OBSESSED WITH DOMO!  

My guy and I went about a month ago for the first time, and we were in heaven!

As everyone here has mentioned, you must try the firecracker balls- they make your mouth come alive!  Domo roll (which is tasty but does kinda fall apart) and the crunchy California roll are special- the dragon roll is the best I've ever had.  Fully satisfied, we started plotting our return.

Two weeks later we decide to bring a couple with us.  We got there just in time to snag the single table.   The daikon salad was savory and an excellent starter.  Then the owner Kuohwa and the waiter recommended some rolls for us- and the fatty tuni nigiri.  WOW.  Each dish presented to us was sampled, and we'd break out in applause.  It was that good.  It didn't hurt that we had some delicious unfiltered sake flowing at the table!  Our friends Heidi A  and Glenn C said it was the best sushi experience they've ever had!

We had to go again.

A couple of weeks later, we had something to celebrate- my guy had gotten a promotion, so we decided to go to one of our two fave restaraunts: you guessed it, Domo.  What followed is an experience every sushi lover should have: I HIGHLY recommend it.  After greeting us  back effusively, Kuohwa asked if he could order for us.  

Seriously, if you have never tried this before: indulge, at least once in your life. 

Crudos: monkfish pate and seared scallops.  Both melt in  your mouth.  Probably my favorite.  Tataki- asparagus wrapped in slightly seared Kobe Beef.  Spicy Hulk roll.  Fish tacos (even better than Umami- really).  The only thing that I wouldn't have again was the deep-fried Spanish Mackeral skeleton- but it was an experience and I'm glad I tried it! 

Kuohwha knows his sushi.  Yes I wish it was bigger- but give them time! They've been here less than a year.  I cannot wait to go back.

Best sushi EVER.

excerpts: I tried my friend's crunchy California roll, and that was over the top!
A smidge too much indulgence in fried tempura and mayo for my liking.
I could only eat one piece of it before feeling bloated.
Don't get me wrong, it was very tasty, but just a little excessive for me.
crunchy california roll.author: Evelyn K.
crunchy california roll.review:
I just moved to Hayes Valley a few days ago, and I am thrilled that there is a fantastic sushi joint right down the street from me.  I've been there on a couple different occasions so far and I have to say that I've been super pleased.  I love that they have tables outside so that you can dine al fresco when the weather cooperates.  Otherwise, the seating indoors is definitely a tight squeeze. 

The seaweed salad is perfect!  Meanwhile, the Spicy Hulk Roll seems to be a bit of a misnomer.  It's spicy tuna, avocado, tobiko wrapped in a cucumber sheet with spicy ponzu sauce.  It's not much of a hulk, but rather light and delicate.   

I tried my friend's crunchy California roll, and that was over the top! A smidge too much indulgence in fried tempura and mayo for my liking.  I could only eat one piece of it before feeling bloated.  Don't get me wrong, it was very tasty, but just a little excessive for me.  I thought sushi was supposed to be healthy! 

The service is generally pretty quick, but sometimes they forget to give you chopsticks...making it challenging to eat the seaweed salad!

excerpts: Next on my list would be the crunchy california roll, which was great!
crunchy california roll.author: Alyssa G.
crunchy california roll.review:
I loved their rolls! Couldn't get enough, and my friend and I ended up ordering 3 rolls, and 3 different Nigiris. To start out, we had the hot sake, always a must, when chatting about dirtbag guys and catching up with friends.  Then came the edemame, which were always a plus. Edamame is always good when they aren't overcooked, slightly crunchy and mildly salty. On to the rolls. My favorite was definitely the spider roll, it was so light but incredibly flavorful. Next on my list would be the crunchy california roll, which was great! The roll was a little hot when we received it, so we let it cool down for a minute, but then.....nothing but a fiesta in my mouth!
Our third roll was the Spicy Hulk...a variation of the spicy tuna roll. It also was delicious, but a little big to eat in one bite. More like 3 bites. Ok, so finally we got around to the nigiri, because we were still hungry after the three rolls. We ordered the scallop, salmon and tuna rolls. They were all really fresh, which is what makes or breaks the whole experience. It's easy to spot day-old fish, and there was none of that here. Loved the little bar facing the street, and the music was really great. Even though I was talking and talking with my friend throughout the meal, I paused and enjoyed the great mix of house/lounge-esque music in the background.

The waitstaff were really nice, and patient as it took us a while to decide what we finally wanted to order. Definitely coming back soon!

excerpts: We ordered miso soup, a crunchy california roll, a Domo roll, and a Temptation roll.
Our personal favorite was the Domo roll, I would highly recommend you get that if you come here!
domo roll.author: James D.
domo roll.review:
Came here this past Thursday and was blown away with how good the sushi tasted!

It's a small restaurant so expect a wait, but it's completely worth it once you get in. They also have outdoor seating as well in front of the restaurant.

We ordered miso soup, a crunchy california roll, a Domo roll, and a Temptation roll. Everything came out super quick to us!

I've tried a good amount of sushi places in San Francisco, but the minute I tasted our first roll I was absolutely SOLD on this place as being one of the best sushi restaurants in SF. The sushi tasted fresh, flavorful, and the prices were very comparable to other sushi in the city.

Our personal favorite was the Domo roll, I would highly recommend you get that if you come here! 

No doubt that we will be repeat customers.

excerpts: Recently grabbed a Domo Roll from here.
It's essentially a Lion King Roll (the most common name) with scallops added in.
I thought it was pretty good but not great
which in my world makes it a 3 star venue.

The servers were friendly, would be nice if this place had a flat screen as some other sushi spots have since there was a big game going on when I popped in and that would have been reason for me (and I'm sure others) to dine in and order more.

Domo Roll $14 
baked california roll with salmon & scallops outside, spicy mayo, unagi glaze, tobiko & scallions
domo roll.author: Rod M.
domo roll.review:
Recently grabbed a Domo Roll from here. It's essentially a Lion King Roll (the most common name) with scallops added in. I thought it was pretty good but not great which in my world makes it a 3 star venue. The servers were friendly, would be nice if this place had a flat screen as some other sushi spots have since there was a big game going on when I popped in and that would have been reason for me (and I'm sure others) to dine in and order more. As it was there was no one in the venue when I came to pick up my order. 

Domo Roll $14 
baked california roll with salmon & scallops outside, spicy mayo, unagi glaze, tobiko & scallions

excerpts: Domo roll: similar in flavor to the fire tuna balls because of the sauces used
domo roll.author: Tom P.
domo roll.review:
Small restaurant, mostly bar style seating. This place is mainly known for their delicious rolls.

Fire Tuna Balls: does not need to be dipped in soy sauce as this is bursting with flavor with all the different sauces it's bathed in. I liked the crunchy batter/tempura that wraps the rice together.

Domo roll: similar in flavor to the fire tuna balls because of the sauces used so I would recommend one or the other, but both are exploding with flavor.

Kobe Beef Roll: a unique roll where a thin slice of Kobe beef wraps cucumber and other vegetables with scallions on top. This was really good I just wish it had more stuffing or felt more full on the inside of the roll (wish there was rice).

excerpts: We ordered  the firecracker balls which were delicious, the Domo roll (a baked sushi roll)...
Delicious , an Alpha Roll..
Delicious and the taco appetizer, which was not great just good.
It was a mix of Japanese and Mexican flavors but would have been better if they stuck with all Japanese flavors.
We would have preferred aioli instead of salsa.
Good service.
Will definitely go back.
domo roll.author: Mary B.
domo roll.review: We got there right at the 5:30 opening, and thank goodness, because it is a small place and by 6:00 they had a full house with a line of people waiting. We ordered  the firecracker balls which were delicious, the Domo roll (a baked sushi roll)...Delicious , an Alpha Roll..Delicious and the taco appetizer, which was not great just good. It was a mix of Japanese and Mexican flavors but would have been better if they stuck with all Japanese flavors. We would have preferred aioli instead of salsa. Good service. Will definitely go back.

excerpts: Also tried the Domo roll which I thought was mediocre.
domo roll.author: Anna S.
domo roll.review:
Solid place for sushi and nigiri. You might walk by and not realize you passed it. No tables, bar counter and window counter seats with stools. No wait 6pm on a Tuesday. Large 600ml bottle of Sapporo for $9 with small glasses provided. 

Hamachi Carpaccio was seared and pretty tasty. I'm used to cooler in temperature and non-seared carpaccio, so this was a new twist that I did fancy! It was flavorful and the jalapeño added a great little kick to my taste buds. 

Tried two different nigiris which were both delicious in their own ways. The walu nigiri aka butter fish, somewhat melted in my mouth and also seemed to have an actual buttery after taste! It was quite delightful. The other nigiri which was a special on the wall, was the Albacore Toro which was $9 for two pieces, solid. 

My favorite roll was the Saba Hit...I didn't know mackerel could be so tasty on a roll. The combination of the fresh ginger, avocado, and shiso flavors really blended well together...refreshing too.  

Also tried the Domo roll which I thought was mediocre. Would pass on that next time, it was essentially a less saucy and smaller lion king roll. 

Street parking pretty easy to find....on a Tuesday around 6pm. Area could get trafficky though!

excerpts: Domo roll - 4/5
domo roll.author: Mark O.
domo roll.review:
Dinner review. 

Chicken Karaage - 3/5
Fish tacos - 4/5 - Would be a 5 if topped with poke instead of salsa
Dynamite mussels - 4/5
Fire tuna balls - 3/5 - 
Temptation roll - 4/5 - So much crab
Domo roll - 4/5

Overall, great sushi place. "I'm a fan."

excerpts: The Domo roll is so fantastic, I feel like I could eat 10 of them.
The restaurant stays very busy so an early dinner with less than 4 people is best to ensure you don't wait over 30 min.
Lunch is eh.
The chirashi bowl has high quality fish, but lacks other common elements (like avacado, cucumber, or egg) - if you're a Chirashi fan, just go to Ginto for one!!
domo roll.author: Candace S.
domo roll.review: My favorite sushi in the City! The Domo roll is so fantastic, I feel like I could eat 10 of them. The restaurant stays very busy so an early dinner with less than 4 people is best to ensure you don't wait over 30 min. Lunch is eh. The chirashi bowl has high quality fish, but lacks other common elements (like avacado, cucumber, or egg) - if you're a Chirashi fan, just go to Ginto for one!!

excerpts: We tried 4 rolls, the crunchy California, the domo roll, the Kobe beef roll and the spicy hulk, all 4 were delicious!
The rolls are very authentic and fresh!
Also service was fast and friendly.
Next time I'm in the city I would defiantly like to come back!
domo roll.author: Brittany Y.
domo roll.review: Found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try, came here with my dad. We tried 4 rolls, the crunchy California, the domo roll, the Kobe beef roll and the spicy hulk, all 4 were delicious! The rolls are very authentic and fresh! Also service was fast and friendly. Next time I'm in the city I would defiantly like to come back!

excerpts: Another roll we loved was the Domo roll (baked California roll with salmon, scallops, spicy mayo, BBQ unagi glaze, tobiko, and scallions).
domo roll.author: Nicole W.
domo roll.review:
Due to the small size this place feels up quickly! Be prepared if you are trying to nab a spot on a Friday or Saturday night. As far as the food goes- it's an untraditional Japanese style sprinkled with Asian fusion. To start we ordered the fish tacos- a crisp tempura like seaweed topped with avocado, fish, and salsa, this was by far one of the highlights of the meal! Another roll we loved was the Domo roll (baked California roll with salmon, scallops, spicy mayo, BBQ unagi glaze, tobiko, and scallions). For a baked roll this didn't feel too heavy, a great addition to any sushi meal!

Can't wait to come back and try more rolls :)

excerpts: I quickly ordered the Domo roll, figuring that the namesake sushi roll had to be good, but was very intrigued by their lunch special of two choosings served over rice with lettuce salad and miso soup for the equivalent price of the roll.
domo roll.author: Amanda W.
domo roll.review:
Narrowly missed the lunch hour! They're efficient with their business hours, and close from 2:30-5:30. 

I quickly ordered the Domo roll, figuring that the namesake sushi roll had to be good, but was very intrigued by their lunch special of two choosings served over rice with lettuce salad and miso soup for the equivalent price of the roll. 

Namesake roll: Domo (4.5/5), basically a fancy baked California Roll with unagi and spicy mayo. I don't like TOO spicy, and there was just enough kick to satisfy my wimpy taste buds. Plating wasn't the prettiest since it was baked on foil and then transferred to the plate on the foil. Utility s understandable, but it didn't look the best. 

I felt a little apologetic for showing up so close to closing, but didn't feel rushed, so kudos to their good manners.

excerpts: The Domo roll is a hot roll with salmon that is super tasty.
domo roll.author: Tamara S.
domo roll.review:
This review has three stars for a few reasons. 
1. The disastrous Kobe beef roll
2. The wait

Do NOT get the Kobe Beef roll. We tried it out of pure curiosity and didn't eat any more than the initial piece we first tried. The idea behind this roll is unique but the execution is a disaster. The beef is chewy beyond belief and overall flavorless. The inside is just avocado and another veggie, while the kobe beef wraps around it like nori. NOT tasty. Not worth it. 

The wait is 30 min - 1 hr on weekends at dinner time. Not the worst but I now feel like it's not totally worth the wait due to the Kobe beef roll partially (I'm just weirdly offended by it) and nothing incredible about the sushi that stood out to me otherwise. And with sushi restaurant prices- you want something to stand out. 

Pros:

The Domo roll is a hot roll with salmon that is super tasty. The Spicy Hulk is a Gluten Free roll with spicy tuna and cucumber wrap. These two were probably my favorite out of the five rolls we tried. Both had really great flavors and textures. 


Overall I wouldn't be excited to go back here, but good flavor and nice atmosphere.

excerpts: We ordered the Kobe beef app, Domo roll, Crunchy Cali roll, Firecracker Balls, and the Red Dragon roll.
domo roll.author: Amy C.
domo roll.review:
Oh domo, you deliciously devil you! :)

Perusing thru my bookmarks, my hunny and I were trying to pick a place for dinner last night. We were amazed that this place has such a high health score-- 100 out of 100?!?!?!? Wth!? 

Normally, I don't even notice the health score on restaurants. Since, I use my yelp app on my phone, the health score rating is not necessarily the thing that pops out at me when I research a place. Haha but we were looking at the restaurants' page on my boyfriend's laptop so the health score section was pretty visible to the eye which helped our decision of picking this place for dinner.

They don't take reservations. Upon arriving, we noticed there were prob about 7 little groups/couples waiting for a seat. Domo is most definitely a very petite restaurant. They had a notebook by the entrance where you can write down your name & phone #. We ended up going back to car to kill some time instead of waiting outside since it was kinda chilly & there weren't really any shops open to wander around about. Oh and we found parking in one of the residential streets/alleyway that was about 2 blocks from Domo.

The wait was about 45-50mins, I think. Yeah, the wait wasn't that fun, but it was so worth it! 

We got seated in the middle of the bar counter in front of the sushi chefs making their creations. My hunny was more interested in watching them work their magic than me. Haha... We ordered the Kobe beef app, Domo roll, Crunchy Cali roll, Firecracker Balls, and the Red Dragon roll. All were very yummy, but my fave would be the Domo roll-- so hot (temp) & über nomness!

So in conclusion, Domo = a very intimate tiny restaurant that has awesome sushi. :)

excerpts: Some of my faves are the fire tuna balls, IC and Domo roll - absolutely delicious!
domo roll.author: Stephanie E.
domo roll.review:
Despite its tiny size, this is my go-to sushi place in SF. You'll probably have to wait no matter what time you go, but there are several bars in Hayes valley nearby for a drink while you wait for a text. Some of my faves are the fire tuna balls, IC and Domo roll - absolutely delicious! 

My only small complaint is it's a little frustrating when there are a ton of 2 people groups waiting and they absolutely won't sit anyone at the 3 top in the back just in case a group of 3 walks in and has to be seated asap. But overall, great food and good Hayes valley location!

excerpts: DOMO ROLL ($14) , a warm baked california roll with salmon & scallops outside, spicy mayo, unagi glaze, tobiko & scallions.
Delicious.
domo roll.author: Sebastian F.
domo roll.review:
No tables!

What?

Domo  d-o-e-s  n-o-t  have tables.

Okay, I get it. No point in making a reservation. Just show up and hope for the best.

A restaurant without tables would probably be frowned upon in most instances, but not so here, my Sushi loving friend. Tight spot with window front and bar seats. Hipster clientele. And fresh rolls that have a reputation across town.

Domo's menu can be described as experimental - if you're a fan of speciality rolls (and who isn't?!) then you'll dream about their menu for days - SALMON CITRON ($8) not too crazy with a slight hint of citron, just right. DOMO ROLL ($14) , a warm baked california roll with salmon & scallops outside, spicy mayo, unagi glaze, tobiko & scallions. Delicious. And Filling. 

There is so much more to discover on the menu - and I will - as the chefs do great things here we're here to admire.

That deserves a full five star, eh? Yep sure, only thing is they charge for the miso soup,  and tea needs to be requested. Other than that - groovy. One of the best Sushi spots in the city.

excerpts: The Domo roll is a must- as with most restaurant's "house roll".
This left me with a rush of flavorful, crunchy goodness that leads into the absolute number one reason to come here...
The fish tacos are somehow the best dish in this gem of a sushi treasure.
Overall my experience was one I would repeat and would recommend others to do so as well.
The man with the glasses?
Yes.
That's the manager and
although he won't crack a smile or offer a warm welcome, this establishment makes up for it in terms of food selection, eclectic dishes and overall warm atmosphere.
In contrast, his staff was very accommodating and always stopped by at the right time to follow up with the dishes that were being brought out.
Price should rarely be a factor, especially in this neighborhood, but leaving perfectly satisfied at about $30 per person- drinks included seem like a great deal.
I recommend this for a casual date night or to catch up with a friend over some drinks.
(4.5/5 Stars)
domo roll.author: Jony V.
domo roll.review:
There's a certain vibe that goes on in Hayes Valley.
It's nicely tucked away from the wind so you can sit outside and enjoy a drink while your name gets called off a hand written clipboard hanging off he wall. The chefs are not traditional, but this place is anything, but ordinary. We started with the Spicy Hulk- perfectly wrapped and light on the palette.
After that we were ambushed in the nicest way. Croquettes are not usually in my favorites, but they were crisp and wash down perfectly with a Sapporo. The Domo roll is a must- as with most restaurant's "house roll". This left me with a rush of flavorful, crunchy goodness that leads into the absolute number one reason to come here...
The fish tacos are somehow the best dish in this gem of a sushi treasure. Overall my experience was one I would repeat and would recommend others to do so as well. The man with the glasses? Yes. That's the manager and although he won't crack a smile or offer a warm welcome, this establishment makes up for it in terms of food selection, eclectic dishes and overall warm atmosphere. In contrast, his staff was very accommodating and always stopped by at the right time to follow up with the dishes that were being brought out. Price should rarely be a factor, especially in this neighborhood, but leaving perfectly satisfied at about $30 per person- drinks included seem like a great deal.
I recommend this for a casual date night or to catch up with a friend over some drinks. (4.5/5 Stars)

excerpts: The hulk roll, domo roll, red dragon roll, spiced tuna balls, albacore nigiri, spicy tuna, I could go on and on.
domo roll.author: Lola W.
domo roll.review:
Dear Domo, I love you.  Seriously.  I travel to SF a few times a year for work and eat here every. Single. Time.  At least once, usually more than once each trip.  Yes, it's that good.  It's not odd for me to eat here multiple nights in a row.  It's that good.  I refuse to tell all but a few very close colleagues where this place is, because I don't want a bunch of them coming here when 30+ of us are in town.  It's that good.  

Tucked in on an alley corner, this place is tiny, with only one table for 3 and the other 15 seats or so "bar style".  I love seeing how they utilize every square inch of their space for storage, etc.  my bedroom is bigger than the entire restaurant, and I don't live in a palatial house.  Anyhow, enough about the place, now on to those scrumptious bites.  

I prefer to come here with one or two people so I can order and eat a little of  everything I want from the menu, because I'm not that much of a gluttonous pig on my own.  The hulk roll, domo roll, red dragon roll, spiced tuna balls, albacore nigiri, spicy tuna, I could go on and on.  Always super fresh, always quick service.  

Downfalls- usually a line (but it moves quickly), they don't serve liquor (beer, sake and plum wine only) and they don't take American Express.

excerpts: The temptation roll (had a creamy crab taste) and domo roll were yummy.
domo roll.author: Beth H.
domo roll.review:
I came here with a group of four at 830pm. We waited around 30 minutes as it had super limited space, like everything around downtown SF. 

Food: a friend from my group knew the guy behind the bar and he was super nice and let us try a variety of appetizers. The memorable ones were the Hawaiian style tuna poke (very unique dish, loved the mix of tuna, seaweed, and fish eggs), Uni (he gave us a good portion of Uni on spoons), fish tacos (the variety of fishes on this taco made this dish so delicious). I would highly recommend trying out appetizers, the blend of ingredients in these dishes made them so delicious.

Aside from appetizers we also got some rolls. The temptation roll (had a creamy crab taste) and domo roll were yummy. 

Definitely try to come with a group and share a variety of plates as each plate is very unique in its own way. Very different than a normal sushi bar.

excerpts: Each piece of nigiri was flavorful and fresh and the signature Domo roll was very filling.
Instead of having the usual hot sake, I paired my meal with their cold sake (which I can not recall the name).
I was hesitant at first but the first sip reminded me of a citrus juice.
domo roll.author: Jaylena P.
domo roll.review:
I'm so glad that my friend suggested this sushi spot! You're up close and personal with the chef, since the space is literally no bigger than the bar.  We arrived around 6:00pm and there were two spaces open. By the time we left there was a line out the door. So either run fast to get a spot early, or bring a coat to wait outside. The wait is deservedly so since the sushi screams fresh!
