I ordered a crudo.. what's that you said? What is a crudo? Oh I'm so glad you asked - I had to ask too. It's a small bite of seafood served in one of those little soup ladles. Mine was the Scallop crudo. Delicious! Each piece of nigiri was flavorful and fresh and the signature Domo roll was very filling. Instead of having the usual hot sake, I paired my meal with their cold sake (which I can not recall the name). I was hesitant at first but the first sip reminded me of a citrus juice. Not sure if that is the flavor cold sake should have, but I really enjoyed it.

The atmosphere here is pretty chill - I am a big fan of intimate sushi settings where you can chat with the chef. Usually if you go often enough you'll start to receive the special treatment. I'd like that.

excerpts: We also ordered the Domo Roll (baked), I think it was called the Saba Hit?
Domo Roll was fantastic if you love your baked rolls.
I could've done without the salmon and lemon rolls only because there was basically only lemon in the end pieces
and it was pretty flavorless.
The Saba roll was pretty good if you like Hamachi.
domo roll.author: Christine C.
domo roll.review:
Came here after watching the Nutcracker and wanted sushi that was open late. Right when we walked up to Domo we noticed it was pretty small but packed and very lively. The ambiance was dark and tightly packed, and even though we walked in the same time a few other people did, we were all seated fairly quickly. 

We ordered the Hamachi Carpaccio to start off with and then moved on to Fatty Tuna Nigiri, a DEFINITE must if you enjoy a succulent, moist, and melt in your mouth piece of fresh fish, ugh SO expensive yet SO good. We also ordered the Domo Roll (baked), I think it was called the Saba Hit? Roll and a lemon and salmon roll. 

The carpaccio was pretty good, lightly seared and pretty juicy. Don't even get me started on the Fatty Tuna again, we all know how much I recommend it. Domo Roll was fantastic if you love your baked rolls. I could've done without the salmon and lemon rolls only because there was basically only lemon in the end pieces and it was pretty flavorless. The Saba roll was pretty good if you like Hamachi. We also got a couple Soporos for $5 (Small size). 

Service was good and the food came out pretty quickly. All in all Domo was a pretty great sushi place and open fairly late. I would come back again.

excerpts: The Domo roll was by far my favorite-packed with tons of raw fish and jalapeño slices.
The salmon citron was refreshing with just the right amount of lemon to complement the salmon.
When we left at 7:45 there was a line out the door
so I suggest coming early!
domo roll.author: Jacqueline Y.
domo roll.review: A wonderful little sushi place tucked away in the picturesque portion of Hayes Valley.  I met a friend for sushi on Friday after work at 6pm and luckily since it was just the two of us we were able to easily grab seats at the bar. The restaurant is small with only a few tables but turnover seemed pretty quick.  The sushi here is fresh and the combinations are delightful.   The Domo roll was by far my favorite-packed with tons of raw fish and jalapeño slices.  The salmon citron was refreshing with just the right amount of lemon to complement the salmon.  When we left at 7:45 there was a line out the door so I suggest coming early!

excerpts: Their Domo roll is delicious and is a variation on a baked California roll with Salmon added, melts in your mouth.
Tuna fat, yellowtail and everything we have had is delicious.
Definitely will be back to try more items.
domo roll.author: Phillip H.
domo roll.review: Love this little gem in Hayes and despite its limited space you don't feel too crammed in there. Been here a couple times now and everything is really fresh. Their Domo roll is delicious and is a variation on a baked California roll with Salmon added, melts in your mouth. Tuna fat, yellowtail and everything we have had is delicious. Definitely will be back to try more items.

excerpts: but Domo roll is great.
Happy staff make Happy customers!
domo roll.author: James R.
domo roll.review:
Decided to give this place another shot. Happy we did! 

This time we arrived early put our name on the list. Went for drinks close by, took our time went back and got right in with no wait.

It's a small space, a bit pricey but Domo roll is great. Happy staff make Happy customers!

excerpts: And the kobe beef, sexy mama, domo roll and one other roll that slips my mind.
domo roll.author: Mabel Y.
domo roll.review:
Came here quite a while ago with babe to get our sushi grub on.

Babe and I got a couple of rolls and some crudos and a beer. If I recall correctly, we got the salmon and scallop crudo, very yum with lots of flavor. And the kobe beef, sexy mama, domo roll and one other roll that slips my mind.

The portions here are pretty small, so not for you if you love sushi and can't get enough. The crudos are very delicious though, I certainly recommend it.

Our server was eh, seemed bored, didn't talk much and didn't smile.

excerpts: Definitely recommend domo roll, grilled kama, and red dragon roll.
I will come back!
domo roll.author: Justin W.
domo roll.review: Cozy. Such a great food. Definitely recommend domo roll, grilled kama, and red dragon roll. I will come back!

excerpts: We finished off with the Domo Roll, which tasted like your typical American-y saucy sushi roll...
domo roll.author: Jennifer L.
domo roll.review:
I took a friend here for her birthday, so we ordered a little bit of everything that other yelpers had recommended.  

We started with the Salmon Crudo which was SO good + had a lot of flavor for how small the portion was (it was served in spoons).  But at $6 for two, the crudo was a little steep.  

This was followed by the Fire Cracker Balls (6 small balls) that everyone around us had also ordered.  For $10, it was also steep, especially if you're actually trying to satiate your hunger.

The Hulk Roll came in 5 pieces and tasted like "healthy" sushi because of the cucumber sheet.   It doesn't look that flavorful, but it is!

We finished off with the Domo Roll, which tasted like your typical American-y saucy sushi roll... so I loved it.

Overall, Domo = the best fusion Japanese food I've ever had.  The seating isn't ideal for a date night, but the food is.  Small portions, lots of things to try / share that look cool, and you won't stuff your face in front of whoever you're trying to impress!

Oh we also ordered the sake... not sure which one, but it was so good!!  Sippable.

excerpts: Really liked the Domo roll and
their lunch special is a pretty good deal.
domo roll.author: Leland H.
domo roll.review: Nice find...I liked that this place opens during lunch cause many Japanese restaurants I like open only during dinner.  Really liked the Domo roll and their lunch special is a pretty good deal.

excerpts: Domo roll, so I decided to check it out!
Not bad!!!
Their fish tacos are delicious!
Their daily specials are written on a huge mirrored wall.
Not a lot of seating, but come early and it should be fine!
Parking was a little of a hassle, but definitely manageable.
Food comes out one by one..
so if you're starving...
patience... patience...

Don't know how else to describe this

Domo Roll - this seemed very popular on Yelp, so I decided to order this, but I wasn't really blown away.
domo roll.author: Carmen C.
domo roll.review:
I was craving sushi and then yelped this place. Pretty good reviews for their fish taco and Domo roll, so I decided to check it out! Not bad!!! Their fish tacos are delicious! Their daily specials are written on a huge mirrored wall. Not a lot of seating, but come early and it should be fine! Parking was a little of a hassle, but definitely manageable. Food comes out one by one.. so if you're starving... patience... patience... I nearly scarfed down every single plate that came by slowly.. 

Monkfish liver pate- personally didn't eat this, but my friend says its just alright... the presentation was wonderful though, served on a soup spoon

Uni- looks delicious, didn't eat it because I'm not a fan, but according to my friend, he says it's really good! very fresh!

Fish tacos - they're not your typical fish tacos that you'd get at a taqueria or some Taco Tuesday...the plate comes with 2 "tacos".. it's a piece of albacore with a piece of salmon served on a crispy fried nori, topped with salsa and sriracha... i can't even begin to describe how all of this tastes in your mouth... sooo good! unlike anything i've ever tasted! I definitely recommend ordering this if you come here! Sadly, the whole "taco" falls apart after a few bites..

Walu (Hawaiian Butterfish) - pretty good! Don't know how else to describe this

Domo Roll - this seemed very popular on Yelp, so I decided to order this, but I wasn't really blown away. It's pretty much a California roll topped with salmon and scallop and baked.  It reminded me of a Dragon roll because I could barely taste the scallops.. 

Sweet Potato Roll - I'm super lame and had to order the non-fishy food and there's not a lot of non-seafood items here, unless you want miso soup and edamame. Don't expect bento boxes of teriyaki chicken and udon because this place serves lots of fish and sushi.. The sweet potato roll was really good! Tempura fried sweet potato wrapped in rice and seaweed and then topped with teriyaki sauce (i'm guessing?) 

California Roll - I hear the crab meat is made from real crab, so I ordered this... To be honest, I couldn't really tell the difference.. maybe it seemed to have a little more of a crabmeat like texture and maybe a little fishier. I wouldn't order this again because there's so many other things to try here!

excerpts: Get the Domo roll.
Their Domo roll is a must try.
Your mouth will explode (not literally, unless you have some bizarre allergy).
It's so good that even my toddlers love it!
Baby's first word was "sushi".
Or was it?
So if you're wondering if you should move to SF, get the Domo roll and you'll be
booking that U-Haul truck in no time.
domo roll.author: Dejana B.
domo roll.review:
tl;dr Get the Domo roll. 

Review: Domo is the reason I left my Toronto life behind me and moved to SF. It totally sold me on the SF foodie lifestyle, and captured it succinctly in a single dining session. I discovered Domo through a random person tweeting at me that I try it out while visiting SF ~6 years ago (when I actually used to tweet). It's been my favourite sushi place on this planet ever since. Their Domo roll is a must try. Your mouth will explode (not literally, unless you have some bizarre allergy). It's so good that even my toddlers love it! Baby's first word was "sushi". Or was it?
So if you're wondering if you should move to SF, get the Domo roll and you'll be  booking that U-Haul truck in no time.

excerpts:
Domo roll was over the top and deliciously so
Dragon roll was well executed
Fish tacos was a super fresh interpretation, with a seaweed "shell"
domo roll.author: Kathryn C.
domo roll.review:
Surprising and creative combinations with super fresh fish!

Fire cracker balls lived up to their name!
Domo roll was over the top and deliciously so
Dragon roll was well executed
Fish tacos was a super fresh interpretation, with a seaweed "shell"

excerpts: The domo roll was a disappointment (too heavy and over sauced)  Stick with the raw fish
domo roll.author: Amihan M.
domo roll.review:
Small restaurant with very good fresh sushi.  We ordered a couple of appetizers, sashimi, and some sushi specials which were the bomb.  The domo roll was a disappointment (too heavy and over sauced)  Stick with the raw fish and you'll love it.

Service could be more down to earth.  But the sushi chef was friendly.

excerpts: For something a little heavier, the Dragon roll or the Domo roll are saucier and heavier.
The Domo in particular, is baked and has a little more sauce on top, but I appreciated that it wasn't drowning in heavy flavors like baked rolls in a lot of other sushi places.
The scallop on top was also a nice refreshing touch.
Domo is definitely one of my new go-to spots to satisfy my sushi fix!
domo roll.author: Ashley T.
domo roll.review: Domo is all about sushi, with not much else to the menu besides rolls and nigiri. However, everything they put out is great and the quality of the fish is good as well. My favorite roll is the Castro roll because of its simplicity and the huge pieces of raw fish on top. The California roll base is made with real crab, and the generous slices of sashimi make for a huge roll. The Alpha roll is also a great pick, with tuna on top along with mango and jalapeño that makes the flavor pop. For something a little heavier, the Dragon roll or the Domo roll are saucier and heavier. The Domo in particular, is baked and has a little more sauce on top, but I appreciated that it wasn't drowning in heavy flavors like baked rolls in a lot of other sushi places. The scallop on top was also a nice refreshing touch. Domo is definitely one of my new go-to spots to satisfy my sushi fix!

excerpts: Domo Roll - I'm not a fan of the Lion King
roll to begin with, but this roll changed my mind for the night.
Kobe Beef - as an unusual item, we obviously had to try this.
Verdict:
The beef was well seasoned, and the roll itself was rich and creamy (because of the avocado).
Overall, I'd re-order, yes.
Mac Daddy - daddy got it right.
domo roll.author: Emmeline A.
domo roll.review:
I'm truly a sucker for good music playing in the background, and Domo definitely gets it right.  There's something about the mix of jazz and sushi, and of R&B/hip-hip and sushi that really works. Domo to me is the less pretentious, more casual brother to Yoshi's, without live music, and in a cozier home.

Aside from the ambience, the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The folks delivering our food placed the plates on our table with little jokes and spritely remarks. 

The food itself was delectable.  While pricey, I'd say the food is well worth it. 

Here's the run-down of what we divulged in:
Hawaiian Style Tuna Poke - delicious, nice flavors, but not groundbreaking in terms of innovative flavors, yet still worth the price.
Small crudos, spicy tuna and scallop - once again delicious: tuna tasted fresh, seasoning was good, but I particularly enjoyed the scallop.
Fire Cracker Balls - Yelp tips told us to get it. The Fire Cracker Balls were indeed crackin'.
Domo Roll - I'm not a fan of the Lion King roll to begin with, but this roll changed my mind for the night.
Kobe Beef - as an unusual item, we obviously had to try this. Verdict: The beef was well seasoned, and the roll itself was rich and creamy (because of the avocado). Overall, I'd re-order, yes.
Mac Daddy - daddy got it right. delicious.

Thanks for the meal, Domo.

excerpts: There was just something a bit different to me in terms of the flavor) and a couple of rolls--the firecracker balls and the domo roll.
Still too much
The firecracker balls were my favorite, as I mentioned, but the domo roll was a close second.
A california roll wrapped in cooked salmon and seared scallops topped with spicy mayo and a few other sauces.
Oh good lord those scallops were good.
I wish there had been more of them (it was more salmon heavy).
Although delicious it was difficult to eat.
I think the scallops made it a bit hard to roll so the pieces fell apart.
Huge sushi pet peeve of mine
but it was damn tasty
I let it slide.
SLIDE RIGHT
domo roll.author: Annette J.
domo roll.review:
Fire Cracker Balls. I mean, with a name like that how could you go wrong? Crunchy, spicy bits of goodness that burst in your mouth (thanks to the roe on top). It's, quite literally, a flavor explosion-osion-osion-osion (echo fade)! Spicy tuna rolled up, breaded and deep fried topped with a variety of sauces, scallions and roe. So spicy. So good. I almost regret getting them because I know I'll end up craving them and will be unsatisfied as they are only available across the country. Sad face.

Domo is a teeny tiny little sushi joint not far from my magical wonderland Miette. I stumbled upon it while wandering around and, after a week long binge on super rich foods, I decided sushi might make a good, light dinner. Of course I order the deep fried roll but that's neither here nor there. The point is, this place was good. 

It's got mega limited eating. I was exploring solo so I was able to grab a seat at the bar quickly as there was one lone chair available. The wait wasn't huge but there were a handful of folks milling about at the door waiting for spots to open up. 

I was having a severe case of my eyes are bigger than my stomach. Everything on the menu looked so good. I wanted to try 2 appetizers and a crap ton of rolls but I limited myself to some edemame (decent--I'm not sure how edemame can be kind of subpar but this one was. There was just something a bit different to me in terms of the flavor) and a couple of rolls--the firecracker balls and the domo roll. Still too much but oh so good.

The firecracker balls were my favorite, as I mentioned, but the domo roll was a close second. A california roll wrapped in cooked salmon and seared scallops topped with spicy mayo and a few other sauces. Oh good lord those scallops were good. I wish there had been more of them (it was more salmon heavy). Although delicious it was difficult to eat. I think the scallops made it a bit hard to roll so the pieces fell apart. Huge sushi pet peeve of mine but it was damn tasty I let it slide. SLIDE RIGHT INTO MY BELLY, THAT IS.

The service is quick but not overly friendly. The sushi chefs were right in front of me but barely glanced in our direction. Focus! There were only a couple of waitstaff around and I saw them doing things like preparing the edemame and other small apps. They do a lot more than just taking your order and bringing your plates! The kitchen is visible and super teeny tiny. Like, studio kitchen small. It's amazing that they churn out so many delicious hot dishes (like the FCB) with a space as small as that. Impressive!

The prices for the special rolls are a little up there but worth it if you like sushi. Ugh, writing this review had be reliving the experience in my brain and now I'm all sad face because I'm missing those scallops and hot little nuggets. Boohoohoo. Damn you Domo for being so darn good.

excerpts: The Domo Roll and Fire Tuna balls were both fantastic!
I'd rank them in my Top 5 favorite sushi places (and I'm a fan of the americanized sushi style).
I only wish the place was bigger, but it would be nice to come back and grab one of those outside seats!
domo roll.author: Jennifer M.
domo roll.review: I showed up at Domo on a busy friday night, knowing full well I wouldn't be able to get a seat, especially as a party of one. I didn't realize just how small the restaurant is, with only bar seating, and a couple small tables outside. So I decided to place an order to go, and the staff was super friendly. They helped me get my food quickly so I could take it home and try it. The Domo Roll and Fire Tuna balls were both fantastic! I'd rank them in my Top 5 favorite sushi places (and I'm a fan of the americanized sushi style). I only wish the place was bigger, but it would be nice to come back and grab one of those outside seats!

excerpts: Moving on, I ordered some of the sushi rolls including the Fire Cracker Balls, Sexy Mama, and the Domo Roll.
Each were fantastic with Sexy Mama being my favorite!
The Sexy Mama is really great if you love the taste of citrus in every bite because it's completely lined with thinly sliced lemons.
domo roll.author: Ann S.
domo roll.review:
Domo is a great place for some good Japanese food. 

I started off with the edamame, miso soup, and seaweed salad appetizers followed by spoonfuls of small crudos. The salmon crudo was fresh and perfect with the small wedge of avocado. The spicy tuna crudo had a nice kick to it with the addition of the sriracha hot sauce. The scallop crudo was wonderfully balanced with delicious seasoning. Last but not least, the uni was delicate, bright, and very fresh. Really, how else would you prefer sea urchin gonads for consumption? Mmm... That's some serious good eats!

Moving on, I ordered some of the sushi rolls including the Fire Cracker Balls, Sexy Mama, and the Domo Roll. Each were fantastic with Sexy Mama being my favorite! The Sexy Mama is really great if you love the taste of citrus in every bite because it's completely lined with thinly sliced lemons. Yum!

Domo is located in Hayes Valley in a cool neighborhood, perfect for outdoor seating. 

Service was attentive and friendly!

excerpts: We got the Kobe beef roll, Domo roll, crab balls and another roll.
5 stars hands down.
Can't wait to come back!
domo roll.author: Patricia L.
domo roll.review: Best sushi I have ever had. I'm obsessed. We got the Kobe beef roll, Domo roll, crab balls and another roll. 5 stars hands down. Can't wait to come back!

excerpts:
We especially enjoyed the following rolls:
- fire cracker balls
- dragon
- domo roll
- castro
- crunch california

P. S.
domo roll.author: Lindsey O.
domo roll.review:
How I dearly wish that Domo would take reservations!  My cousins, who grew up in Japan all their lives, and I went to this restaurant on a non-holiday Sunday night - wait was still 45 minutes long!  It was worth it, though, because I got to impress my 3 young tastebuds with one of the best Americanized sushi experiences :)  We made a point to only order rolls (for an obvious reason - the cousins get the real deal in Japan).  Wow, every roll was so well made!  Fresh ingredients and innovative construction.  We especially enjoyed the following rolls:
- fire cracker balls
- dragon
- domo roll
- castro
- crunch california

P. S. They offer iichiko hot sake, and I highly recommend it!  Such a smooth hot sake to go along with the meal!

excerpts: We also go the domo roll.. which is a baked roll with salmon and scallops.
I usually wouldn't go for the baked rolls or even LOVE it.. but this one was good and is worth a try!
Lastly, we go their special: Wiki Wiki roll which was topped with butterfish and has shitake mushroom tempura in side.
Perfect crunch!
domo roll.author: WENDY K.
domo roll.review:
Went late on a Sunday night and didn't expect there to be a wait.. but there was! I think that's better than no way at all anyway. We weren't too hungry but we got a good amount. It's a very small restaurant with just 1-2 servers and 1 hostess. The bathroom is SUPER nice and clean.. just the way it should be! 

On to the food... we got the hamachi/jalapeno roll.. the hamachi was good but the jalapeno didn't have as much flavor. I still prefer the good old negi hama rolls (hamachi with green onions!). Also got salmon nigiri and albacore toro. We also go the domo roll.. which is a baked roll with salmon and scallops. I usually wouldn't go for the baked rolls or even LOVE it.. but this one was good and is worth a try! Lastly, we go their special: Wiki Wiki roll which was topped with butterfish and has shitake mushroom tempura in side. Perfect crunch!

excerpts: Everything we had was amazing sake, maguro, uni, domo roll was ok not the best item on the menu.
domo roll.author: Joseph M.
domo roll.review:
I must be in a generous mood today. It's probably because I had a great night last night. 

Domo is an authentic little sushi bar that also has a fairly complete menu. 

Everything we had was amazing sake, maguro, uni, domo roll was ok not the best item on the menu. 

Terrible place for kids, groups and bad attitudes.

excerpts: We ordered the Domo roll, which was a crazy roll that was california roll with scallops and salmon or hamachi and some other stuff
I can't even remember right now, but damn, that roll was made up from some crazy imagination, it was HELLA GOOD.
The sauce was somewhat garlicky, which I believe was the magic of it all.
Mmm.
domo roll.author: Sharon B.
domo roll.review:
Uh....dang.

 I have NEVER in my life had sushi this delectable and dreamy. The fish is really fresh and the rolls are just amazing. I want to say awesome, but the word is just too plain in comparison to what the sushi actually is. 

For starters, I ordered two orders of uni. So dang fresh, I closed my eyes and had dreams of ocean living. My husband, on the other hand, liked watching me.

The place is small and crowded- elbow to elbow crowded. While waiting for seats, my husband (oh yay, I can actually say that now!) and I met a really cool couple, whom we ended up buying their desserts cause they were just that awesome, or it could have been the sake that I was feelin while I was waiting as well. 

Let's get back to the nitty gritty. The sushi was amazing. We ordered the Domo roll, which was a crazy roll that was california roll with scallops and salmon or hamachi and some other stuff I can't even remember right now, but damn, that roll was made up from some crazy imagination, it was HELLA GOOD. The sauce was somewhat garlicky, which I believe was the magic of it all. Mmm. I'm dreaming of it right now.

We also ordered the Spicy Hulk. Man. Unbelievably fantasmic. Great for spicy lovers, which I am famous for, wonderful for tuna lovers, which I am not. So it says A WHOLE LOTTA SOMETHING.

The reason why I'm not giving it 5 stars is because when we ordered mochi for dessert, please tell me why my husband saw them pull individual mochi balls from the box of 6 that I can buy at Pacific Super for $4.59 and then get charged $3 per ball on a fancy little dish with acrab fork? Everyone who eats this mochi ball knows we don't need utensils!!! BOO!

I'm coming back! But not order mochi. I'll just bring it in my purse, just to be ghetto.

excerpts: The Saba hit roll was mediocre and a bit bland, but the Domo roll was great.
domo roll.author: Audrey M.
domo roll.review:
This place is tiny and only has bar seating, but we arrived at 5:30pm on a weekday so we didn't have to wait. The seaweed salad was pretty standard, and the crudos (salmon, spicy tuna) were fine, nothing to write home about. The Saba hit roll was mediocre and a bit bland, but the Domo roll was great. It was warm and flavorful and completely redeemed the meal. 

The service was friendly and the other specialty rolls looked really good, so I'm excited to come back and try more. But reading some other reviews, I'm not sure I would wait over an hour to eat here. Also, because of the seating availability, I would only come with a party of 2 or 3.

excerpts: We loved the fish tacos and Domo roll!
WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!
domo roll.author: Sandra P.
domo roll.review: Our first time there since we were in town. And they did not disappoint. We loved the fish tacos and Domo roll! WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!

excerpts: I particularly love the temptation roll, the dragon roll, and the Domo roll.
While some of them don't wow me
domo roll.author: Nathan B.
domo roll.review:
I've been coming to Domo since I discovered it was down the street.  It's a small restaurant, so you'll need to get cozy unless you're fortunate enough to be seated outside on a nice warm evening.  It's a good value and has great service.

The lunch specials are a great value.  I sometimes pick up two or three for myself and have lunch, dinner, and then another lunch.  

The nigiri is really nice, and they have a nice selection of fresh fish.  The sashimi is great too.  They frequently have butterfish (walu), which is one of my personal favorites, along with monkfish liver and uni.  All worth getting when available.  Definitely check out the specials too, as the hamachi kama is wonderful.

While I'm not a huge fan of sushi rolls, the rolls here are something special.  I particularly love the temptation roll, the dragon roll, and the Domo roll.  While some of them don't wow me, I have enjoyed all that I have tasted.

There is only one menu item that I've tried that I'm not a fan of, and that's the fish tacos.  It's a fusion confusion dish, and while some of the individual flavors are nice, it doesn't quite come together.

While it can be a wait to eat here, they do to-go orders quickly.  If you live around the corner like me!  An awesome way to have a perfect sushi experience at home.

excerpts: The Domo roll was by far the best that we tried but the spicy hulk looked good with cucumber as well.
It would be nice if they had sake cocktails and some heat lamps for the outside seating at night.
domo roll.author: Jing L.
domo roll.review: Good sushi with a limited menu. The Domo roll was by far the best that we tried but the spicy hulk looked good with cucumber as well. It would be nice if they had sake cocktails and some heat lamps for the outside seating at night.

excerpts: A friend and I shared hamachi, the Domo roll and the Fire Cracker Balls which he had told me would change my life.
One bite of that fire cracker ball
and I knew I had an addiction.
The Domo roll is also now on my list of top favorite rolls ever.
domo roll.author: Liz M.
domo roll.review:
I have only been here once, but I seriously see no reason for giving this place anything less than 5 stars. It was INSANELY delicious. A friend and I shared hamachi, the Domo roll and the Fire Cracker Balls which he had told me would change my life. One bite of that fire cracker ball and I knew I had an addiction. The Domo roll is also now on my list of top favorite rolls ever. You should definitely order those two! 

I had hamachi at this super expensive snobby restaurant in Vegas and honestly, Domo's was just as melt-in-your-mouth-super-fresh delicious but at half the price. The prices at Domo are just right. You are eating super fresh yummy sushi in Hayes Valley, so it's not cheap, but it's not so expensive I consider it a splurge either. It's appropriately priced.

Domo is a small place so I wouldn't recommend bringing your whole posse here and yelling "SAKI BOMB!!!!!!!!!!", while twirling your shirt in the air. Bring a friend or two and enjoy the chill ambiance.

excerpts: We had the Domo roll which is baked and delicious.
domo roll.author: Sergio R.
domo roll.review:
Excelente!
Orion draft beer is very refreshing plus their service is personal and very friendly. Now, the sushi is very very very good. We had the Domo roll which is baked and delicious.

excerpts: The poke and the domo roll are very delicious.
The hulk is also good.
The miso soup is a bit salty though.
It's a very nice, intimate spot.
They have seats outside too.
Everybody is very friendly and welcoming.
domo roll.author: Stacy C.
domo roll.review: The poke and the domo roll are very delicious. The hulk is also good. The miso soup is a bit salty though. It's a very nice, intimate spot. They have seats outside too. Everybody is very friendly and welcoming.

excerpts: We ordered the firecracker balls, the salmon avocado lemon roll, the domo roll, and the kobe beef roll.
Not entirely impressed with everything except the kobe beef roll.
It literally melts in your mouth.
domo roll.author: Grace C.
domo roll.review:
Cute little sushi spot right in Hayes Valley.  

Good sushi rolls.  Didn't have the sushi so can't comment on that.

We ordered the firecracker balls, the salmon avocado lemon roll, the domo roll, and the kobe beef roll.  Not entirely impressed with everything except the kobe beef roll.  It literally melts in your mouth.  The other stuff was good, but they kind of drench their rolls in too much sauce.

The service was very prompt.  I will visit again - but next time I'll order other stuff.

excerpts: We also had the domo roll, which is the restaurant's signature, but all in all, a mediocre warm cheese sushi.
domo roll.author: Travis L.
domo roll.review:
Small space but really interesting twists on sushi. My friend and I were eager to try most their Kobe Beef roll, which features a kobe beef outer wrap with avocado and, ginger, and asparagus in the center. The ponzu helped cut the oil, and the kobe beef just sort of disappears as you bite into it.

We paired this with the Spicy Hulk, which had the refreshing cucumber sheet with lemon ponzu and spicy tuna center. It's nice to break away from traditional rice-based sushi to enjoy a set of different textures and tastes all at once. 

We also had the domo roll, which is the restaurant's signature, but all in all, a mediocre warm cheese sushi. I think it was good partially because of the other rolls we had next to it.

Lastly, in order to have a bit of a traditional flavor, we went with the hamachi sashimi, which honestly was one of the best I had tried in a long time. Really fresh fish that could stand alone without the shoyu and the wasabi. It was to appreciate the natural sweetness of the fish alongside the more complex flavors of the other rolls. 

I liked the atmosphere of the restaurant and its location. It's a tad pricey, but overall the food quality was great.

excerpts: i had the fireball and domo roll.
it was good but it tasted the same.
I'm going to try the hulk next time.
also the spoonfuls of treats was a must have.
domo roll.author: Dor C.
domo roll.review:
this is a cute and cozy restaurant. i would recommend coming with a small group of people.or with s date. i had the fireball and domo roll. it was good but it tasted the same. I'm going to try the hulk next time. also the spoonfuls of treats was a must have. the creamy sake was interesting.

overall, I'll come back again

excerpts: I like the fancy, over the top, unauthentic rolls with more ingredients than you can count, and this restaurant's namesake roll, the Domo Roll, fit the bill perfectly.
It's got everything you might want in your sushi roll
all mixed together: salmon, crab, scallops, avocado, spicy mayo, bbq unagi glaze, tobiko & scallions.
It's visually appealing and extremely tasty.
It was nearly as wonderful as the Domo roll.
domo roll.author: Adam B.
domo roll.review:
Domo is currently my favorite sushi place in San Francisco. I like the fancy, over the top, unauthentic rolls with more ingredients than you can count, and this restaurant's namesake roll, the Domo Roll, fit the bill perfectly. It's got everything you might want in your sushi roll all mixed together: salmon, crab, scallops, avocado, spicy mayo, bbq unagi glaze, tobiko & scallions. It's visually appealing and extremely tasty. Oddly, the salmon on top is baked, not raw or smoked, which I was surprised to learn works well.

I also tried one of the specials. I don't remember all the details, but it had a crunchy nutty exterior (crushed almonds perhaps?) and scallops inside. It was nearly as wonderful as the Domo roll. My boyfriend prefers the simple classics; he ordered a california roll and a tuna roll and he liked them both as well.

I'm usually left wanting more after dining on sushi, but I was pretty stuffed after leaving Domo; both of my rolls were very filling. I'll be back.

excerpts:
(http://static1.px.yelp.com/bphoto/VENheXH8mYtgwPrFtMU_Ow/l)
- Hamachi and Toro Sashimi (http://static4.px.yelp.com/bphoto/GT2ksGp2QBhJO19j-w3G-g/l)
- Domo Roll (http://static1.px.yelp.com/bphoto/XByYhTTvoVewW3nd25g0MA/l)
- Crunchy California Roll (http://static3.px.yelp.com/bphoto/MzHL9-eDlchb7xxBK5oWvA/l)
- Omega Roll (http://static2.px.yelp.com/bphoto/OgLyxt4lFEaGnlsIgFvTfg/l)
Hamachi Sashimi (3.5 Stars): Fresh Yellowtail, one of my favorites to order.
Not the best I've had, but still quite good and tasty.
Toro Sashimi (5 Stars):
My other favorite, the Fatty Tuna that was extremely stimulating and scrumptious.
When I devoured the first piece I instantly fell in love.
It seriously just melted in my mouth.
One of the best sashimis I've had in quite a while.
I highly recommend this for any sashimi lovers out there!
Crunchy California Roll (5 Stars):
Tempura Battered California Roll with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, scallions, & tobiko.
Out of the three rolls we had, this was my favorite.
Again, I am a sucker for fried rolls,
so I am a bit biased.
Domo Roll (4.5 Stars):
Baked California Roll topped with salmon & scallops with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, and tobiko & scallions.
This roll was a close second in terms of what I liked between the three rolls we ordered.
Full of flavor and packs quite a tasty punch!
Omega Roll (4 Stars):
This was on their special menu written on the mirror.
Our waitress informed us the specials rolls and what they contained, and I didn't catch everything she said.
I do remember it having shrimp, mango, and macadamia nuts.
This roll was quite refreshing and luscious.
Sake - Cream de Sake (5 Stars)
: This is my first experience of having unfiltered sake and my only question is, why have I never had this before?
OMG, it was so good!
It looks real creamy and milky like, and tasted so smooth and sweet.
I think I will start ordering unfiltered sake from now on!
domo roll.author: Mike S.
domo roll.review:
Domo is quite a charming little sushi joint that offers a cozy yet intimate atmosphere. It's a relatively small and modern restaurant, able to fit a maximum of 20 or so people. I was helping my friend move last weekend and for his last dinner before he moved we decided to hit up Domo. I really didn't know what to expect, but it wasn't like I was going to say no to soooshi! :)
 
Between the two of us, we ordered:
- Three bottles of Sake (http://static1.px.yelp.com/bphoto/VENheXH8mYtgwPrFtMU_Ow/l)
- Hamachi and Toro Sashimi (http://static4.px.yelp.com/bphoto/GT2ksGp2QBhJO19j-w3G-g/l)
- Domo Roll (http://static1.px.yelp.com/bphoto/XByYhTTvoVewW3nd25g0MA/l)
- Crunchy California Roll (http://static3.px.yelp.com/bphoto/MzHL9-eDlchb7xxBK5oWvA/l)
- Omega Roll (http://static2.px.yelp.com/bphoto/OgLyxt4lFEaGnlsIgFvTfg/l)
 
Hamachi Sashimi (3.5 Stars): Fresh Yellowtail, one of my favorites to order.  Not the best I've had, but still quite good and tasty.
 
Toro Sashimi (5 Stars): My other favorite, the Fatty Tuna that was extremely stimulating and scrumptious.  When I devoured the first piece I instantly fell in love.  It seriously just melted in my mouth.  One of the best sashimis I've had in quite a while. I highly recommend this for any sashimi lovers out there!
 
Crunchy California Roll (5 Stars): Tempura Battered California Roll with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, scallions, & tobiko.  Out of the three rolls we had, this was my favorite.  Again, I am a sucker for fried rolls, so I am a bit biased.  The crunchy tempura layer is what does it for me, so exceptional!

Domo Roll (4.5 Stars): Baked California Roll topped with salmon & scallops with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, and tobiko & scallions. This roll was a close second in terms of what I liked between the three rolls we ordered. Full of flavor and packs quite a tasty punch!
 
Omega Roll (4 Stars): This was on their special menu written on the mirror.  Our waitress informed us the specials rolls and what they contained, and I didn't catch everything she said.  I do remember it having shrimp, mango, and macadamia nuts.  This roll was quite refreshing and luscious.
 
Sake - Cream de Sake (5 Stars): This is my first experience of having unfiltered sake and my only question is, why have I never had this before? OMG, it was so good! It looks real creamy and milky like, and tasted so smooth and sweet.  I think I will start ordering unfiltered sake from now on! :)

Summary (5 Stars): A true hidden gem! They have Toro Sashimi to die for, as well as highly addictive and delicious rolls. It all goes so well with their Cream de Sake! I also enjoyed the soft mellow hip hop beats in the background, so faint that my friend didn't even notice.

excerpts: Domo roll?
Yes.
domo roll.author: Darya T.
domo roll.review:
I'm an L.A. resident, and I was visiting a friend in The City. We did wait a while for two open places at the Sushi Bar, and were starving when we sat down. The Sushi chef was intelligent, knowledgeable and full of good suggestions.
 
I seem to recall kickass Toro, which is one sign to me of a good Sushi place. They also offer Spanish style Crudo in little spoons; elegant and cool.

Domo roll? Yes. Fire Cracker balls? yes.

excerpts: Had a DELICIOUS Domo roll here, very filling and only needed one.
domo roll.author: Adele Z.
domo roll.review:
Had a DELICIOUS Domo roll here, very filling and only needed one. Flavor was fantastic and I didn't get sick of the backed mayo type flavor.

Got here on a Wednesday around 7pm and there were only 2 other people there. Friend had rainbow roll that was good as well. The ambiance is pretty intimate, and very cozy-esque. There are no tables - just sushi bar style seating. The only downside I see in the restaurant is the wait to be seated -- by the time we left everything was packed.

excerpts: The Domo roll was baked and tender.
The crunchy spicy tuna was not that crunchy, but had a thick layer of tempura batter, which was even more exaggerated because it was sliced diagonally.
The kobe beef roll was delicious and juicy.
The beef was sliced incredibly thin and it was really tender.
The avocado and asparagus inside was good.
Same with the cucumber roll, good use of a different type of wrap than the usual nori.
I don't like that some rolls are heavily drizzled with a lot of the same house sauce.
Some rolls I wish I could taste without the sauce or just with soy sauce.
Also, I wonder if they will serve omakase here...
domo roll.author: Jennifer W.
domo roll.review:
The smaller the place, the more I like it. I love the intimate setting here, a few tables outside and all counter inside. It has some nice woodwork and a large mirror to lend itself some space. The specials written on that mirror should not be missed. Usually there is a croquette or some seasonal fish on there as well as special rolls not listed on the menu. The service is great. Portions are small, but leaves me satisfied.

I am a fan of the lunch specials. There is a small, but apt selection that comes with miso soup and an iceberg lettuce wedge with housemade dressing. The dressing is sweet, sour, and refreshing. The fish is incredibly fresh. Go with the chirashi or some nigiri. My top pick is the sunazuri when there is no toro. The sushi is innovative and interesting. The rolls are unlike other ones I've had. The Domo roll was baked and tender. The crunchy spicy tuna was not that crunchy, but had a thick layer of tempura batter, which was even more exaggerated because it was sliced diagonally. The kobe beef roll was delicious and juicy. The beef was sliced incredibly thin and it was really tender. The avocado and asparagus inside was good. Same with the cucumber roll, good use of a different type of wrap than the usual nori. I don't like that some rolls are heavily drizzled with a lot of the same house sauce. Some rolls I wish I could taste without the sauce or just with soy sauce. Also, I wonder if they will serve omakase here...

excerpts: And finally, while I am not a roll girl, I would recommend trying the Crunchy California Roll, which is a tempura-style deep-fried roll, the Domo Roll, which is a really luxurious baked roll topped with scallop and sauces, and the Jalapeno Hamachi,not nearly as big or as fancy as the previous two, but the juxtaposition of the sweet, soft hamachi with the crunchy, crisp, sometimes spicy jalapeno and sea salt is one that I often crave.
domo roll.author: Shirley T.
domo roll.review:
For a "neighborhood joint" feel and a good date night spot, Domo is ichiban! The fish is always fresh and sliced generously and the sushi rice is seasoned properly.  I've been going for about three years, and now that I live in the neighborhood, I go at least twice a month.  And, while I may go alone, I never eat alone.  Ryo, the head sushi chef and manager, is unpretentious, outgoing, cool, and has great taste in music.  It's easy to sit at the bar and engage him in conversation while he prepares you some delicious sushi.  The staff is also very friendly and helpful with the menu. 

I like to recommend Domo as a good date place, especially for dates #1-4.  It's small and intimate with soft lighting, so everyone looks pretty good and you don't have to yell to communicate.  The seating is all counter style so you sit next to one another which can work when you're too nervous or don't want to be forced to face each other, or, when you want to be able to lean in closer or even have a reason to "accidentally" touch.  Finally, it's sushi.  For those fortunate enough to be on a date with someone who likes sushi, it's perfect date food, light, yet filling, allows you to show off your cultured palate and the dinner can be as long or as short as you can handle.  And to help you seal the deal, you can try going off the beaten path from the menu and order dinner from Ryo, omakase (chef's choice).

While they don't have a "kitchen", there are some excellent dishes besides sushi/sashimi that are unique to Domo.  Try any of their Crudos; the Ankimo, monkfish liver pate, is made in-house, fresh, and is great for those who enjoy foie gras or duck liver pate.  The Daikon Salad, served with arugula and bonito shavings; light and refreshing while anchored with the earthy bitterness of the arugula and the delicate saltiness of the bonito and drizzled with a house dressing.  Iidako, deep-fried baby octopus served with a spicy dipping sauce, takes the pedestrian calamari to a different level.  One of my go-to favorites, and highly overlooked, is the Hamachi Kama.  The kama is the jaw or cheek of the Yellowfin Tuna that they broil and serve with lemon and a light soy or temari sauce.  It's always cooked perfectly tender and completely satisfying.  Try the Fish Tacos.  It's a creative take on mexican tacos using deep-fried nori as the shell, filled with a couple different fish and avocado and topped with a house-made salsa.   And finally, while I am not a roll girl, I would recommend trying the Crunchy California Roll, which is a tempura-style deep-fried roll, the Domo Roll, which is a really luxurious baked roll topped with scallop and sauces, and the Jalapeno Hamachi,not nearly as big or as fancy as the previous two, but the juxtaposition of the sweet, soft hamachi with the crunchy, crisp, sometimes spicy jalapeno and sea salt is one that I often crave.

excerpts: My favorites are the Sake Toro, Domo Roll, Albacore Tetake, and Uni.
It's a great date spot; there is usually wait, but it is well worth it.
You can leave your number and grab a drink around the corner on Hayes too!
domo roll.author: Emily B.
domo roll.review: I am never disappointed with a meal at Domo.  My favorites are the Sake Toro, Domo Roll, Albacore Tetake, and Uni. It's a great date spot; there is usually wait, but it is well worth it.  You can leave your number and grab a drink around the corner on Hayes too!

excerpts: We got the firecracker roll, Domo roll and the fish tacos.
Domo roll was a-OK.
The roll kept falling apart and didn't taste any different from your average baked roll at another spot.
I would definitely skip this next time, but either way I'm definitely coming back for the above two items.
domo roll.author: Megha A.
domo roll.review:
First time here over the weekend.

First, you can put your name and number down and they will call you when your table is ready.  Now you can go to a bar around the corner, or wait it out at home instead of just standing around, yay!

the specials are written on a mirror, so it's pretty hard to read them.  I think a chalkboard would look better with the feel of the place, and just be easier to read, but whatevs - we didn't order from that. 

We got the firecracker roll, Domo roll and the fish tacos. 

firecracker roll was BOMB.  perfect amount of sauce, crunch and yumminess.

The fish tacos were SO FREAKIN GOOD. Would not have ordered these if we didn't see the table next to us drooling over theirs, and SO glad we did.  the fish was ridiculously good, and the salsa they used, along with the little fluffy chip thing it was on was DELICIOUUUSSSSS. I was tempted to just order more of these.

Domo roll was a-OK. The roll kept falling apart and didn't taste any different from your average baked roll at another spot. I would definitely skip this next time, but either way I'm definitely coming back for the above two items.

excerpts: Ordered the sashimi platter, their house domo roll and the miso soup.
Not too expensive and the sashimi/rolls were generous cuts.
Prepare to wait (can't call ahead) since it's a smaller place.
domo roll.author: Sean P.
domo roll.review: Real solid sushi joint - definitely will go back. Ordered the sashimi platter, their house domo roll and the miso soup. Not too expensive and the sashimi/rolls were generous cuts.  Prepare to wait (can't call ahead) since it's a smaller place.

excerpts: My favorite roll was the domo roll.
The poke was refreshing.
The crudos were wonder.
We just had an awesome time.
domo roll.author: Natalie L.
domo roll.review: Fantastic! Perfectly satisfied my SF sushi craving. I am still thinking about the firecracker balls. We arrived at around 5:30 on a Wednesday and had our pick of where to sit. By the time we left at 7:30, there was a wait. Everything we had was great. Service was wonderful. My favorite roll was the domo roll. The poke was refreshing. The crudos were wonder. We just had an awesome time.

excerpts: The Domo roll was very tasty as well if you like warm sushi.
domo roll.author: Tori Q.
domo roll.review:
I am definitely a fan of this tiny sushi joint.  I am a big fan of sushi rolls (my favorite being Sushi House in Alameda) and this place lives quite up to the hype.  The rolls are a lot less heavy than Sushi House but it's quite good.  

You need to try the Spicy Hulk because it's unlike any sushi roll I've ever tried.  It's spicy tuna wrapped in a cucumber sheet!  It taste so healthy and yet so good!  The Domo roll was very tasty as well if you like warm sushi.  You always gotta try the rolls named after the restaurant, after all.  

The venue is quite small with only bar seating surrounding the insides of the restaurant and one table inside.  There are three tables outside but no one would sit there on a cold SF night.  I can see this place getting busy real fast on the weekends so I recommend going on a week night where there's less traffic.

excerpts: from there the domo roll took a little long to get out
but then again it was cooked
domo roll.author: Ashley H.
domo roll.review:
Ok Domo is hella bomb!
Went here last night and cant wait to go again. This place is SUPER small. So its great for a date. All the seats are bar style around the window and counter. I'm guessing maybe 14 people can fit in here at one time...max. the atmoshpere is energetic but quiet because there are a lot of people in  small space. the service is good too. we sat down less than 5 minuets afer walking in and sat in a little edge on the wall. i think we were both blocking someones  chair but nobody was going any where and we would have gladly moved for someone to exit.  the timing is a little off but the food made up for it. we got our edamame right before the first roll so we didnt have time to enjoy it before we dug into the main event. from there the domo roll took a little long to get out but then again it was cooked may have needed a little more love than the other rolls. 

We ordered the Temptation, Domo, Kobe Beef, and Chef's choice Sashimi

Temptation: everything i always want in one roll!!! i love it! it was pretty small. about 6 pieces but it was delicious!

Sashimi: well it was fresh and it was good but there were only two pieces of each type of fish so it wasnt very satisfying. and i have had fresher sashimi before but that doesnt mean theres wasnt spot on good. 

Domo: Took a little longer to come out. Just the right amount of spicey mayo. I love the baked rolls and the presentation was the best ive probably seen in a baked roll.
 
Kobe Beef:  while everything was super great and yummy we werent quite full yet so we decided to order one more roll. No rice, just steak. Thats just about as americanized sushi can get. it was soo good but i doubt i would get it again. it was nice to try.

overall a great experience.

excerpts: has a bit too much lemon zest but still very good and the domo roll (baked salmon roll) - interesting item
domo roll.author: Bhavin M.
domo roll.review:
Food was awesome.  The place is a bit small - however they do a good job of moving people through well.  

We had a spicy hulk (spicy tuna) - which was very light (no rice) and super fresh - highly recommend it, sexy mama (salmon) - has a bit too much lemon zest but still very good and the domo roll (baked salmon roll) - interesting item, however the sauce was a bit too sweet - preference would be too be light on the sauce.  

Definitely - a must go for the sushi yelpers!

excerpts: If you like rolls, try their Domo roll or Hulk roll...
Albacore tataki was also very tasty, tuna tartar was delicious, and their hamachi kama was so good
domo roll.author: tiannaaah J.
domo roll.review:
My favorite sushi spot in the city!!! The place is tiny and parking is a little hard to find, but Domo's like a jewel box!!! I've had sushi all over the bay from traditional to innovative, and Domo definitely high up there on the innovative side =)

If you want good sushi, you need fresh ingredients, especially fish, and Domo's definitely got that down. A lot of "trying to be innovative" sushi joints I've been to that has 100's of rolls on their menu tend to use too much mayo and sriracha and whatever sauce to cover-up their cheap, not so fresh, low quality fish. But all the sashimi I tasted here were so fresh it's comparable or even better than those high-end Japanese places like Sakae and Sushi Tomi people rave about...  The uni was so sweet and the toro melted in my mouth... everything was just so fresh! 

If you like rolls, try their Domo roll or Hulk roll... Albacore tataki was also very tasty, tuna tartar was delicious, and their hamachi kama was so good I wanted to order one all for myself. 

They also have a great selection of sake and very friendly waiters and sushi chefs =) I'll definitely be back here over and over!

excerpts: Very small place, perfect for 2 people - order the Fish Tacos and the Domo Roll!
domo roll.author: Sara B.
domo roll.review: Very small place, perfect for 2 people - order the Fish Tacos and the Domo Roll!

excerpts: The Domo roll is hot and sooooooo yummy.
It's like melt-in-your-mouth goodness.
The Kobe also had great flavor and I've definitely never seen beef in a sushi roll
domo roll.author: Emilia S.
domo roll.review:
I've been wanting a chance to fairly update my review for a while and a dinner date with the bf last weekend presented the perfect opportunity.

Domo is teeny tiny but as they say, good things come in small packages. A good trick to avoid waiting for 30minutes is to call as you're heading out and ask for your name to be put on the list; it's not a reservation but they will gladly do it and by the time you arrive, you only have a few minutes to wait. This time, we were seated upon arrival.

The food is fantastic, as I've said. This time we had the Kobe beef roll, the IC, and Domo, the Shiitake (only place that does this really well) and soup and edamame. The IC was a special roll and I believe last time we ordered a special too, so I would suggest checking out the list on the mirror. The Domo roll is hot and sooooooo yummy. It's like melt-in-your-mouth goodness. The Kobe also had great flavor and I've definitely never seen beef in a sushi roll but it was wonderful. 

I mean seriously, this place is really really good. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a date spot or dinner with a friend. The seating makes it difficult for any more than 2 people really, but the bar style does provide for a sense of intimacy that works like magic for a romantic date.

excerpts:
- domo roll: satisfying! 
when you're craving something filling, this hits the spot.
- spider roll: meh, it was okay.
domo roll.author: T L.
domo roll.review:
Let me tell you, I was skeptical.

Right off the bat, we ordered a large hot sake and there was a small dead spider in one of the cups. But they were so nice about it and gave us an extra free large sake.

A friend took us here, telling us its his favorite sushi spot. I already have my favorite down (Koo) but Domo made quite an impression!

The ambiance is extremely intimate - not great for any group with more than 3 people. Besides, the restaurant itself is super small.

We ordered:
- crudos: uni x ankimo - uni sashimi & ankimo, each on a single spoon. Simple and delicious. We had 2 pairs of this :)
- 2 amaebi: the fried heads were very lightly, LIGHTLY fried. Still very good but I wish they fried it more!
- 2 uni
- 1 sake
- spicy hulk: SO GOOD!! Pretty small "roll" but each bite was super tangy and spicy. Loved the ponzu sauce mix!
- domo roll: satisfying! when you're craving something filling, this hits the spot.
- spider roll: meh, it was okay.
- large, hot sake

Yes, the portions are pretty small.
Yes, the owner's Chinese.
Yes, it's priced a little exorbitantly (due to its location).
Yes, there was a small dead spider in one of our sake cups, but they handled it quite well and we could have probably gotten it comped.

This place was really cute, and the food was pretty good - rolls and sushi. Everything tasted refreshing and delicious, except the spider roll (my bf orders that, not me!) and that other spider, but all in all, I really liked Domo.

The ambiance was perfect (so intimate!) and the food wasn't bad either -- highly recommend the spicy hulk! Prices to portions, it's not the best but hey, what sushi place is cheap!!?

excerpts: My recommendations are the domo roll, sexy mama, and fire cracker ball.
The small crudos are awesome too!
domo roll.author: Jeanne L.
domo roll.review:
The various rolls that I had were all amazing with great flavor. The presenation of each dish was a work of art. The service was good and although the place is small, the ambience was nice. I will definately have to come back and try the other items, especially the special deals.

My recommendations are the domo roll, sexy mama, and fire cracker ball. The small crudos are awesome too!

excerpts: We ordered the Domo Roll and the Crunchy Spicy Tuna... both were baked and super yummy.

A little on the heavy side (since they're covered in mayonnaise based sauces) so I would recommend balancing with a normal roll...
Good beer selection too!
Not just Sapporo and Asahi but a couple others I hadn't tried before.
Only downside is the place is tiny
so I'm sure there is quite a wait sometimes.
domo roll.author: Alisa M.
domo roll.review:
I went here last Saturday on a date with my honey.
The sushi was spectacular!  Very fresh and they are really creative with the ingredients and presentation.
We ordered the Domo Roll and the Crunchy Spicy Tuna... both were baked and super yummy.  A little on the heavy side (since they're covered in mayonnaise based sauces) so I would recommend balancing with a normal roll...
Good beer selection too!  Not just Sapporo and Asahi but a couple others I hadn't tried before.
Only downside is the place is tiny so I'm sure there is quite a wait sometimes.

excerpts: The Domo roll was just...it was amazing.
I've had a lot of sushi in my days, and this place is right up there with the best of them.
It's since become one of my/my boyfriend's go-to take out places.
Oh man, I want it now.
This is why I don't do reviews often, I just get hungry and want to eat at every good place I've ever been simultaneously.
domo roll.author: Amy S.
domo roll.review: Some friends came in from out of town and they demanded sushi. I'd heard rumors from several friends about the lack of decent sushi in SF, even in areas like J-town. Domo is pretty close to where I live, so we settled on going there. It's pretty tiny and therefore not many people can eat there, but we were there around 9:30 so we got a table for four right away. This sushi was so. good. The Domo roll was just...it was amazing. I've had a lot of sushi in my days, and this place is right up there with the best of them. It's since become one of my/my boyfriend's go-to take out places. Oh man, I want it now. This is why I don't do reviews often, I just get hungry and want to eat at every good place I've ever been simultaneously.

excerpts: I got their fire cracker balls and domo roll, which were good, but a little overdone in terms of sauce and such for me.
domo roll.author: Kristine B.
domo roll.review:
It is a solid sushi joint.  I would come here again, just not anytime soon given the plethora of sushi options in the city that I would like to try first.  

Bf got a $60 omakaze which was fresh, delicious and creative.  Def got $60 or more worth of deliciousness.

I got their fire cracker balls and domo roll, which were good, but a little overdone in terms of sauce and such for me.  I prefer the more simple maki sushi.

When I come back, I'll be ordering the omakaze.  Skip the overly ornate maki sushi and order the more simple things in life.

excerpts: My favorites are: domo roll, the spicy hulk, fish tacos, and this yummy potato appetizer-y thing (but I don't know what the name of it is).
domo roll.author: Radha S.
domo roll.review:
I can't believe I've lived in Hayes Valley for 6 months, right down the street from Domo, and it took my friend from Italy to show me this place. I'm downright disappointed in myself!

My favorites are: domo roll, the spicy hulk, fish tacos, and this yummy potato appetizer-y thing (but I don't know what the name of it is).

I've only eaten here on two occasions, both at lunch time. All the other times I've gotten takeout. 

My staff is super friendly and attentive. The only two concerns are that the place is very small, so not the best place to go if you want to have a meal where you can talk (it's only side-by-side seating), and definitely not for a group of more than 2 people. Also, the sushi is a little pricy (I think it's 13 bucks for the domo), so I don't get to come here as often as I would like, but I think the prices are a little pricier than other places because the fish they use is very fresh.

excerpts: i've also had the opportunity to try to domo roll with friends, while delicious, i always tend to go for the mercury laden tuna in my rolls.
domo roll.author: Boho H.
domo roll.review:
I just returned from Domo after my second visit.  Definitely a sushi place that prides itself and knowing its fare and keeping their customer happy.  They are driven to please you, whatever you want, you can have...but some say otherwise. So I'm not sure how open they are to suggestions (what you don't like, or; what you do like) and having them create something special for you.  However, the service is always great, the atmosphere is serene for a date or with a couple friends (this place is TINY, so not good for more than 2 people).

i highly suggest ordering the butter fish sashimi which is not on the paper menu, but you'll find it on the hard-to-read mirror menu on the northern wall of the restaurant.  it is one of the few sushi places (that I know) whic carry this fish and the only place I will order it.  always a slight cool and definitely fresh, i sometimes have three orders.

as for their rolls, always go from the cucumber wrapped spicy tuna (Spicy Hulk) and the soy sauce they use just makes it much more enjoyable and my brother's favorite; the (light) deep fried firecracker balls.  they are always an order for me each time i go, so good and bite size.  i've also had the opportunity to try to domo roll with friends, while delicious, i always tend to go for the mercury laden tuna in my rolls.  i'll never learn (maybe when my fingers begin to curl into my palms) then I'll learn.

the ambiance is always on the quite side since it is a smaller venue, the lighting always dim and the seating mostly bar or window bar with one lone table that seats up to four guests makes it a perfect evening with friends yet you can still feel intimate with your date (however, one time I heard the depressive story of a girl and I wanted to tell her to shut up).

excerpts: My date had the Domo roll (baked California roll with salmon on top and spicy mayo) and it was also delish.
domo roll.author: Theresa T.
domo roll.review:
Domo is located in the perfect area nestled between cafes and boutiques in Hayes Valley. The sushi is good and the menu may not be long, but it is impressive. They don't take reservations and if you are not in a hurry it is worth the wait to sit at the window.  

Starters are super affordable and executed very well. The edammame (a staple of mine) was perfect and the seaweed salad was good. At $3.50 each you must try a few. After starters don't skip the small crudos section. You can pick 2 types of seafood and they come out on individual spoons with wasabi and avocado. Fresh and spicy! 

Sushi is what they are best at. First, I really like that even if you are ordering 2+ rolls they come out on separate dishes. It really bugs me when sushi places plate 4 rolls together. We don't have to share if we don't want to ha! The veggie roll was great with cucumbers and asparagus. My date had the Domo roll (baked California roll with salmon on top and spicy mayo) and it was also delish. 

Edammame, seaweed salad, two rolls, 3 Sapporos = $56.00. Domo is deff worth checking out and I will be back.

excerpts: We both wanted the Domo Roll (baked california roll topped with salmon & scallops with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, tobiko & scallions).
domo roll.author: Jason B.
domo roll.review:
She wanted the Fire Cracker Balls (spicy tuna roll with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, scallions & tobiko).

He wanted the Sexy Mama (asparagus, tobiko topped with sliced lemon & salmon, yuzu cucumber). 

We both wanted the Domo Roll (baked california roll topped with salmon & scallops with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, tobiko & scallions).

Everything was absolutely delicious, and I'm still thinking about the brilliant pop of lemon in the Sexy Mama.

Equally impressive was the Kobe beef roll. We didn't actually order it, but watched in awe as the chef cooked the beef with a propane torch. It was so very, very awesome, and so very, very on our items to order next time.

Service and decor were the perfect mix of friendly, inviting, warm, modern, subtle, sophisticated. All comes without breaking the bank - a reasonable bill became a steal after learning the salad and edamame were on the house. 

Go and enjoy.

excerpts: The domo roll is out of control.
Always packed so get there early for dinner..
domo roll.author: Alder H.
domo roll.review: one of the best sushi spots you will find in the city. The domo roll is out of control. Always packed so get there early for dinner..

excerpts: We ordered 2 of the uni crudos, domo roll, hamachi kama, and one of the special rolls.
I thought the uni crudo was just okay.
I don't think I'd order it again next time I go.
However, I loved the rolls and hamachi kama.
I would love to check out the lunch menu sometime.
$12 for fresh delicious sushi.
I'm in!
domo roll.author: Vicky C.
domo roll.review: I checked this spot out on a Monday night with my girlfriend.  We didn't have to wait because we just beat the crowd as we arrived around 6ish 7.  We ordered 2 of the uni crudos, domo roll, hamachi kama, and one of the special rolls.  I thought the uni crudo was just okay.  I don't think I'd order it again next time I go.  However, I loved the rolls and hamachi kama.  I would love to check out the lunch menu sometime.  $12 for fresh delicious sushi.  I'm in!  :)

excerpts:
- Firecracker balls: hot tuna crusted with panko breadcrumbs: a whole lot of deep fried goodness
- Domo Roll: Usually not a fan of baked rolls, but this restaurant namesake roll hit the mark!
domo roll.author: Aditi K.
domo roll.review:
Intimate place, not more than 20 seats: all along the walls/windows & bar. We sat at the bar, and it was an great experience watching the chefs & servers working efficiently in what seemed like 50 sq. ft :)

- Firecracker balls: hot tuna crusted with panko breadcrumbs: a whole lot of deep fried goodness
- Domo Roll: Usually not a fan of baked rolls, but this restaurant namesake roll hit the mark!

excerpts: Domo roll (which is tasty but does kinda fall apart) and the crunchy California roll are special- the dragon roll is the best I've ever had.
domo roll.author: Trisha F.
domo roll.review:
I AM OBSESSED WITH DOMO!  

My guy and I went about a month ago for the first time, and we were in heaven!

As everyone here has mentioned, you must try the firecracker balls- they make your mouth come alive!  Domo roll (which is tasty but does kinda fall apart) and the crunchy California roll are special- the dragon roll is the best I've ever had.  Fully satisfied, we started plotting our return.

Two weeks later we decide to bring a couple with us.  We got there just in time to snag the single table.   The daikon salad was savory and an excellent starter.  Then the owner Kuohwa and the waiter recommended some rolls for us- and the fatty tuni nigiri.  WOW.  Each dish presented to us was sampled, and we'd break out in applause.  It was that good.  It didn't hurt that we had some delicious unfiltered sake flowing at the table!  Our friends Heidi A  and Glenn C said it was the best sushi experience they've ever had!

We had to go again.

A couple of weeks later, we had something to celebrate- my guy had gotten a promotion, so we decided to go to one of our two fave restaraunts: you guessed it, Domo.  What followed is an experience every sushi lover should have: I HIGHLY recommend it.  After greeting us  back effusively, Kuohwa asked if he could order for us.  

Seriously, if you have never tried this before: indulge, at least once in your life. 

Crudos: monkfish pate and seared scallops.  Both melt in  your mouth.  Probably my favorite.  Tataki- asparagus wrapped in slightly seared Kobe Beef.  Spicy Hulk roll.  Fish tacos (even better than Umami- really).  The only thing that I wouldn't have again was the deep-fried Spanish Mackeral skeleton- but it was an experience and I'm glad I tried it! 

Kuohwha knows his sushi.  Yes I wish it was bigger- but give them time! They've been here less than a year.  I cannot wait to go back.

Best sushi EVER.

excerpts: we had the seaweed salad, the domo roll, the salmon skin, the fire cracker balls (not as spicy as you'd think, which is a good thing), the kobe beef, and one more that i can't remember.
all tasted incredibly fresh (i don't know sushi very well, but you could just tell).
the main reason i'm not giving it five stars is that there was a slight overwhelming taste to everything.
for most of the dishes, it was salty.
for one of the rolls (again, forgot which :( ), it was too cilantro-y.
domo roll.author: Jonathan K.
domo roll.review:
one of the best sushi places i've been to -- and also one of the smallest (the bathroom is almost the same size as the restaurant). all bar seating (either at the sushi bar or facing the plate glass window that looks out onto the street.)

came here with a friend who had passed by but never been, and well, that was my first time really in hayes valley (what a cute area!). they have a good variety of rolls (nearing the point of overwhelming, but only because they all sound so good!) and they are priced well for the portion size you get. 

we had the seaweed salad, the domo roll, the salmon skin, the fire cracker balls (not as spicy as you'd think, which is a good thing), the kobe beef, and one more that i can't remember. all tasted incredibly fresh (i don't know sushi very well, but you could just tell). the main reason i'm not giving it five stars is that there was a slight overwhelming taste to everything. for most of the dishes, it was salty. for one of the rolls (again, forgot which :( ), it was too cilantro-y. i'm thinking it was just me, though, as just thinking about these again, i'm salivating (and not because i'm imagining salt!).

that said, however, i would gladly go again -- and go out of my way to go again. service was excellent (maybe because we got there at 5:30) and fast. very cute, warm space.

excerpts: Firecracker Balls live up to their hype, Domo Roll was dank, and the Spicy Hulk was a keeper as well.
They have changing "specials" of which were all pretty good.
I added Jalapenos to a "Dragon Domo" roll they have, and the chefs appreciated my recommendation...so
next time I'm expecting to see the Matt's Dragon Domo Roll gracing the menu!
Arigato!
domo roll.author: Matt D.
domo roll.review: Mmhmm, beer at Suppenkuche and then stroll down the street to this teency weency sushi bar for some scrumptious sushi. Firecracker Balls live up to their hype, Domo Roll was dank, and the Spicy Hulk was a keeper as well. They have changing "specials" of which were all pretty good. I added Jalapenos to a "Dragon Domo" roll they have, and the chefs appreciated my recommendation...so next time I'm expecting to see the Matt's Dragon Domo Roll gracing the menu! Arigato!

excerpts: Once we were seated, we ordered the sashimi combination and a couple rolls, including their signature Domo roll.
Everything was fresh, delicious, and QUICK!
They already seemed to figure out how to maximize profits by shuffling customers in and out.
I couldn't find a single thing wrong with my experience so congratulations,
Domo, five stars!
domo roll.author: Susan L.
domo roll.review: Great new addition to Hayes Valley! For such a tiny place, it delivered in a big way. It did a great job of maximizing their limited space by having mostly counter seating, one row in front of the window and one row at the sushi bar. They also added a couple small tables outside. I popped in here with a friend on a random weekday and they had a short waitlist. We grabbed a couple chairs outside and we were immediately greeted by a waiter asking if we'd like a glass of wine or beer while we waited. Way to show their A-game! Once we were seated, we ordered the sashimi combination and a couple rolls, including their signature Domo roll. Everything was fresh, delicious, and QUICK! They already seemed to figure out how to maximize profits by shuffling customers in and out. I couldn't find a single thing wrong with my experience so congratulations, Domo, five stars!

excerpts: Love the Domo Roll, the Spicy Hulk, and the Crudos.
The restaurant is tiny and the seating isn't very spacious, but th great food and good service more than makes up for it.
domo roll.author: Vijay C.
domo roll.review: Love the Domo Roll, the Spicy Hulk, and the Crudos. The restaurant is tiny and the seating isn't very spacious, but th great food and good service more than makes up for it.

excerpts: The spicy tuna roll was good, but I will say their signature roll (think it was called the domo roll) was a bit of a disappointment...
it's actually baked and the rice stuck to the tin foil.
Creative and yummy but not too easy to eat.
domo roll.author: Eric C.
domo roll.review: I've been on this sushi rampage lately and tried this place for lunch a few weeks ago.  Awesome sashimi, fresh and tasty.  Ate outside on a sunny afternoon which added to the whole experience.  There are no tables inside, just sushi bar and counter eating, so not a date place.  The spicy tuna roll was good, but I will say their signature roll (think it was called the domo roll) was a bit of a disappointment...it's actually baked and the rice stuck to the tin foil.  Creative and yummy but not too easy to eat.

excerpts: The domo roll reminds me of the hot mama at naked fish - but fresher, better sauce, and more crab and salmon.

The more traditional options are equally satisfying - the hamachi belly melted perfectly in my mouth and tasted fabulous with both scallions in the negi-hama roll and with jalapenos in the hamachi-jalapeno roll.
domo roll.author: Casey M.
domo roll.review:
Ever since Naked Fish changed management, I've been looking for a staple  sushi joint.  Although not in my neighborhood, I'll make the trek to Hayes Valley any day to eat at Domo.

Firecracker balls?  Perfect.  Filled with tuna, not over fried, and unagi glaze/spicy mayo sauce combo truly dances on your taste buds.  The domo roll reminds me of the hot mama at naked fish - but fresher, better sauce, and more crab and salmon.  The more traditional options are equally satisfying - the hamachi belly melted perfectly in my mouth and tasted fabulous with both scallions in the negi-hama roll and with jalapenos in the hamachi-jalapeno roll.  Fresh, generous fish portions, and just perfectly executed.

The place is tiny, but get a seat at the bar overlooking Laguna and you'll have a fabulous time admiring the cute up-coming neighborhood and people watching.  I wish I lived down the block, it's truly the essence of your neighborhood sushi joint.

And if that wasn't enough...  4 rolls, edamame, 2 beers, and a tea = $50.  Done and done.

excerpts: firecracker balls, domo roll,
etc.
I found everything to be average, not outstanding.
They definitely was pushing the various rolls.
Had a few sushi, such as Hamachi and albacore tuna.

They were fresh, but not very generous slices ,  
My summation is that it is more of an
"Americanized" sushi restaurants.
Go there if you don't mind difficult parking, a cramp restaurant
and if you are primarily interested in funky rolls.
Price is average.
domo roll.author: jason l.
domo roll.review:
ate there with my toddler.  definitely not kid/family friendly place because the place is small and cramp and have to sit at counter-top
which not the most comfortable if you want to relax or have a bad back.  Asked the waitress what she recommended and it was pretty much what has been yelped about........firecracker balls, domo roll, etc.   I found everything to be average, not outstanding.  They definitely was pushing the various rolls.  Had a few sushi, such as Hamachi and albacore tuna.  They were fresh, but not very generous slices ,  
My summation is that it is more of an  "Americanized" sushi restaurants.  Go there if you don't mind difficult parking, a cramp restaurant and if you are primarily interested in funky rolls.  Price is average.
